loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Carlos con 41 años de edad,de estado civil casado, vive en casa propia de material rústico ,junto con su cónyuge y tres hijos, en el distrito de Santo Tomás,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. Carlos cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en la mayoría a la agricultura, ganadería , cultivo de maíz, cultivo de productos de pan llevar y a la cría de animales menores.

Carlos se dedica a la agricultura, especificamente al cultivo de café,de la variedad Catimor,con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace 4 años, cultivo se desarrolla en terreno propio en el sector la Muyuna del Caserío Viza. Así mismo dedicado a la cría-engorde de ganado vacuno, actividad que realiza hace 10 años, cuenta con terreno de invernas propio en Sector la Muna del Caserio Viza .Adicionalmente cultiva maíz amarillo criollo duro, cuenta con 2 has. Para cosechar producto, cultiva productos de pan llevar (yuca, vitucas, menestras, frutas y otros) y cría de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes y cerdos), tiene una familia unida que se esfuerza por tener una mejor calidad de vida. Se solicita préstamo para el mantenimiento de parcela agrícola, asegurando una buena producción de su cosecha en beneficios de su familia.

Carlos es socio recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Carlos is 41 years old, married, and lives with his wife and their three children in a home of rustic materials in the Santo Tomás district, Cutervo province, department of Cajamarca, Peru. Carlos has very good personal and work references among the residents of the region. The people of this village are engaged mostly in agriculture, livestock, the cultivation of corn and basic food crops, and small livestock.

Carlos works in agriculture, specifically the cultivation of the Catimore variety of coffee, with 4 years’ experience in this line of work. His crop is grown on his own land in the
Muyuna del Caserío Viza sector. He also raises and fattens cattle, an occupation he has worked in for 10 years. He has his own pasture land in the Muyuna del Caserío Viza sector.

Additionally he grows hard yellow Creole corn; he has 2 hectares. In order to harvest products, he grows basic food crops (cassava, taro, beans, fruits and others) and he breeds small animals (chickens, guinea pigs, and pigs). He has a close family that strives to have a better quality of life. He is requesting a loan for the maintenance of agricultural land, ensuring a good harvest that will benefit his family.

Carlos is a recurrent member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: in the maintenance of agricultural land.

loans.name: Bima  Yawavi

texts.fr: Mère de cinq enfants, Bima est une femme mariée âgée de 48 ans résidant à Agoè. Bima  prépare et vend de la boisson locale appelé « Tchoukoudou » faite à base du mil. Bima s’approvisionne du nécessaire trois fois par mois au marché. Pour commander des sacs de mil, Bima demande ce prêt pour financer son achat ; ce qui lui permet d’augmenter sa quantité de marchandises, éviter les ruptures ; de fidéliser ses clients et avoir plus de bénéfices pour participer aux charges de son foyer puis aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Bima is 48 years old, married, and the mother of five children. She lives in Agoè where she makes and sells a local drink called "Tchoukoudou," which is made from millet.

Bima procures her ingredients three times a month from the market.

She is seeking this loan to finance a purchase of sacs of millet, which will allow her to increase her quantity of drinks, avoid gaps in her stock, attract loyal customers, and earn enough profits so that she can help to cover the household's expenses and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy three sacs of millet.

loans.name: Marie  Thérèse

texts.fr: Mère de quatre enfants, Marie Thérèse est une veuve femme âgée de 58 ans habitant à Agoè. Marie Thérèse est une marchande  de bouillie  préparée à base du maïs et accompagné des beignets qu’elle revend à la devanture de son domicile. Marie Thérèse s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au marché du nécessaire pour sa préparation et désire ce prêt pour réaliser ses achats des sacs de maïs et de farine de blé en vue de bien revendre puis de gagner une marge bénéficiaire assez importante pour inscrire ses enfants dans des écoles de bonne qualité.
texts.en:
Marie Thérèse is 58 years old, a widow, and the mother of four children. She lives in Agoè where she sells bouillie [corn porridge] and beignets from the front of her home.

Marie Thérèse procures ingrédients three times a month from the market.

She is seeking this loan so that she can buy sacs of corn and wheat flour. She hopes to have good sales so that she can earn enough profits to enroll her children in high-quality schools.

loans.use: to buy three sacs of corn and two sacs of wheat flour.

loans.name: Ubuzima Group

texts.fr: Mugongo est commerçante, présidente du groupe solidaire «Ubuzima», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée à un menuisier, âgée de 37 ans, mère de 9 enfants dont 6 scolarisés et 3 sont encore petits. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires au marché du centre commercial depuis 16 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 20 sacs d’haricots. Elle commença son business avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite augmenter son capital et scolariser ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Mugongo is a merchant, a member of the micro-finance institution Hekima, and the president of the business group "Ubuzima." She is 37 years old and married to a carpenter. She has nine children, of whom six are in school and three are still very young.

Mugongo has worked selling basic foodstuffs from the central market for 16 years. She started this business with funds that she received from her husband.

[With this loan], she is going to procure 20 sacs of beans.

Mugongo wishes to increase her capital and educate her children.

Finally, she thanks Hekima for their support of entrepreneurs who lack access to traditional banking services.

loans.use: to buy 20 sacs of beans.

loans.name: Nakorpo

texts.fr: Veuve, Nakorpo est femme de 47 ans qui vit avec ses deux enfants à charge à Agoè. Pour vivre et venir en aide aux besoins de ses enfants, Nakorpo prépare et vend de la boisson locale alcoolisée appelée « Tchoukoudou» à la devanture de son domicile. Nakorpo s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché et réalise une bonne marge bénéficiaire grâce ce commerce. Nakorpo désire ce crédit pour commander des sacs de mil en vue de mieux vendre puis de maximiser son profit afin d’aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire et à leurs besoins quotidiens.
texts.en:
Nakorpo is 47 years old, a widow, and lives with her two dependent children in Agoè. To make a living and to be able to support her children's needs, she makes and sells a local alcoholic drink called "Tchoukoudou" from the front of her home.

Nakorpo procures ingredients four times a month from the market. She makes good profits thanks to this business.

Nakorpo seeks this loan to make an order for sacs of millet. She hopes to make good sales and maximize her profits, so that she can support her children's education and their daily needs.

loans.use: to buy four sacs of millet.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Ama est une veuve femme  âgée de 52 ans qui vit à Agoè. Mère de deux enfants, Ama est une marchande de friperies  qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à domicile et en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Ama demande ce prêt pour commander des balles de friperies en vue de bien revendre puis de gagner des bénéfices et pouvoir aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en:
Ama is 52 years old, a widow, and the mother of two children. She lives in Agoè where she sells used clothing that she procures twice a month from the market.

She makes her sales from her home and by traveling around to the surrounding neighborhoods.

Ama is seeking this loan to make an order for bales of used clothing. She hopes to make good sales and earn profits, so that she can support her children's education.

loans.use: to buy four bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Adjo Celestine

texts.fr: Mère  de trois enfants, Adjo est une femme mariée résidant à Agoè. Agée de 42 ans, Adjo produit des gâteaux faite à base de la farine de blé. Adjo s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend  à la devanture de son domicile puis dans les quartiers environnant. Adjo sollicite ce crédit pour commander des sacs de farine de blé en vue de bien satisfaire les attentes des clients puis gagner des bénéfices qui lui permettre de soutenir son mari à bien s’occuper de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Adjo is 42 years old, married, and the mother of three children. She lives in Agoè where she makes cakes made from wheat flour.

Adjo procures [ingredients] twice a month from the market and makes her resales from the front of her home and in the surrounding neighborhoods.

Adjo is seeking this loan to make an order for sacs of wheat flour.

She hopes to be able to satisfy her customers' needs and earn profits that will allow her to support her husband take care of their children.

loans.use: to buy two sacs of wheat flour.

loans.name: Yenifer

texts.es:
Yenifer está estudiando la carrera de análisis de sistemas, tiene como meta poder tener un negocio propio en su ciudad, y de esa forma poder ayudar a las demás personas.
Ella es una persona que se esfuerza por poder salir adelante y ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios, esforzándose por crecer y mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
Yenifer is studying systems analysis. Her goal is to be able to open her own business in her city, and in this way help other people.

She is a person who strives to get ahead and help her loved ones.

She is asking for this loan to pay for college tuition so she can continue with her education, working hard to grow and improve every day.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition.

loans.name: Jose Lainis

texts.es:
José Lainis con 19 años de edad, vive en casa familiar, de material rústico, junto a sus padres, en el distrito de Santo Tomás,provincia de Cutervo,departamento de Cajamarca,país Perú. El cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona. Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

José Lainis se dedica a la cría, engorde y venta de ganado vacuno, contando a la fecha con 4 cabezas de ganado vacuno; dicha actividad la realiza en el Caserío de Palma Central del distrito de Santo Tomas , actividad la realiza hace 3 años. Así mismo se dedica a la cría y venta de animales menores (gallinas, cuyes). Adicionalmente se dedica al cultivo de productos de pan llevar (yuca, plátano, vituca) siendo estos últimos para su consumo y en ocaciones para la venta. El destino del crédito sera para la compra de ganado vacuno ( 2 novillas) para luego engordarlo y venderlo a un mejor precio para obtener un mayor volumen de ventas y por ende tener mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

Jose Lainis es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
José Lainis is 19-years old. He lives in his family's house made of rustic material, with his parents, in the district of Santo Tomás, Cutervo province, and department of Cajamarca in Peru. He has very good personal and work references from the people in the area. The people who live here mainly work in agriculture, business and livestock.

José Lainis works raising, fattening and selling cattle. At the moment he has 4 heads of cattle. He does this work in the Caserío de Palma Central in the district of Santo Tomás and has done it for 3 years. At the same time, he raises and sells small animals (chickens, guinea pigs). Additionally, he works growing bread products (yucca, plantain, taro root) of which the last two are for eating and on occasions to sell.

The loan will be used to buy cattle (2 heifers) to fatten and then sell at a better price to get a larger volume of sales. Thus, he will have better earnings to be able to improve his quality of life.

Jose Lainis is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy cattle (2 heifers) to fatten and then sell at a better price to get a larger volume of sales.

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Laura es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, está estudiando la carrera de gestión pública, por medio de su carrera quiere abrirse camino y poder convertirse en una buena profesional.
Comenta que está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder lograr su meta, y a través de ella también poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad, lo que le ayudará a seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Laura is from the city of Carapeguá. She is studying public management. With her major, she wants to make her way and have a great career.

She remarks that she is working as hard as she can to achieve her goal, and through her goal. also be able to help her family.

She is asking for this loan to pay for college tuition, which will help her continue with her education.

loans.use: to pay for college tuition.

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter está estudiando la carrera de hotelería y turismo, quiere graduarse de licenciado y algún día tener su propio alojamiento turístico.
Él es una persona muy dedicada a sus estudios, ve una gran oportunidad en su carrera ya que el turismo en el país va mejorando.
Pide este préstamo para poder cubrir los gastos de su titulación, de manera a llegar a buen término su carrera.
texts.en:
Walter is studying hotel management and tourism. He wants to get his college degree and one day open his own tourism lodgings.

He is a person who is very dedicated to his education. He sees a great opportunity in his major. since tourism in his country is improving.

He is asking for this loan to cover expenses related to getting his degree, so that he can finish his major.

loans.use: to pay costs related to getting his degree.

loans.name: Liza

texts.es:
Liza es una joven estudiante, es de la ciudad de Santaní, es soltera, vive con su mamá, es una persona  muy dedicada al estudio, desea sobresalir adelante profesionalmente a través de los logros obtenidos por medio de su carrera de enfermera.
Su meta es de tener su título y poder trabajar en una institución pública, enseñar en las Universidades así ayudar a los jóvenes.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar sus materiales de estudios para poder continuar la carrera.
texts.en:
Liza is a young student, from the city of Santaní. She is single, lives with her mother and is a person who is very dedicated to her studies. In the future, she wants to stand out professionally through her achievements in her career of nursing.

Her goal is to have her degree and be able to work in a public institution and teach in the universities so to help the young people.

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase school supplies to be able to continue with her program.

loans.use: to purchase school supplies.

loans.name: Regina

texts.es:
Regina es estudiante de la carrera de Medicina, está haciendo su internado en un Hospital, su meta es terminar sus estudios, especializarse, ser médica ginecóloga y de esa manera poder ayudar a las personas.
La inspira la idea de poder ser útil a las personas que necesitan ayuda en algo tan importante como es la salud.
Pide este préstamo para cubrir las cuotas de su carrera, las cuales son muy costosas y quiere pagarlas por adelantado.
texts.en:
Regina is a medical student. She is doing her internship in a hospital. Her goal is to finish her studies, specialize, be a gynecologist and, in this way, be able to help people.

She is inspired by the idea of being useful to people who need help in something so important as health.

She asks for this loan to cover her program fees, which are very expensive and she wants to pay them up front.

loans.use: to pay program fees.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es:
Lucia está estudiando la carrera de psicología, ella trabaja como promotora en un supermercado, y de esa manera tiene los medios para poder cubrir los gastos de sus estudios.
Comenta que su propósito es poder abrir su propio consultorio en forma independiente, y poder ir capacitándose cada vez en la profesión.
Pide este préstamo para la poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Lucia is studying for a psychology degree. She works as a promoter in a supermarket and, in this way, she has the means to be able to cover her educational expenses.

She says that her goal is to open her own office, independently, and to be able to continue getting training once she is in her profession.

She asks for this loan to be able to pay the program fees and, in this way, be able to continue with her education as she has been doing.

loans.use: to pay program fees.

loans.name: Nilse

texts.es:
Nilse es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, estudia la carrera de contabilidad, comenta que es hija única y que sus padres siempre la han apoyado en todo, desde joven trabaja para poder cubrir también sus gastos de estudios.
Su sueño es poder tener su propio estudio contable para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en cubrir sus gastos de titulación, de manera a tener con que cubrir ese gasto grande.
texts.en:
Nilse is from the city of Coronel Oviedo, she is studying for an accounting degree. She says that she is an only child and that her parents have always supported her in everything. Since she was young, she has worked to be able to also cover her school expenses.

Her dream is to be able to have her own accounting firm to improve her living conditions.

She asks for this loan to be able to invest it in covering the costs of registering her degree, in this way to have the means to cover this large expense.

loans.use: to pay the expenses of registering her degree.

loans.name: Juan Alfredo

texts.es:
Juan es conocido por su emprendimiento y por su calidad de trabajo, desde hace más de dos años, este joven de tan solo 21 años de edad, tiene su venta de lubricantes y un taller de reparación de motos. El cual montó, luego de haber trabajado desde los trece años en un taller donde aprendió todo lo que sabe ahora, convirtiéndolo en un mecánico profesional. 
Con el apoyo de su padre y de su madre, Juan ha salido adelante a su corta edad. Ahora quiere innovar ofreciendo el servicio de reparación de motos a domicilio. Por lo que solicita un préstamo, para comprar una motocicleta para la movilización de estos trabajos de campo. Esto le permitirá atender ese sector de la población que no tiene como movilizarse para reparar motos y así generar mayores ingresos.  En sus planes está agrandar su negocio y trabajar con grandes empresas.
texts.en:
Juan is known for his business venture and for the quality of his work. For over two years, this young man, just 21 years old, has sold lubricants and has had a motorcycle repair shop. He established this after having worked since he was thirteen in a shop where he learned everything that he now knows, becoming a professional mechanic.

With the support of his father and of his mother, Juan has gotten ahead at his young age. Now he wants to innovate, offering motorcycle repair service house calls. For this, he asks for a loan to purchase a motorcycle to get to these jobs in the countryside. This will allow him to service this sector of the population that doesn't have a means to travel to repair motorcycles and, so, to generate more income. In his plans are to grow his business and work with large businesses.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Zamira

texts.ru: Замира, 42 года, замужем, мать 4 детей. У нее среднее образование. Также в качестве дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, Замира на сегодняшний день имеет 4 коровы. Также у нее есть 1,0 ГА собственной земельной доли, на которой выращивает кукурузу и пшеницу. Она в целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на сбор экологически-чистого урожая и обработку почвы. Доходы от кредита Замира планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Zamira is 42 years old, married, and has four children. She has secondary education. She also works in animal husbandry and field husbandry to bring in income for her family. Thanks to her persistent hard work, Zamira has four cows today, and also owns a 1.0 hectare plot of land, on which she cultivates corn and wheat. 

With the view of further developing her business, she has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) in order to produce environmentally friendly crops and cultivate her land. Zamira plans to invest the funds from the loan in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to cultivate her land and harvest eco-friendly corn and wheat.

loans.name: Menelio

texts.es:
Menelio está estudiando la carrea de contabilidad, comenta que se siente comprometido a convertirse en un buen profesional, y por medio de su carrera poder ayudar a las demás personas.
Es una persona dedicada a sus estudios, y pone todo de si para poder cumplir con sus metas y anhelos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar su matrícula, lo que le permitirá poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Menelio is studying accounting and says he feels committed to becoming a fine professional and to being able to help other people through his career. He is someone who is dedicated to his education and he gives it his all so he can reach his goals and desires.

He is asking for this loan to pay for his enrollment, which will allow him to continue studying like before.

loans.use: to pay college enrollment fees.

loans.name: Super Poderosas Group

texts.es:
Este es un grupo nuevo formado en la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando cada una por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra.  Liz, quien es una humilde peluquera, ella es una persona muy trabajadora que con mucho sacrificio está luchando para poder sacar adelante a su familia. Comenta que ha tenido que pasar por muchas dificultades, pero que las supera por sus seres queridos.
La Sra. Liz solicita de este préstamo para la compra de productos que necesita para su salón de belleza, como ser tintes, cremas, shampoo, enjuagues y otros, de manera a poder seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
This is a new group that was formed in the city of Coronel Oviedo. They are part of the poverty elimination program, and each member strives to improve her living conditions.

One of the members is Liz, who is a humble hairdresser. She is a very hard-working person who, with a great deal of sacrifice, is struggling so her family can get ahead. She mentions that she has had to come through great difficulties, but that she does it for her loved ones.

Liz is requesting this loan to buy the products she needs for her beauty salon, such as dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses and other items, so she can continue giving good service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy dyes, creams, shampoo, rinses and other supplies for use in a hair salon.

loans.name: Barrio Cruce Group

texts.es:
El grupo tiene 18 integrantes, ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, cada una está poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos. Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Teresa quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y por medio de la venta de frutas que hace se gana la vida.
Ella es una mujer trabajadora que pese a los inconvenientes ha podido mejorar y dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida, para todos sus seres queridos.
La Sra. Teresa solicita de este crédito para  comprar  de frutas y así poder vender más y generar más ingresos.
texts.en: The group has 18 members, all of whom are participating in the eliminating poverty programme. They all give their all to help their loved ones. One of the members is Teresa who earns her living through a great deal of effort and hard work and by selling fruit. She is a hardworking woman who, in spite of problems, has managed to improve and give all her loved ones a better quality of life. Teresa is applying for this loan to buy fruit, so that she can sell more and boost her income.

loans.use: to buy fresh fruit to sell.

loans.name: Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Kyrey, es un grupo nuevo, el cual está trabajando de manera unida para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos. Ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, cada una poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Faustina, quien se dedica a la venta de ropas de todo tipo, comenta que tiene una buena clientela que siempre compra de ella las prendas que vende. Faustina gracias a sus ventas tiene los medios para poder dar a sus seres queridos una vida digna y sin privaciones.
La Sra. Faustina cuenta con un salón de ventas y pide este préstamo para poder comprar más variedades de ropas y así mejorar la variedad de prendas que ofrece a sus clientes.
texts.en: The group is called Kyrey and it is a new group whose members are working cooperatively to improve their own living conditions and those of their loved ones. They are participating in the eliminating poverty programme and they are all giving their all to get by. One of the members is Faustina, who sells clothing of all kinds. She says that she has a good clientele who always buy the clothes she sells. Thanks to the goods she sells, Faustina has the means to provide a decent life for her loved ones and ensure that they go without nothing. Faustina has a room from which she sells her clothing and she is applying for this loan to buy a greater variety of clothing and provide a wider choice for her customers.

loans.use: to buy various items of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Kimsanai

texts.ru: Кимсанай, 53 года, есть сын. У нее среднее образование, в качестве дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав 7 лет назад. В хозяйстве есть 2 коровы, на 0,50 Га земли выращивает кукурузу и пшеницу для реализации, малину для собственного потребления. Урожай собирают дважды в год. Благодаря упорному труду, Кимсанай на сегодняшний день имеет ежемесячную прибыль от бизнеса 14,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кимсанай обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Kimsanai is 53 years old and has a son. She has secondary education, and works in animal husbandry and crop husbandry in order to bring in income for her family, having started seven years ago. On her farm there are two cows, and on 0.50 hectares of land she cultivates corn and wheat for sale, and raspberries for personal consumption. The crops are harvested twice a year. Thanks to her persistent hard work, today Kimsanai has a monthly profit of 14,000 som (KGS) from her business. 

With the view of further developing her business, Kimsanai has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) in order to buy two cows for increasing her herd. She plans to invest the funds from the loan in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to purchase two cows in order to increase her herd

loans.name: 8 De Diciembre Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama 8 de Diciembre, ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de pobreza, cada una pone su mayor esfuerzo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, y de esa manera dar a sus familias todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Nanci, quien se dedica a las confecciones de todo tipo de productos, ella poco a poco se ha ido ganando la clientela que le hace muchos pedidos, y lo cual le ayuda a poder tener los medios para ayudar a su familia.
Nanci pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas y otros insumos para poder seguir con sus confecciones, y de esa forma poder seguir cumpliendo con sus clientes.
texts.en: The group is called 8 de Diciembre and all its members are participating in the eliminating poverty programme. They all make every effort possible to improve their living conditions and thereby give their families what they themselves could not have. One of the members is Nanci, who makes goods of all kinds. She has gradually built up her clientele who order lots of goods from her and this enables her to help her family. Nanci is applying for this loan to buy fabric, thread, elastic and other supplies for making clothes, as this will enable her to continue meeting her customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic and other supplies for making clothes.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is 27 years old and married. She sells clothes, which she has been doing for four years, to help her husband cover the needs and expenses of their family. Hanan is a hard worker who has a good reputation among her customers.

Hanan requested a youth loan from Al Majmoua, which she will use to increase her business merchandise with a new collection of winter clothes to satisfy her customers' needs.

With the loan, her income will increase and her living conditions will improve. She hopes to expand her business more in the future by opening a pajamas section.

loans.use: to purchase a new collection of winter clothes

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Janice is 29 years old and both of her children are in school.

Janice has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more items like canned goods, snack foods, personal care products and other groceries.

Janice has been in this business for eight years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items like canned goods, snack foods, personal care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Discipline Group

texts.en:
The Discipline Group is composed of three women. Mary, a progressive woman, is appointed as the leader. She is married to Seth, a hard working trader, and is blessed with two children: Dorcas, in the first grade of senior high school and Joseph, in the first grade of K.G.

To make more income, Mary operates a second-hand clothing business. It has been running for 12 years. This business helps her to meet their living needs.

Mary was thinking of selling more clothing at Kaneshi, but she needs more money to do so.

When she and her group members were told about ID-Ghana group loan products, they were enthusiastic about the loan. They then formed the Discipline Group and requested a loan sum of 4800 GHS for their businesses.

Just like Mary, the other members also want to invest their loan portions for their businesses. They are sure the loan from Kiva, via ID-Ghana, will benefit their businesses' continuity.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to supply to her regular customers.

loans.name: Gerogita

texts.en:
Gerogita is 52 years old and married, with four children.

Gerogita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, cooking oil, bread, snack foods, shampoo and other personal care products.

She has been running the general store for 16 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Gerogita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, cooking oil, bread, snack foods, shampoo and other personal care products.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Erlinda is 52 years old now.

Erlinda has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell in the market.

Erlinda has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell in the market.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is 48 years old and married with one child. Marita works very hard to provide for her family.

Marita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, spices, cooking oil, bread, snack foods, shampoo and other personal care products.

Marita has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Marita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, spices, cooking oil, bread, snack foods, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Mujeres Bellas Y Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Bellas y Trabajadoras está en su ciclo número 2 del programa de comité de mujeres, es ubicado de la ciudad de Caacupé, las 18 integrantes del comité realizan muchos esfuerzos para así poder salir adelante junto con sus familias. 
Margarita es una de las que integra este grupo, ella tiene una despensa en la que todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas del día, comenta que poco a poco ha ido mejorando su negocio gracias a su sacrificio y esfuerzo. Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada que pone todo de si para poder seguir creciendo y mejorando cada día para poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para poder comprar insumos para su despensa, como ser: verduras, frutas, panificados, carne, enlatados y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group called Mujeres Bellas y Trabajadoras is in its second cycle of the Women’s Committee Program. It is located in the city of Caacupé. The 18 members of the committee put forth a lot of effort in order to get ahead with their families.

Margarita is one of the members of this group. She has a food pantry where she works daily from the early hours of the day. She says that little by little her business has been improving thanks to her sacrifice and effort. She is a woman who makes sacrifices doing all she can so she can continue growing and improving every day in order to support her family.

She is asking for this loan to buy supplies for her food pantry, such as: vegetables, fruit, bread, meat, canned items, and more, so she can continue with her sales as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her food pantry, such as: vegetables, fruit, bread, meat, canned items, and more.

loans.name: Roquella

texts.en:
For the past six years, Roquella has run a sari-sari (variety) store, providing goods ranging from seasonings, toiletries, edible oil, assorted canned goods, biscuits and soft drinks.

She is a fifty-four-year-old married woman and has twelve children, four of which are still attending school.

She hails from the town of Talibon, Bohol. Most of her income goes for food and school fees. She keeps on seeking ways to become more productive in order to support the needs of her children.

Roquella wants to buy rice, soft drinks and assorted goods. With these items she could maximize her resources, enabling her to maintain the flow of merchandise. In this way, she could start to save and invest in any opportunities to augment her income.

For the future, she is hopeful that she could improve the living conditions of her entire family and become more self-sustaining.

loans.use: to buy rice, soft drinks and assorted goods

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a married woman with 12 children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cristina is 60 years old now.

Cristina has a buy and sell coconut wine business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Cristina requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy containers of coconut wine to sell.

In the future, Cristina would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy containers of coconut wine to sell.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 38 years old, married, and has one child who is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Roselyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Roselyn requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Roselyn has been in this business for six years. In the future, Roselyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Chau's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Chau, 38 years old, is a Thai ethnic woman. Her family consists of four members, including her husband and her two sons living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is cultivation and breeding, with an annual income after deducting all costs of about VND 45 to 50 million. However, that income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and allows saving a small amount. She wants to raise a breeding buffalo, but she does not have enough money to invest in the breeding. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family in raising breeding buffalo well, and then the next year the buffalo will bring her family a lovely buffalo calf. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to raise a breeding buffalo.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 44 years old, two of her children are in school.

Jocelyn has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Monalisa

texts.en:
Monalisa, 49, is a married woman with four children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Monalisa has a buy and sell vegetable business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.

Monalisa requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional vegetables like beans, eggplant, banana, papaya, etc. to sell in her stall.

She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables like beans, egg plant, banana, papaya, etc. to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Adelita

texts.en:
Adelita, 51, is a married woman with five children, and one child is still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Adelita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years.

Adelita requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more assorted fish to sell to her customers.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more assorted fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda is 57 years old and married. She has 13 children, three of whom are in school.

Merlinda is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for six years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Merlinda requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

In the future, Merlinda would like to save enough money to continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Doan's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Doan, born in 1986, is a Thai ethnic woman. She currently lives with her husband and her two children, one daughter and one son, in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from her meager salary as a civil servant. The salary is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family. She wants to raise chickens but she does not have enough money to buy breeding chickens and food for them. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest effectively in breeding with high productivity, and when selling the first chicken herd, it will bring her family a considerable profit. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy breeding chickens

loans.name: Regin

texts.en:
Regin is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Regin is 40 years old and her three children are currently in school.

Regin has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Regin requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

Regin has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 48 years old, married with one child.

Nancy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, spices, cooking oil, bread, snack foods, shampoo and other personal care products.

She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from pig fattening, E-loading, and buying and sell purified water.

Nancy aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, spices, cooking oil, bread, snack foods, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Mujeres Activas Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Mujeres Activas  está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante, cada una pone su mayor esfuerzo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
Una de las personas que integra este grupo es la Sra. Sonia, quien se dedica al reciclaje de todo tipo de productos, como ser cartones, plásticos, aluminio y otros, que ella misma recoge de manera ambulante, o también los compra en cantidad y luego los revende para poder tener una mayor ganancia. Ella está orgullosa del trabajo que hace, ya que es digno y por medio de él ayuda a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar cartones, plásticos, aluminio y otros para poder revender y de esa manera poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
This group is called Mujeres Activas. It is in its first cycle of the Women’s Committee Program where everyone works to help each other get ahead. Each one puts forth her best in order to improve their living conditions and those of their loved ones.

One of the members of this group is Sonia. She is dedicated to recycling all types of products such as cardboard, plastic, aluminum, and more. She travels on foot to collect them and she also buys in quantity and then later sells them in order to have greater profit. She is proud of the work she does as it is dignified and is a way of helping her family.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy cardboard, plastic, aluminum, and other items for resale so she can continue with her work as she has been doing. She is grateful for the opportunity she receives so she can go on working.

loans.use: to buy cardboard, plastic, aluminum, and other items for her recycle business for resale

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
For several years now, Vilma has shown her dedication as a member of CCT Credit Cooperative in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental. The organization gives her spiritual guidance and practical tips on how to manage her variety store and RTW (ready-to-wear clothes) business. She tries to impose strict discipline regarding her customers’ debts because she really needs to earn enough to support the needs and medication of her sick husband. Her youngest child is also finishing his college degree and it requires a large sum of money for tuition fees and miscellaneous costs.

Since all responsibilities fall on her shoulders, she aims to improve her RTW business in time for the Christmas season. Simultaneously, she will enhance her variety store with more supplies of groceries, beverages, and sacks of rice. She is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan to address this need. She hopes that your help will somehow lighten her burden as the breadwinner for her family.

She’s looking forward to her child’s college diploma that will ensure his brighter future. She regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more ready-to-wear clothes, groceries, beverages, and sacks of rice

loans.name: Erna

texts.en:
Erna is a hard-working woman entrepreneur with two children.

She has a personal care products business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more personal care products to offer for sale.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Erna dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more personal care products to offer for sale.

loans.name: Remelyn

texts.en:
Remelyn is a single woman with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Remelyn is 30 years old and her child is still in school.

Remelyn has a food vending business in the Philippines. Remelyn requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy bread, burger patties, hot dog, french fries, cooking oil, eggs and other materials for her business.

Remelyn has been in this business for 1 year. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy bread, burger patties, hot dog, french fries, cooking oil, eggs and other materials for her business

loans.name: Norlita

texts.en:
Norlita is 50 years old, married, and has three children. With two children in school, Norlita works very hard to provide for them.

Norlita has a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soap, noodles and other groceries.

Norlita requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

In the future, Norlita would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is 36 years old and married. She has four children who are in school, and she works very hard to provide for them.

Cristina runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

Cristina requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

In the future, Cristina would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 29 years old and married. She has four children who are in school.

Maricel is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Maricel requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is 35 years old and married. She has five children, four of whom are in school.

Marissa is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years now and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Marissa requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

In the future, Marissa would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 38 years old and has three children, two of whom are in school. Lolita is married.

Lolita is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Lolita requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs. Lolita has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lolita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 50 years old, married with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Evelyn has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Evelyn has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Ma. Rosario

texts.en:
48-year-old Ma. Rosario earns a living by growing seaweed. She also helps her husband to fish, selling his catch to local settlers in her rural town of Talibon, Bohol. Ma. Rosario has five children between ages 12-18. Three of her children are still attending school. She is striving hard to improve her income. 

Ma. Rosario is requesting a loan to purchase fishing nets and seaweed farming paraphernalia such as seaweed seedlings, rope, straw, and soft-ties. These essential tools will improve her husband's on-going catch as well as help her to produce more seaweed to sell. In this way, Ma. Rosario will slowly boost her earnings and settle her obligations. In the long run, she looks forward to improving her income and investing in other income sources to continue to support the welfare of her growing children.

loans.use: to purchase nets and seaweed farming paraphernalia such as seedlings, rope, straw, and soft-ties.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman and has five children. Three of her children are still attending school and are 13 to 18 years old. Her husband's occupation is a fisherman. His catch is used for family consumption and as a source of income, too. She lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol.

She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various commodities like chips, candies, bread, cooking oil, sugar, coffee, canned goods, soft drinks, ready-to wear clothing and toiletries. Aside from running her store, she also caters snack food to the locals in her town. This serves as supplemental income for the entire family.

Grace decided to avail a loan to buy various supplies for the store like beverages, condiments and soft drinks. With the presence of these, she can maximize its resources, enabling her to maintain the flow of merchandise. Thus, she can now start to save and invest to become sustainable.

She dreams that someday she will have her own capital to become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy various supplies for her store like beverages, condiments and soft drinks.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
It all starts with a dream. Ofelia, 47, wants to improve her family’s living conditions, expand her business, and lead her daughter towards her dream of being a successful teacher.

To reach these goals, Ofelia is doing her very best in her chosen endeavors: a variety store and a hog fattening business.

Ofelia resides in Bacolod City, Negros Occidental, where the Center for Community Transformation Credit Cooperative has been operating for years. She was able to avail several loans from the cooperative in the past, which were faithfully repaid. Now she’s very thankful that CCT has partnered with Kiva, giving better opportunities for partners like her to avail higher loans.

She applied for PHP 60,000 loan that she can use partly to buy additional feed for her hogs and partly to improve her store by buying big quantities of dry goods, grocery items, rice, and beverages. She knows that an improved store facade will contribute to higher sales and profits. With this, she can efficiently augment the salary of her husband, Romeo, a baker.

The couple is doing their best to save for future investments. Thanks for your heartfelt generosity and goodness.

Ofelia meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the religion she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study religion, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy big quantities of dry goods, grocery items, rice, and beverages and to buy additional feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Anita is 59 years old and married with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Anita has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Anita requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell to customers.

Anita has been in this business for six years. In the future, Anita would like to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell to customers.

loans.name: Felimen May

texts.en:
Felimen May is 45 years old, married, and has one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Felimen May has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for ten years.

Felimen May requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Felimen May would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children, one of whom is in school. She runs a nipa roofing business in the Philippines and has successfully repaid her previous loan.

Fe is requesting a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her nipa roofing business. She dreams of one day saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for her nipa roofing business

loans.name: Mayla

texts.en:
Mayla is 42 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Mayla has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years.

Mayla requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

In the future, Mayla would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Sela

texts.en:
Sela is a 21-year-old single student at university pursuing a degree in Architecture and Engineering in the city. He is from Kandal Province of Cambodia. His parents are rice farmers and poor.

Due to a lack of financial support, Sela would like to request a loan to pay for his tuition fees from the second to the fourth year. This loan will help him graduate successfully. In the future, Sela is going to find a good job with reasonable salary, and save money to build his own house. If he has children, he wants them to study to pursue a bachelor or master degrees, if he can support it.

loans.use: pay for his tuition fees from the second to fourth year in Architecture and Engineering. His parents are rice farmers and poor.

loans.name: Corazon Unido Group

texts.es:
El grupo de nombre Corazón Unido, es  de la ciudad de San Ignacio, las integrantes son unidas y solidarias entre ellas, trabajan juntas en actividades, están conformes y sienten el apoyo del programa de comité de mujeres para que puedan ellas aumentar sus ingresos y ser cada vez más independientes.
La señora Luciana es una de las que integra este grupo, quien se dedica a las confecciones variadas, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, que pone todo de si siempre dentro de las capacitaciones que va ofreciendo la fundación paraguaya. Luciana comenta que pese a todos los inconvenientes que ha tenido que pasar está saliendo adelante.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus confecciones como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y mejorando.
texts.en:
The group called Corazon Unido is from the city of San Ignacio. The members are united and supportive, working together on activities. They are comfortable and feel the support of the Women’s Committee Program where they are able to increase their income, increasingly becoming more independent.

Luciana is one of the members of this group. She works making various garments. She is a hardworking fighting woman who always throws herself into the training that Fundación Paraguaya is offering. Luciana says that despite all the problems she has been through she is getting ahead.

She is asking for this loan in order to invest it in buying fabrics, thread, bias tape, and more items. This will allow her to continue making garments as she has been doing. She is grateful for the opportunity she receives so she can continue growing and improving.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, bias tape and more items to make garments.

loans.name: Masrakhon

texts.en:
Masurakhon was born in 1961 in Tajikistan. Her family was poor and she has worked a lot since childhood. Masurakhon always wanted to have a higher education but she has not had the opportunity to get it. For more than 23 years, she has been busy with her business buying and selling women’s clothing and fabrics. Masurakhon is a businesslady who sells clothes and fabrics in her local market. She has extensive experience and knows all aspects of her business well. 

Masurakhon is requesting a 2,500 TJS loan to buy women’s clothing for the new season. She renews her assortment of her goods every season and in this way she attracts buyers. Masurakhon awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy women's clothes for new season

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 62 years old and is married with four children. For the past ten years, she has run a food-vending business in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Delia is requesting a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: San Francisco Group

texts.es:
El grupo denominado San Francisco se formó en la ciudad de San Ignacio, ellas se ayudan las unas a las otras y por medio del trabajo unido quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
La señora Luisa, Presidenta del grupo; se dedica al comercio, tiene un pequeño negocio, comenta que es casada y tiene hijos, por quienes ella y su esposo se esfuerzan para sacarlos adelante. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que quiere salir adelante, es por ello que pone todo de si.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos para su negocio, como ser bebidas, frutas, verduras y otros, agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
The group San Francisco was formed in the city of San Ignacio. Members help each other and work together to improve their living conditions and those of their loved ones.

Luisa is the president of the group. She works in trade and has a small business. She is married and has children, for whom she and her husband strive to get ahead. She is hardworking and wants to succeed. That is why she puts her life in her work.

She requests a loan to buy supplies for her business such as beverages, fruits, vegetables etc. She thanks for the opportunity to improve their living conditions and those of their loved ones.

loans.use: to buy beverages, fruits, vegetables etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El es un señor de 60 años de edad soltero, trabaja en una empresa de fabricación de concreto como supervisor. Sufre de cataratas en ambos ojos. Desde hace varios meses esta inactivo en su trabajo, vive con su hermana quien es viuda y  el tiene a su cargo los gastos del hogar.  Esta por obtener su jubilación y desea operarse antes para poder estar bien de su vista.
texts.en:
He is 60 years old and single. He works as a supervisor for a company that makes concrete. He has cataracts in both eyes. For several months he has not been active at work.

He lives with his sister, who is a widow. He is responsible for the household expenses.

He will be receiving his retirement, and he wishes to have the operation before this in order to be able to see well.

loans.use: to pay for ophthalmic treatment.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 57-year-old married woman with four children. Her husband is a police officer. Marilyn is a sari-sari (variety) store owner and her profits provide for the family’s daily needs. Her husband’s salary is the source of their children’s tuition. 

Marilyn is requesting a loan to purchase many kinds of canned goods and school supplies to sell in her sari-sari store. Her goal is to run a one-stop-shop in her barangay. Marilyn will use her loan to improve her family’s lives with her earnings.

loans.use: to buy additional goods for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Kuña Guapa Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Kuña Guapa está en su ciclo 11 del programa de comité de mujeres, son 17 integrantes donde todas trabajan en variadas actividades. Tienen  la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde todas se encuentran trabajando y esforzándose por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Maria es una de las integrantes, se destaca por ser una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que pone todo de sí para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia. Ella vende joyas en platería y comenta que tiene una buena cantidad de clientes que siempre le hacen muchos pedidos, y es gracias a este trabajo que tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de joyas de plata para poder venderlas y de esa manera poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
This group's name is Kuña Guapa, and is in its eleventh cycle with the Women Committee. It is comprised of seventeen members who work all with different activities. They took the Poverty Elimination survey, and work hard to improve their living conditions.

Maria is one of the members. She is a very hardworking and enterprising woman who gives her best to improver her and her family's living conditions. She sells silver jewelry and says that she has many customers that order her products. Thanks to this job, she has the resources she needs to help her family.

She is requesting this loan to purchase silver jewelry to sell and continue working as she has been doing so far.

loans.use: to buy silver jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Gulbahor

texts.en:
Gulbahor buys and sells children's clothes at the local market to earn a living. As the widowed mother of one child, Gulbahor works hard every day to earn an income, because she is the sole breadwinner for the family. She manages the enterprise on her own, and has run her business for more than 14 years.

Gulbahor offers a variety of clothes for sale, such as as children's suits, skirts, and trousers. As the seasons change, she replenishes her assortment of goods to meet customer demand. She has presently requested a loan in order to buy children's clothes and shoes for the new season.

She is grateful for the kindness of her Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes and shoes for the new season to offer for sale

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre mujeres unidas  está en su ciclo número 11 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, como un medio para conocer la situación de vida de cada una y conforme a ello poder esforzarse por mejorar.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Paola quien tiene una cantina en una escuela, es por medio de las ventas que hace allí que puede ayudar a su familia. Paola es una persona muy trabajadora todos los días desde muy temprano en la mañana ella empieza a trabajar y de esa manera tiene los medios para poder dar a sus seres queridos una vida digna.
La Sra. Paola solicita de este préstamo para la compra de insumos para su cantina, como ser bebidas, comestibles, jugos, golosinas y otros, y de esa manera poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en:
This group is called Mujeres Unidas. They are in the 11th cycle of the Women’s Committee Program where all of them work and help each other to get ahead. They are doing the Poverty Stoplight Program as a way to understand the living situation of each one and to strive to improve accordingly.

One of the members is Paola who has a canteen in a school. Through the sales she makes there she can support her family. Paola is a very hardworking person. Every day from very early in the morning she begins to work and this allows her to have a way of giving her loved ones a decent life.

Paola is asking for this loan to buy supplies for her canteen, such as beverages, food items, juices, sweets, and more, so she can continue with her sales as she has been doing. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving so she can grow and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy supplies for her canteen business such as beverages, food items, juices, sweets, and more.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is 47 years old and single. She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Gemma has requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Gemma has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF and more recently from Kiva to sustain it. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Vilma Catalina

texts.es:
La sonrisa que se dibuja en los labios de Vilma, muestran lo orgullosa que se siente de llevar paso a paso su negocio, con el sudor de su frente. Si bien, esta emprendedora de 37 años de edad inició con la ayuda de su esposo a los 26 años de edad, ella lo ha mantenido y hecho crecer, todo con el objetivo de sacar adelante a sus tres hijos. 
El sueño de Vilma es ampliar más el negocio, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar arroz, frijoles, café, leche en polvo, pan, entre otros productos de gran demanda en su negocio. Con esto podrá encaminarse al sueño de hacer crecer más su pulpería y construir su casa con la ayuda de esos ingresos.
texts.en:
The smile that is drawn on Vilma's lips shows the pride she feels about carrying out her business step by step with the sweat of her brow. This 37 year old entrepreneur started with the help of her husband when she was 26 years old. She has maintained the business and made it grow. She did all of this with the objective of getting her three children ahead.

Vilma's dream is to expand her business more. That is why she is requesting a loan to buy rice, beans, coffee, powdered milk, and bread, among other products that are in great demand in her business. With this she will be able to move towards her dream of making her grocery store grow more and building her house with the help of these earnings.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, coffee, powdered milk, and bread, among other products.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 48 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Alma has been farming rice for 13 years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan, age 58, earns her living by running a general store. She has been in this business for two years. In her store, she sells a variety of grocery items such as sugar and noodles, as well as household goods like soap.

She and her husband have five children, and she works very hard to provide for them.

Susan requested a loan in the amount of PhP 12,000 loan through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy a variety of grocery items to offer for sale.

In the future, Susan would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a variety of grocery items to offer for sale

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar is a 42-year-old married woman, living with her husband and three children in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband drives a taxi, which does not belong to him; he has to pay the daily fair to the taxi owner. He wants to buy his own taxi to drive, so that he will not have to pay the fair on daily basis.

Therefore, Kousar requested a loan from BRAC Pakistan, which is the field partner of Kiva. She hopes that through this amount her husband will be able to buy a new taxi along with the contribution of savings. She belongs to a poor family; her husband is a single earning source and he does not have any other source of income. Kousar seems very glad and thanks to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a new taxi for her husband's transportation services.

loans.name: Ana

texts.en:
Ana is 59 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Ana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Ana has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Editha is 51 years old now.

Editha has a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. Editha requested a 10,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy dresses, pants, etc. to sell.

Editha has been in this business for five years. In the future, Editha would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy dresses, pants, etc. to sell

loans.name: Jelma

texts.en:
Jelma is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jelma is 40 years old and has three children who are in school.

Jelma has a food vending business in the Philippines. Jelma requested a 24,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business such as vegetables, meat, rice, etc.

Jelma has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Jelma would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her business such as vegetables, meat, rice, etc

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is 57 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Eufemia has a general store business in the Philippines. Eufemia requested a 15,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Eufemia has been in this business for three years. In the future, Eufemia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell

loans.name: Jose Dolores

texts.es:
José se levanta desde muy temprano a ordenar y limpiar el pequeño espacio designado a su pulpería. Perseverante, trabajador y emprendedor son las principales características de José, ya que inició con este negocio para poder seguir manteniendo a su familia y además para mejorar su estatus económico. En todos estos años José ha tratado de diversificar los productos que son ofrecidos en su pulpería. 
Además cuenta con el apoyo de su esposa quién junto a ella ha administrado dicho negocio, José acude a solicitar este crédito para poder invertir en productos de la pulpería, tales como; arroz, frijoles, azúcar, granos básicos  obtener estos productos le permitirá diversificar y le podrá ofrecer a sus clientes una variedad, sus expectativas son poder ampliar la vivienda y el negocio, José es un claro ejemplo de emprendedurismo  quién es conocido por la calidad y variedad de productos.
texts.en: Jose rises early every morning to organize and clean the little space designated as his convenience store. Persistent, hard-working and enterprising are Jose's main character traits, since he started this business so he could continue to support his family and to improve his financial situation. In all these years Jose has tried to diversify the products offered for sale in his store. He also counts on the support of his wife, who has managed the business along with him. Jose is applying for this loan to invest in products for the store, such as: rice, beans, sugar, and staple grains. Obtaining these products will let him diversify his stock and offer his customers more variety. He hopes to add on to his home and the business. Jose is a clear example of an entrepreneurial spirit, who is known for the quality and variety of his products.

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
María una mujer decidida decidió establecerse en el mundo de los negocios para buscar un mejor futuro para ella y su familia, el cual lo ha encontrado y se encuentra satisfecha con lo que ha logrado hasta ahora. Doña Maria tiene una pequeña pulpería en ascenso, además vende comida los días domingos y cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo y su hija. Este es su segundo crédito desde el primero ha visto la evolución del negocio el cual ha incrementado desde su inventario y hasta ha logrado realizar mejoras en el hogar. Por lo que agradece a todas las personas que le apoyaron.
El trabajar desde su hogar le ha permitido mantener una buena relación con su familia ya que ha podido estar con ellos en todo momento. María tiene como expectativas lograr que la pulpería sea más grande, diversificar sus productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes lo mejor. María solicita el crédito para la compra de más productos, como arroz, frijoles, jabon, pan, leche, entre otros productos, ya que de esa manera podrá obtener mayores ganancias. Como planes futuros doña María sueña con tener otro negocio de venta de comida.
texts.en:
María, a determined woman, decided to set herself up in the world of business in order to seek a better future for herself and her family. She has found it, and she is happy with what she has managed to achieve so far. María has a small grocery store that is on the rise. She also sells food on Sundays. She has support from her husband and her daughter.

This is her second loan. Since the first one she has seen her business evolve. It has grown in inventory, and she has even managed to make improvements to her home. For that she is grateful to all of the people who supported her.

Working from home has allowed her to maintain a good relationship with her family because she has been able to be with them all of the time.

María expects to make her grocery store bigger and to diversify her products in order to offer her customers the best.

María is requesting the loan to buy more products like rice, beans, soap, bread, and milk, among other products. This way she will be able to get better earnings.

María dreams of having another business selling food in the future.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, soap, bread, and milk, among other products.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is a maize farmer from Bazana II village. As a member of Babban Gona, Ibrahim is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the chance to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria. 

Before joining Babban Gona, Ibrahim would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Ibrahim can store his maize and sell it in the future for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 

Ibrahim is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family and in the end, hopes to use his increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Carina

texts.en:
Carina is a 31-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Carina has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 24,500 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients, such as sugar, coconut oil and rice.

Carina has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients, such as sugar, coconut oil and rice.

loans.name: Ma. Nelly

texts.en:
Ma. Nelly is 59 years old and married with five children.

Ma. Nelly is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Nelly has been raising pigs for six years now. She has borrowed 10 times from NWTF and, more recently, from Kiva to sustain her business.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Luisa Amanda

texts.es:
