Luisa subsistía solo con el salario de su compañero de vida  y al ver las necesidades y también para obtener ingresos extras decidió realizar una actividad que le aportara ingresos para ayudar a su pareja.  Ella comenzó a tener experiencia en el comercio a partir de los 34 años. Éste es su segundo negocio al que se ha dedicado de lleno,  anteriormente vendía tortillas. 
Luisa es una mujer emprendedora, trabajadora y luchadora ahora espera seguir trabajando en el negocio que emprendió con mucha dedicación. Por lo tanto solicita el crédito para invertir más en su negocio y de esa manera comprar otros productos como frijoles crudos, leña, fósforos, entre otros materiales para diversificar la cantidad de productos que ofrece, asimismo mejorar la calidad de estos. Luisa espera crecer y poder variar en un futuro cercano, Luisa también cuenta con el apoyo de su pareja y el de su hijo.
texts.en:
Luisa used to get along only on the salary of her life partner and seeing the need and also in order to obtain extra income she decided to start an activity that will contribute income to help her partner. She began to have experience in commerce 34 years ago. This is her second business that she has fully dedicated herself to. Previously she sold tortillas.

Luisa is enterprising, hardworking and a fighting woman and now she hopes to continue working in her business that she started with great dedication. Therefore she is asking for a loan to invest more in her business. She will buy other products such as dry beans, firewood, matches, among other items, to diversify the number of products she offers, also improving the quality of these. Luisa hopes to grow and be able to diversify in the near future. Luisa also has the support of her partner and son.

loans.use: to buy dry beans, firewood, matches, among other supplies.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 29 years old and has three children. Jocelyn is married and two of her children are in school.

Jocelyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Jocelyn has been in this business for two years now, and she has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es:
Juguetes, mochilas, materiales didácticos para bebes, lámparas, son algunos de los productos que se observan desde lejos por una de las aceras de las calles, donde María tiene establecido su puesto de mercadería en general, por más de diez años, y negocio que le ayudó a sacar adelante a sus tres hijos como madre soltera. 
María inició con capital propio, por lo que se siente orgullosa de tener un trabajo prospero, a pesar de haber estudiado para ser dicente. Ella cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos, quienes viven fuera del país y mandan remesas. A sus cincuenta años tiene muchas metas por delante, por lo que desea solicita un préstamo para comprar más materiales didácticos para bebés, juguetes, peluches, carteras, entre otros productos que ha ofrecido y han hecho crecer el negocio. En sus planes está aumentar sus ingresos, mediante un excelente servicio, para que en un futuro sus hijos se hagan cargo de este negocio.
texts.en:
Toys, backpacks, instructional materials for babies, and lamps are some of the products you can see from afar on a sidewalk, where Maria has a stall and sells different products. She has had this business for ten years, and it has helped her to raise her children as a single mother.

Maria started this business with her own capital. She is proud of having a prosperous business, depite having studied to be a teacher. Her children, who live abroad, support her and send her money.

She is fifty years old, and has set many goals for the future. This is why she is requesting a loan to buy instructional materials for babies, toys, stuffed toys, and purses, among other products she usually sells and have helped her to expand her business.

She plans to increase her income through an excellent service, so her children can take over the business in the future.

loans.use: to buy instructional materials for babies, toys, stuffed toys, purses, and other products.

loans.name: Laxmi's Group

texts.en:
A good amount of highly nutritious manure goes into the cultivation of everyone's favorite fruit — the commonly available banana. Laxmi, standing to the extreme left in the photograph, is a banana cultivator in Koraput district of Odisha, India. In lean times, Laxmi works as a laborer to bring some money home for her family's basic expenses. After her divorce, she lives with her two daughters.

At present though, Laxmi, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan amount to meet the costs of purchasing manure for her half-acre banana plot.

"As you sow, so you reap." This adage applies not just to cultivators of edible crops. You can sow some of your funds and reap the benefit of satisfaction and contentment, as you watch the money make a difference to Laxmi's efforts.

loans.use: to meet the costs of purchasing manure for her half-acre banana plot.

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es:
Desde que era una adolescente, Trinidad miró como su madre viajaba todas las tardes al mercado con el objetivo de vender comida para sustentar a su familia. Actualmente, esta emprendedora de 63 años de edad, intercambió de papel y ahora lleva más de veinte años como comerciante de comida en el mismo mercado donde vio trabajar a su madre. Anteriormente ella había solicitado un préstamo para comprar alimentos para realizar sus comidas, por lo que se siente muy agradecida por haberlo conseguido.
El apoyo de sus hijos, la han ayudado a salir adelante también, después de dar toda su vida a la crianza de sus hijos como madre soltera. Trinidad tiene unas expectativas bastante altas, pues quiere llegar a tener un restaurante, por lo que quiere seguir invirtiendo en su pequeño puesto de comida para seguir ahorrando. Razón por la cual solicita un nuevo préstamo para comprar arroz, carne de pollo, cerdo, verduras, entre otros productos indispensables para seguir vendiendo comida de calidad.
texts.en:
Trinidad has been seeing her mother go to work every day since she was a teenager. Her mother worked selling food at the marketplace in order to sustain her family. Today, this 63-year-old entrepreneur took over and has worked as a businesswoman for more than twenty years, selling food at the same market where she saw her mother work.

She applied for a loan in the past to buy ingredients to prepare her food, and is grateful for having received it. Her children support her, and this has been of help to get ahead, after offering them her life to raise them as a single mother.

Trinidad has high expectations; she wants to have her own restaurant. She wants to continue investing in her small food stall, and save some more. This is why she is requesting a new loan to buy rice, chicken, pork, and vegetables, among other products she needs to continue selling good-quality food.

loans.use: to buy rice, chicken, pork, and vegetables, among other products.

loans.name: Sabita's Group

texts.en:
Sabita is a 48-year-old lady standing to the extreme right-hand side in the photograph. She hails from a village of Koraput district, Odisha, India. This humble lady has a family of four.

Sabita is a tailor by profession and has a good reputation in her community due to her work efficiency and pleasant behavior. Her husband, being an elderly person, often remains ill and is not able to work anymore. So, Sabita is the only breadwinner in her family.

She has two daughters. Her elder daughter has completed her education and helps her in her business, and her younger daughter is continuing her studies. After meeting the daily household expenses and the medical expenses of her husband, Sabita is hardly able to save any money.

She, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR. Sabita will utilize her portion of the loan amount to pay the course fees of her daughter's banking course. The loan amount will help her daughter complete her education smoothly with flying colors and will help her in getting a good job with a pretty good package.

Sabita is eagerly awaiting your kind help.

loans.use: to pay the course fees of her daughter's banking course.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen, age 45, is a mother of six children living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband owns a tailoring shop in the market. This is the only source of income for the family. He needs to purchase a tailoring machine and variety of tailoring materials for the shop, including threads, needles, clothing, etc. This is very important for him to continue his work efficiently and professionally.

However, due to the lack of money he finds it difficult. Therefore his wife, Nasreen is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan, with the goal of helping her husband. He will purchase the needful things with the help of the loan amount. Nasreen is feeling happy that she will be able to help her husband with the loan amount. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy threads, needles, clothing etc. for her husband's tailoring services.

loans.name: Kunthy

texts.en:
Kunthy is a 20-year-old single freshman. He is from the Tboung Khmum Province, Cambodia where his parents are rice farmers, they depend on farming as revenue. Currently, Kunthy is pursuing a bachelor’s degree majoring in Information Technology at a university in the city.

Due to the fact that he is short of the finances to pay his fees from the first to the fourth year, so he would like to apply for a loan. With this loan, he will be able to have enough finances to cover his university fees and go through from the first to the fourth year successfully. For his dreams, Kunthy wants to find a good job with a reasonable salary.

loans.use: to pay his fees from the first to the fourth year, for a BSc. in IT.  His parents are rice farmers.

loans.name: Oynura

texts.en:
Oynura lives with her family in the northern part of Tajikistan. She is widowed and she is bringing up four children alone. Oynura is has pedagogy and she has worked in a kindergarten more than four years. She has been working in this kindergarten since her husband died. She uses her salary for buying food products for her children.

Now she is ill and she must go to doctor as soon as possible, but she does not have money. Oynura is asking for a loan of 1,000 TJS to buy medicines for treatment. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicines for treatment.

loans.name: Shahrikhon

texts.en:
Shahrikhon was born in 1969. She is a married parent of four children.

Shahrikhon is the main feed keeper of her family. She has been busy buying and selling children's clothes in a local market. Her husband and daughter help her to manage the business. Sahrikhon buys clothes from foreign countries and sells them in a local market. She has worked in this field for more than 12 years.

Shahrikhon periodically renews the assortment of her goods. So, she plans to buy children's clothes for the new season. She is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni (TJS) with this aim.

She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy children's clothes for the new season.

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita's way of earning a living is by operating a sari-sari (variety) store, situated in front of her home. She sells basic seasonings, eggs, edible oil, assorted canned goods, biscuits, and soft drinks. She is a 54-year-old, married woman and has three children. Her youngest child is 18, and still attending school.

She has requested a loan to buy assorted goods like sardines, soap, sugar and soft drinks. With these, she can maximize the resources, enabling her to have variety of goods on display and continue to serve her customers. In that way, she can start to save and invest any possible sources of income to become sustainable.

Carmelita is determined that she is doing her best to become more efficient in handling her sari-sari (variety) store to improve the living conditions of her family. She is thankful to Kiva for continued support.

loans.use: to buy assorted goods like sardines, soap, sugar and soft drinks.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is a repeat client in Ugafode Microfinance applying for a loan of UGX 2,400,000. She is a married woman with children. She is a businesswoman who owns a salon.

In a bid to increase her working capital/expand the business, she has applied for a loan of UGX 2,400,000 to buy beauty products and hair relaxers in bulk while preparing for the festive season. She is, however, faced with a challange of competition and lack of enough capital.

She is very grateful for the support Ugafode Microfinance and Kiva lenders offered to her, since she is now able to fund and sustain her business.

Pictured is Annet with the UGAFODE credit officer (right) at Annet's salon.

loans.use: to boost her salon business.

loans.name: Puspanjali's Group

texts.en:
Puspanjali, 35, standing in the middle in the photograph, is a divorcee who lives with her two sons in a small village of Koraput district in Odisha, India. Puspanjali works on her farm and manages her own vegetable cultivation business in the extension of her house. She has been carrying out the vegetable cultivation, especially of bitter gourd and ridge gourd, for the past five years and has steadily grown her vegetable produce and profits.

She wants to enhance her business and wants to increase the vegetable production to a greater level. For this, she requires an initial capital which she lacks currently. Thus, she, along with her group members, has decided to borrow 36,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to buy a hand spraying machine, better quality seeds and fertilizers and pay off the water rent.

With better equipment, her vegetable produce will increase, which she will sell in local markets and vegetable co-operatives to earn good profits. She assures that she will be repaying her loan amount completely on time.

loans.use: to buy a hand spraying machine, better quality seeds and fertilizers and pay off the water rent.

loans.name: Tinh

texts.en: Mrs. Tinh is 35 years old and married. She has three children under 18.  She would like to improve her living standard, especially for her children but has a lack of capital. The loan can help her to build a hygienic latrine. Small business is the main income source of her family, so she is able to repay the loan monthly.

loans.use: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

loans.name: Noor Ayesha

texts.en:
Noor, a mother, is aged 35 and lives with her husband in Multan, Pakistan.

Noor is engaged in embroidery to earn an income. She started her embroidery business nine years ago because she wanted to support her family and meet their household expenses.

With the aim of providing ease to her children and make their future secure, Noor initiated this embroidered-clothing business. She used to work with hand-embroidery, but her son suggested that she install a embroidery machine to earn better profits.

Noor is thankful to the Kiva team and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her embroidery business.

loans.name: Namoz

texts.ru: Веселый и щедрый человек Намоз. Он из района Восеъ. Ему 47 лет. Намоз семейный мужчина. Жене 44 года. Детям 20, 18 и 15 лет. Намоз вместе с семьей занимается растениеводством. У него большой земельный участок. На земле одному работать тяжело, и ему помогает его жена и дети. У Намоз небольшая и дружная семья. Они заботливые и помогает друг другу. Намоз в этом году на половине земли посадил кукурузу, а на остальное часть земли посадил морковь. Он и его семья много трудятся, чтобы получить богатый урожай. Намоз хочет обработать урожай минеральными удобрениями, чтобы собрать качественный урожай. На большой земельный участок требуется больше количество минеральных удобрений. Для купли больше минеральных удобрений Намозу не хватает денежных средств, и по этой причине он обратился за кредитом. Намоз надеется на Вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
This happy and generous man is Namoz. He is 47 and from the Vose region. He is a family man; his wife is 44 and his children are 20, 18 and 15. Namoz and his family work in agriculture. He has a large plot of land. It's difficult to work the land alone and so his wife and children help him. He has a small and loving family. They are caring and help each other.

This year, Namoz planted corn on one half of his land and carrots on the other half. He and his family have been working very hard to ensure a rich harvest. He wants to fertilize the crops so that the quality of the harvest is improved, but with so much land he needs more fertilizer and doesn't have enough money to buy it. For this reason he is looking for a loan. He hopes for your support.

loans.use: to purchase mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Judita

texts.en:
Judita is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 32 years old and has one child in school. She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines.

Judita has requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fruits to sell. She has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Judita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмира успешно погасила свой кредит, она использовала средства по назначению. Гульмира очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Гульмиры на сегодняшний день насчитывается 5 коров, 23 овцы, ежегодно она обрабатывает 1,53 Га земли, где выращивает арбузы, помидоры, кукурузу. В целях дальнейшего расширения бизнеса, Гульмира обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы с теленком. Доходы Гульмира планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья и завершение строительства дома.
texts.en: Gulmira successfully repaid her loan and used it for the intended purpose. She is grateful to Kiva and everyone who helped her with the financing. Thanks to Gulmira's hard work, she now has five cows and 23 sheep. She also has 1.53 hectares of land where she plants watermelons, tomatoes, and corn. In order to expand her business, she applied for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy a cow with a calf. She plans to use the earnings from the loan to invest in additional livestock and to finish building a house.

loans.use: to buy a cow with a calf in order to invest in her business

loans.name: Philibus Maigemu

texts.en:
Philibus is a maize farmer from Bazana II village. As a Babban Gona member, Philibus is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of Land, 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Philibus would have had to sell his maize at harvest, when the price of maize is at its lowest, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member, Philibus can to store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize, at a premium of up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Philibus no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per Hectare of land, Philibus hopes to realize better yields and plans on using his additional income to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Saltanatkhan

texts.ru: Салтанатхан, 46 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей. Образование у нее средне-специальное, занимается сельским хозяйством, начав этот бизнес с 10,000 сом (KGS) в 1990 году. Благодаря упорному труду Салтанатхан, она смогла развить и расширить свой бизнес, ее деятельность приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В хозяйстве на сегодня есть 5 коров, на 0,80 Га земли выращивает арбузы для реализации. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Салтанатхан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы с теленком для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита помогут Салтанатхан расширить ее бизнес деятельность.
texts.en: Saltanatkhan is 46, married, and has four children. She has a vocational education and is a farmer, having started a business in 1990 with 10,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Saltanatkhan's hard work, she was able to develop and expand her business, which earns about 15,000 som (KGS) per month. This is how she pays for her family's food and household needs. She currently has five cows and grows watermelons to sell on a 0.8 hectare plot of land. In order to develop her business, Saltanatkhan applied for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) with Bai Tushum Bank to buy a cow with a calf to increase her livestock headcount. The earnings from the loan will help Saltanatkhan expand her business activities.

loans.use: to purchase a cow with a calf in order to increase her livestock headcount

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
In the Philippines, there’s one unique type of business and it is called a sari-sari store. It is similar to a convenience store but a smaller version. You will see this type of business in every barrios, barangays, and even in cities. A variety of items can be bought at a cheap price since the stores sell the items by volume, kilos, or piece. Sari-sari store have grills or screens as protection against theft.

Ma. Gina is 43 years old and operates a sari-sari store, which she has been doing for seven years. She earns an approximately 15,000 PHP every month. She is an active member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) and benefits from CCT loans that help aspiring entrepreneurs to operate and expand their businesses.

Ma. Gina requested a loan for 20,000 PHP, which shew ill use to add items to her store. She will purchase bottled drinks, sacks of rice, school supplies, and other grocery items with the loan. She aims to expand her business and offer more products to her customers. Perseverance and patience are her strengths. She plans on using her profits to support the educational expenses of her children.

Ma. Gina attends CCT group fellowship meetings with 10-15 individuals where she can gain strength spiritually and where she hear testimonies from other CCT partners. They study God, build social relationships with other partners, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase items such as bottled drinks, sacks of rice, school supplies, and other grocery items.

loans.name: Tolib

texts.ru: Это мужчина Толиб. Он из района Восеъ. Ему 34 года. Толиб имеет троих детей в возрасте 14, 12 и 11лет. Жене 32 года. Толиб на районе живет вместе с отцом, матерью, женой и детьми. Толиб образованный и умный сын в семье. Он занимается сельскохозяйственной деятельности. Толиб  9 лет выращивает растение. Толиб радуется, когда собирает богатый и здоровый урожай. Он больше времени проводит на земле и любить зарабатывать честно нажитым трудом. Еще немного времени осталось до сбора урожай, Толиб планирует отработать урожай минеральными удобрениями. Для купли минеральных удобрений ему требуется сумма денег, и Толиб решил взять кредит и приобрести необходимых средство.
texts.en: This man is Tolib. He is from the Vose district and is 34 years old. Tolib has three children, ages 11, 12, and 14. His wife is 32. Tolib lives with his father, mother, wife, and children and he is an educated and intelligent man. He is a farmer and has been planting crops for nine years. Tolib is happy when he receives a rich and healthy harvest. He spends most of his time in the fields and loves to earn an honest living. There is still a little time before the harvest, so Tolib is planning to treat the soil with fertilizers. He needs money to buy fertilizers, so he decided to take out a loan and obtain the necessary funds.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 50 years old and has two children who are in school.

Lydia has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 24,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients such as sugar, rice, etc. Lydia has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as sugar, rice, etc.

loans.name: Kasimu

texts.en:
Kasimu is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Kasimu has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Kasimu would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Kasimu can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Kasimu will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Kasimu is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to move to the city with his family.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Mamuka

texts.en:
Mamuka is a 41-year-old married man from Kobuleti city. He lives with his pensioner parents, wife and 2 sons and the only employed person is his wife, who is a teacher. Mamuka grows maize and nut trees on the family-owned agricultural land. In additions he owns a cow and the family produces dairy products. In order to get financial independence, Mamuka decided to be involved in his own business. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience. 

After several unsuccessful attempts, Mamuka applied for the credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva, permitting people to start or re-start businesses. With the received amount of 4000 GEL, Mamuka plans to purchase special machinery of an auto crane, rent the place and start repairing cars. He will get clients among local people and will generate some income.

With the support of the Start Up program, Mamuka will get an opportunity to be involved in his own business and tackle the financial difficulties. He needs your support.

loans.use: to purchase an auto crane and start repairing cars.

loans.name: Souweba

texts.fr: Souweba est femme âgée de 36 ans qui vit à Agoè. Mariée et mère de six enfants, Souweba est une marchande de «  pure water »  qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile puis dans les quartiers environnant. Souweba désire ce crédit pour financer son achat de sachets d’eau «  pure water »  en vue de bien revendre et de tirer profit afin de gagner plus de revenus et pouvoir mieux contribuer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en: Souweba is a 36-year-old woman who lives in Agoè. She is married and has six children. Souweba sells purified water that she purchases two times a month at the market and resells from the front of her home, then in the nearby neighborhoods. Souweba would like this loan to cover her purchase of bags of purified water. Her goal is to have good sales and to make a profit in order to have more income and be able to better contribute to her family's expenses.

loans.use: to buy 100 bags of purified water.

loans.name: Basila

texts.en:
Basila, who is in her early 50s, is single with one child who is grown up.

She has been running a beauty salon since 2002. She works from 8am to 8pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Basila's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy up-to-date salon products to meet her customers' requirements. She dreams of being able to develop her business more.

Basila will be responsible for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy up-to-date salon products to meet her customers' requirements.

loans.name: Fenly

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Fenly works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buy and sell vegetable. Fenly is borrowing PHP 3000 through NWTF to  buy ingredients like meat, fish, pork, vegetables, spices and other materials for her food production business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, pork, vegetables, spices and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like soft-drinks, sardines, noodles and other personal care products to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Gloria dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like soft-drinks, sardines, noodles and other personal care products to sell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a married woman, 58 years old with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Teresa has a food vending business in the Philippines. Teresa requested a PHP 3000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Teresa has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Dometila

texts.en:
Dometila is a widowed woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Dometila is 66 years old now.

Dometila has a buy and sell coconut wine business in the Philippines. Dometila requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy containers of coconut wine to sell.

Dometila has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, Dometila would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Miraluz

texts.en:
Miraluz is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Miraluz is 45 years old and has one child still in school.

Miraluz has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Miraluz requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional box of fish to sell to her customers.

Miraluz has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional box of fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Iluminada

texts.en:
Iluminada is 61 years old, married with five children.

Iluminada works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 3000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, spices, cooking oil, bread, snack foods, shampoo and other personal care products.

She has been running the general store for 1 year and also earns an income from food vending.

Iluminada aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, spices, cooking oil, bread, snack foods, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Tetchie

texts.en:
As a single parent of four children, Tetchie works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Tetchie is borrowing PHP 5000 through NWTF to buy assorted fish to sell to her customers for her fish vending business.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 55 years old, widow with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ma. Fe has a clothing retail business in the Philippines. Ma. Fe requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of clothes to sell.

Ma. Fe has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Ma. Fe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Irene Eufrosina

texts.en:
Irene is a hardworking woman entrepreneur.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Irene dreams that one day, She will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en:
Liezel is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Liezel is 46 years old and has two children are still in school.

Liezel has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Liezel requested a PHP 5000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fish to sell to her customers.

Liezel has been in this business for 6 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Presentacion

texts.en:
Presentacion is 52 years old, married with one child.  

Presentacion is in the agricultural, business raising pigs in the Philippines. Presentacion requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Presentacion has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Presentacion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 46 years old, single.

Annie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, spices, cooking oil, bread, snack foods, shampoo and other personal care products.

She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from E-loading station.

Annie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, drinks, spices, cooking oil, bread, snack foods, shampoo and other personal care products

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Josephine is 25 years old and has one child in school.

Josephine has a food vending business in the Philippines. Josephine requested a PHP 8000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending busines such as, rice, sugar, etc..

Josephine has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending busines such as, rice, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy, age 34, operates a general store to earn an income. She has been in this business for 11 years. In her store, she sells a variety of grocery items such as canned goods and noodles, as well as household goods like soap.

She and her husband have two children, both of whom are attending school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Amy requested a loan in the amount of PhP 16,000 loan through NWTF. With her loan funds, she will purchase a variety of grocery items to offer for sale.

In the future, Amy would like to save enough money to be able to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: purchase a variety of grocery items to offer for sale

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 61 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Lourdes works very hard to provide for them.

Lourdes runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Lourdes has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Lourdes would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 69 years old and married with six children. With four children in school, Maria works very hard to provide for them.

Maria runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, homecare products, and other groceries. She has been in this business for 6 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Maria would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, homecare products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Wilber Daniel

texts.es:
Las ganas de progresar y sacar adelante a su familia, hacen que Wilber se levante a diario con muchos ánimos y entusiasmo para trabajar arduamente. Es un joven de 35 años de edad, esta casado y tiene,  dos hijos, uno de cuatro años y otro de diez. Luego no haber podido establecerse en los Estados Unidos debido a la deportación, su madre le brindó todo el apoyo para que iniciará un trabajo digno y de esta manera progresara,  por lo tanto compró un camión e inició la venta de piedra cantera.
Wilmer desea seguir incrementando la compra y venta de piedras canteras, razón por la cual solicita el préstamo, puesto que requiere aumentar las cantidades de piedra que compra para luego vender y así poder obtener más ganancias. Estima que el financiamiento será de mucha ayuda  ya que mejorará la economía familiar, además quiere lo mejor para su esposa y una educación y salud de calidad para sus hijos. Entre sus planes futuros esta mejorar el camión en el que reparte la piedra cantera.
texts.en:
His dreams of moving forward and supporting his family mean that every day, Wilber gets up full of spirit and enthusiasm to work hard. He is a young man aged 35 years, is married and has two sons, aged four and ten years. After having been unable to establish himself in the United States due to being deported, his mother supported him so that he could start a decent job, enabling him to move forward. From this, he bought a truck and started selling quarried stone.

Wilmer wants to keep increasing his purchases and sales of quarried stone. He is requesting this loan as he needs to buy more stone so that he can sell it and make more income. He believes this funding will be very helpful as it will improve his family's finances, and he wants the best for his wife and good health and education for his children. His future plans include improving the truck he uses to deliver the quarried stone.

loans.use: to buy quarried stone.

loans.name: Auwalu Muhammadu

texts.en:
Auwalu Muhammadu is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, he is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, which is 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Auwalu Muhammadu would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest time to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, he will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season when he can obtain a significantly higher price for it, even a premium of up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2,000 per hectare of land, Auwalu Muhammadu now has the opportunity to actualize his dream of expanding his agriculture business for himself and other family members, and he would like to use his additional income to purchase a motorbike for business purposes.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest time.

loans.name: M. Yasin

texts.en:
M. Yasin is 49, living in the rural area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is a very hardworking and gentle person. He is responsible for his ten children and old parents as well.

M. Yasin is a milkman by profession and sells milk in his community. He has been selling milk since 1993, so now he is very expert and experienced in his profession of producing milk from a buffalo; he produces milk from his all buffaloes in no time. He has many buffaloes. This is the reason he has to do very hard work to feed them. Every day he takes his herd to the pasture for grazing, gives them a bath in the stream, and he has to stay with them the whole day due to a fear of theft. He has not much time for his family members.

M. Yasin wants to get an assistant to look after his cattle, but he does not earn enough profit to afford the salary.

M. Yasin is receiving his second loan, and he has been investing his previous loan in the same business. With the help of last loan, he has purchased a buffalo and has benefited from that buffalo. He still wants to establish his business, and wants to buy another buffalo, so that he can increase his monthly income, get an assistant, and spend some time with his family.

Therefore, M. Yasin has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan.
M. Yasin thanks Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for increasing milk production and income so he can afford his assistant's salary.

loans.name: Mounira

texts.fr: Mounira est une veuve femme âgée de 48 ans et sans enfant à charge. Résidant à Agoè, Mounira est une revendeuse de friperies qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend en un emplacement au bord de la route. Pour avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin de répondre à nombreuse attentes de ses clients, Mounira sollicite ce crédit pour commander des balles de friperies en vue de mieux revendre puis de gagner des bénéfices pour pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens.
texts.en: Mounira is a widowed 48-year-old woman without children. Mounira lives in Agoè and resells used clothing that she purchases twice a month at the market and resells at a roadside location. Mounira is asking for this loan to order bales of clothing to have a large stock, maximize her profits, and meet her customer's needs. Her goal is to sell more and make a profit to be able to meet her daily needs.

loans.use: to buy four bales of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Brigilda

texts.en:
Brigilda has been engaged in fishing for many years now. She sold fish, crabs and clams to the locals. She is a 62-year-old married woman and has eight grown children. She lives in the rural town of Talibon, Bohol. Her husband is also a fisherman. They work hard to support their daily needs and also aim to save for future use.

She has requested for a loan from KIVA's field partner, CEVI to avail loan and to boost her fishing livelihood. Brigilda wants to buy new engine (for the motorboat) and fishing accessories like floater and nylon. These are vital tool that could improve her on going catch and help provide ease in transporting her daily catch.

Brigilda is hopeful that she will be prosperous in handling her livelihood to uplift the living condition of her family to become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy new engine(for the motorboat) and fishing accessories like floater and nylon

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 46 years old and married with four children. With one child in school, Marcelina works very hard to provide for them.

Marcelina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Marcelina has been in this business for 3 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Marcelina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Katiela Christel

texts.es:
Los números, las ecuaciones y las gráficas en matemática siempre le han fascinado a Katiela, razón por la que decidió estudiar Contaduría Pública y Finanzas. Desde primaria siempre ha resuelto las tareas asignadas sin ningún inconveniente, es una joven soñadora con muchas metas en la vida, tiene 20 años y cuenta con el apoyo de sus padres. Aparte de estudiar, trabaja medio tiempo en la librería de su universidad para poder ayudar a sus padres en los gastos del hogar.
Con el interés de ampliar sus conocimientos y horizontes, Katiela va a tomar un curso de diseño gráfico, razón principal por la que solicita el préstamo, ya que requiere de una computadora, herramienta que le ayudará a completar todos los trabajos asignados por sus docentes. Ella deposita su confianza en el financiamiento ya que anhela adquirir nuevas habilidades y así lograr ser una profesional eficiente. Su sueño es culminar su carrera con excelentes calificaciones, al mismo tiempo obtener una buena posición laboral para brindar apoyo a sus padres.
texts.en:
Numbers, equations and mathematical graphs have always fascinated Katiela, which is why she decided to study Public Accounting and Finance. Since primary school, she has always completed her assigned work with no problems. She is a young woman with big dreams and many life goals, is 20 years old and is supported by her parents. Apart from studying, she works part-time at her university's book shop in order to help her parents with household expenses.

Wanting to expand her knowledge and horizons, Katiela is going to take a course on graphic design, which is the main reason she is requesting this loan as she will need a computer. This tool will help her to complete the work assigned by her teachers. She is relying on this funding as she hopes to learn new skills and so become an efficient professional. Her dreams are to complete her degree with excellent qualifications and to get a good job in order to support her parents.

loans.use: to pay for a course on graphic design.

loans.name: Maria Jesus

texts.es:
María, de 34 años de edad, estudió hasta octavo grado, está casada, su esposo se dedica a la albañilería y también le ayuda en el negocio que tiene y viven con su único hijo el cual se dedica a estudiar.

María, tiene una tienda, la cual está ubicada a orillas de la calle principal que atraviesa su comunidad, la pequeña tienda donde despecha el producto es un cuarto hecho de lámina, el cual abre desde las 6:00 a.m. y cierra hasta las 7:00 p.m.
Este negocio lo inició cuando su hijo tenía ocho años, porque tuvieron problemas económicos y tuvieron que ver que hacían para seguir adelante y fue así como optaron por abrir la tienda.

El préstamo que está solicitando es para ampliar el lugar donde tiene la tienda, pues la demanda a aumentado y necesitan más espacio para colocar la mercadería; ya se están iniciando a hacer las bases del nuevo puesto, el cual está haciendo su esposo.

María, sueña con que su negocio siga creciendo y de esta manera poderle dar una mejor educación a su hijo para que se supere y sea profesional.
texts.en:
María is 34 years old and left school after the eighth grade. She is married and her husband works as a builder as well as helping her out with her business. They live with their only child, who is a student.

María has a shop which is located at the side of the main road that goes through her town. Her store where she sells her products is a room made from sheet metal. It opens at 6am and closes at 7pm.

María set up her business when her child was eight, because they had financial problems and they had to do something to move forward. That is why they decided to open a shop.

The loan she is requesting is to extend the site of her store, as demand has increased and they need more space for their merchandise. Her husband has already started building the foundations for the new site.

María dreams that her business will continue to grow, in order to give her child a better education so that he can better himself and become a successful professional.

loans.use: to extend the site of her store.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Maribel is 44 years old and has two children who are in school.

Maribel has a food vending business in the Philippines. Maribel requested a PHP 24500 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients such as, sugar, corn, coconut oil, etc..

Maribel has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as, sugar, corn, coconut oil, etc.

loans.name: Anna Marie

texts.en:
Anna Marie is 31 years old and has four children. Anna Marie is married and has four children are still in school.

Anna Marie is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Anna Marie requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Anna Marie has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Anna Marie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Bai Rubybelle

texts.en:
Bai Rubybelle is 33 years old and married with two children, one child still in school, Bai Rubybelle works very hard to provide for them.

Bai Rubybelle runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, cooking oil, eggs, shampoo and other snack foods.

Bai Rubybelle has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Bai Rubybelle would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, cooking oil, eggs, shampoo and other snack foods

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 39 years old and has one child in school. Rosalie is married woman.

Rosalie is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Rosalie has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Daisy

texts.en:
Daisy is 59 years old, married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Daisy has a general store business in the Philippines. Daisy requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like sugar, shampoo, canned good and other groceries.

Daisy has been in this business for three years. In the future, Daisy would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like sugar, shampoo, canned good and other groceries.

loans.name: Frank

texts.en: Frank is a 48 year old married man with one child living in Fort Portal Uganda. He owns a business of selling auto spare parts which he has been running for over 5 years and has a vision of earning an income for his family. He faces challenges of inadequate capital that limits his business expansion. However, he has future plans of opening up new business venues and educate his child up to the university. Frank has asked for a loan to help him buy more auto spare parts for sell.

loans.use: to buy more auto spare parts for sell.

loans.name: Sadiki

texts.en: Sadiiki owns a boutique and does teaching as a side income business. Through these businesses he has been able to look after his family by providing them with their daily needs. He desires to construct a residential house, and also expand her business. This time, Sadiiki wants to construct a residential house as a Christmas package for his family but the available funds are not sufficient to accomplish his desire. He already has some materials on the ground, like bricks, and concrete. He requests for credit to buy cement, and timber to construct his residential house.

loans.use: to buy cement, and timber to construct his residential house.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: Luis tiene 49 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, tiene un hijo de 21  años  que le ayuda a trabajar arreglando zapatos, a domicilio con su bicicleta recorre la ciudad en busca de clientes recoge la obra y se lleva al lugar donde viven para acomodar luego regresa a dejar  el calzado ya reparado, hace cinco años ellos vinieron  de Colombia en calidad de refugiados fue muy duro  al principio trabajaron como jornaleros obteniendo un poco de dinero para comprar algunos pegantes y pequeñas herramientas que les ayude en el oficio. Luis con el dinero desea alquilar un pequeño local en el centro de la ciudad, comprar  una vitrina, tres sillas generaría mayores ingresos cubriendo las necesidades básicas de su hijo y el, a futuro desea comprar una maquina cocedora de zapatos.
texts.en:
Luis is 49 years old, single, and has a son who is 21 who helps him with his work repairing shoes at home.  

With his bicycle he goes through the city in search of clients. He picks up the work and takes it to where he lives to fix it, he then returns and brings back the repaired shoes.

Five years ago they came to Colombia as refugees.  It was very difficult at first.  They worked as day laborers earning some money to buy some glue and small tools to help them with their trade.  

With the money [from the loan], Luis would like to rent a small room in the city center, to purchase a display case, and three chairs.  This would generate more income to meet the basic needs of his son and, in the future he would like to purchase a shoe sewing machine.

loans.use: to rent a small shop in the city center, to purchase a display case, and three chairs

loans.name: Tukur

texts.en:
Tukur is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Tukur has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Tukur would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Tukur can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Tukur will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Tukur is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es:
El exquisito olor a pan recién horneado se desprende cada mañana de la casa de José, quién con mucho amor y esmero realiza las mezclas de los panes para que deleitar a su clientela y de esta manera no perderla y así seguir aumentando sus ventas. Gracias al primer crédito su vida ha cambiado puesto que ha aumentado sus puntos de ventas. Asegura que el apoyo de su familia ha sido un pilar muy importante para seguir adelante.
José solicita un segundo préstamo con el objetivo de aumentar la producción de su capital, requiere de insumos como harina, levadura, leche, queso, entre otros. Deposita su confianza en el financiamiento, puesto que será el principal soporte para seguir progresando y expandiendo su negocio. Una de sus metas es mejorar su vivienda,  así que poco a poco ha invertido en los materiales,  no descansará hasta lograrlo, ya que  desea brindarle un hogar seguro a su familia, en el que se puedan desarrollar sanos y cómodos.
texts.en:
The delicious smell of freshly-baked bread floats through José's house every morning as he mixes bread dough with a great deal of love and care in order to please his customers, so that he doesn't lose any of them and can continue to increase his sales. His life was changed by the first loan, because he increased his number of retail outlets. His family's support has definitely been very important in helping him to move forward.

José is requesting a second loan with the aim of increasing production of his stock. He needs supplies such as flour, yeast, milk, cheese and other products. He is relying on this funding as it will be the main support for continuing to move forward and expand his business. One of his aims is to improve his home, so he has been investing in materials for this little by little. He will not rest until he has done so as he wants to provide his family with a safe home where they can live healthily and comfortably.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, milk, cheese and other products.

loans.name: Yolanda Marisol

texts.es:
Yolanda, de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está soltera, tiene un negocio de comida en el malecón de una playa muy reconocida y vive con sus hijos. 

Yolanda, tiene aproximadamente 20 años de tener este negocio, el cual lo aprendió de su madre.

Yolanda, necesita el préstamo para comprar mesas, sillas, cacerolas, entre otros para fortalecer el negocio, porque es una muy buena inversión porque ahora tiene muchos más clientes.

Ella sueña con obtener muchas más ganancias, para que sus hijos puedan seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
40-year old Yolanda has a grade 6 education. She is single, lives with her children, and runs a food stall on a street next to a well-known beach.

Yolanda has had her business for approximately 20 years. Her mother taught her how to run it. She needs a loan to buy tables, chairs, saucepans etc. to strengthen her business. It's a good investment as she now has many more customers.

Her greatest wish is to earn more money so that her children can continue with their education.

loans.use: buy tables, chairs, saucepans etc. to strengthen her business

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is single and 27 years old. For the past 10 years, she has run a barber shop in the Philippines. The other person in this picture is one of her customers. Christine works hard to support her family. 

Christine is requesting a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials such as hair oil, scissors, and to use to maintain her business. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy hair oil, scissors, and to maintain her business

loans.name: Irma De Jesus

texts.es:
Irma, de 45 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casada y vive con su hijo y su esposo; su hijo es una persona con capacidades especiales y su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Irma, trabaja junto a su esposo en la agricultura desde que se casó, ella tiene una parcela cerca de su casa en la cual trabaja con su esposo todos los días por la mañana.

Irma, necesita el préstamo para comprar abono y fertilizantes para sus cultivos, porque tiene que aplicarle estos insumos para asegurar una buena cosecha. 

El sueño principal de Irma, es tener siempre a su hijo junto a ella porque es especial y también obtener una buena cosecha.
texts.en:
45-year old Irma has a grade six education. She is married and lives with her husband and son. Her son has special needs; her husband works in agriculture.

Irma has worked with her husband in the fields ever since they got married. She has a piece of land next to the house where she and her husband work every morning. Irma needs a loan to buy compost and fertilizer for the land as these items must be applied in order to ensure a good harvest.

Irma's greatest wishes are to always have her son by her side because he is special, and also to have a good harvest.

loans.use: buy compost and fertilizer for her fields

loans.name: Irma Lisseth

texts.es:
Irma, de 19 años de edad, estudio hasta octavo grado, actualmente está acompañada, su pareja trabaja en la agricultura y en la pesca artesanal.

Irma, se dedica a la pesca artesanal junto a su esposa, los dos siempre han trabajado en la pesca porque sus familias también se dedican a esta labor; esto lo realizan tanto en el día como en la noche y luego lo comercializan casa por casa en las comunidades más cercanas. 

Irma, necesita el préstamo para comprar redes de pesca, porque las que poseen actualmente están muy deterioradas y evitan que la pesca no se efectiva.

El sueño principal de Irma, es comprar un vehículo para salir a vender los productos a otros municipios, para obtener más ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Irma is 19 years old and left school after the ninth grade. She has a partner who works in agriculture and small-scale fishing. Irma works in small-scale fishing alongside her husband. They have always worked in fishing because their families also worked in the sector. They work both during the day at at night. They then go from house to house selling their catch in the nearby towns.

Irma needs the loan to buy fishing nets, because her current ones are very damaged and prevent effective fishing.

Her biggest dream is to buy a vehicle so that she can go out and sell her products in other towns, in order to boost her income.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a maize farmer from the village of Kwankwani. As a member of Babban Gona, Samaila is excited about the opportunity to become a better farmer. With Babban Gona’s support, he has the chance to attain yields of up to eight metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land, which is 5.5 times the average yield in Nigeria.

Before joining Babban Gona, Samaila would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, he can now store his maize and sell it in the future at a price up to 37 percent higher than the market price at harvest.

Samaila is grateful to be part of the Babban Gona family. He hopes to use his expected increased earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Martina

texts.en:
Martina is a 44-year-old married woman with two children. She and her spouse manage a small business to sell furniture. Her spouse also works as driver. She would like to help her husband to improve their business by creating more furniture to sell. She requests a loan to buy wood.

In the future, Martina hopes to maintain their business and create good profit for education and business maintenance.

loans.use: to buy wood to use in her furniture-making business.

loans.name: Edita

texts.en:
Edita is a 61-year-old married woman with nine children, one attends school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Edita has run a general store for 20 years and requests 21,000 PHP through NWTF to buy canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

In the future, Edita would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Abdulia

texts.en:
Abdulia, age 44, operates a fishing business to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for 23 years.

Abdulia and her husband have five children, three of whom are still in school. She works very hard to support them.

She requested a loan in the amount of PhP 6,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies.

In the future, Abdulia would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a farmer. She plants and harvests rice and sugarcane to earn her living, and she earns an additional income by operating a general store. Esther has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and, more recently, through Kiva.

Esther and her husband have three children, and she works hard to support her family.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of PhP 27,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her farming business.

Esther hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline, age 43, earns her living as a vendor of coconut wine. This hard-working entrepreneur has been engaged in this business for one year.

She and her husband have seven children, four of whom still attend school.

Evangeline requested a loan in the amount of PhP 7,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy more containers of coconut wine to offer for sale.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy containers of coconut wine to offer for sale

loans.name: Jeanne

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 42 ans, Jeanne  est une femme qui vit avec deux enfants à charge. Habitant à Agoè, Jeanne prépare et vend de la pâte bandée appelée « Akpan » et le revend à la devanture de son domicile en vue d’avoir une bonne rentabilité financière. Jeane s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché du nécessaire. Pour commander des bols de maïs,  Jeanne demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat afin de gagner plus de revenus pour pouvoir aider son mari à subvenir aux charges de ses enfants.
texts.en: Jeanne is a married, 42-year-old woman who has two children whom she cares for. She lives in Agoè. Jeanne makes and sells "pâte bandée" called "Akpan" [a yogurt-like beverage.] She resells it from the front of her home with the goal of making a good profit. Jeanne purchases the necessary ingredients twice a month at the market. Jeanne is asking for this loan to order bowls of corn. She would like to make more money to be able to help her husband meet her children's needs.

loans.use: to buy 43 bowls of corn.

loans.name: Tonousse

texts.fr: Tonousse est une femme mariée âgée de 42 ans résidante à Tokoin. Avec deux enfants à charge, Tonousse est une marchande de fruits qu’elle achète et revend en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Tonousse s’approvisionne de ses marchandises trois fois par mois  au marché et désire ce prêt pour commander des sacs de citrons. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera suite à une bonne vente, Tonousse compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et pouvoir subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens puis supporter ses enfants et à leur épanouissement.
texts.en: Tonousse is a married, 42-year-old woman who lives in Tokoin. She has two children whom she cares for. Tonousse sells fruit that she buys and resells circulating in nearby neighborhoods. Tonousse purchases her supplies three times a month at the market and would like this loan to order bags of lemons. With the profits resulting from good sales, Tonousse intends to improve her sales performance and be able to meet her daily needs, then support her children and their growth.

loans.use: to buy four bags of lemons.

loans.name: Hadiyakhon

texts.en: Hadiyakhon was born in 1971 year. She is a kind woman. Hadiyakhon is married and has 3 children. Two of them are adults and one of them is non-adult. Hadiyakhon’s husband is a master of repairing houses. His income is small and that’s way Hadiyakhon is the main feed keeper of her family. She has been busy with buying and selling children clothes. Hadiyakhon sells clothes in a local market. She works in this field more than 3 years. Hadiyakhon is asking for a loan of 6000 Somoni to buy medicines for her treatment because she is ill. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy medicines for treatment.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is married and has three children. She is a resident of Pasay City, Philippines and a member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) in Malibay Pasay. Her husband is a messenger. She makes and sells cheese sticks, which is a favorite snack of Filipinos since it is budget-friendly and easy to prepare. All that is needed is a spring roll wrapper, cheese, and a frying pan.

Evangeline requested a loan for 15,000 PHP, which she will use to buy ingredients needed in making packs of cheese sticks, such as spring roll wrappers, boxes of cheese, and plastic wrappers for packaging. Product demand is increasing since Christmas is fast approaching. The remaining amount of the loan will be used as capital for establishing an added business.

Evangeline is hardworking and aims to expand her business as well as manage another business. The profit is just enough to support her family's day-to-day expenses and she is dedicated to making a living and earning more profit.

Evangeline has been consistent in attending CCT fellowship group meetings that consist of 15 to 30 members. She studies God and repays microfinance loans.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients to make cheese sticks and to establish a new business.

loans.name: Anne

texts.en:
Anne is 30 years old, married with two children.

Anne works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, cooking oil, eggs, shampoo and other snack foods.

Anne has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from pig fattening and rice retailing.

Anne aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, cooking oil, eggs, shampoo and other snack foods

loans.name: Ma. Luz

texts.en:
Ma.Luz is a 63-year-old married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Ma.Luz has had a food vending business for 8 years and requests 18,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

In the future, Ma.Luz would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Melodia

texts.en:
Melodia is a 36-year-old married woman with three children, all attend school.

Melodia has been in the agricultural business raising pigs for 7 years. Melodia requests 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She has previously borrowed 4 times from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Melodia would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Teofila

texts.en:
Teofila is 45 years old and has four children. Teofila is married and has four children who are in school.

Teofila is in the agricultural business farming fruits in the Philippines. Teofila requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

Teofila has been in this business for 8 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teofila would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Celenia

texts.en:
Celenia works hard to support her family. Celenia is single, 69 years old and has a roasted pig business in the Philippines.

Celenia requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like spices, pork and other materials for her business.

Celenia has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Celenia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like spices, pork and other materials for her business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 46 years old and married with five children. Four of her children are still in school. Helen works very hard to provide for them. Helen runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries.

Helen has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items. In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home product care, and other groceries

loans.name: Janeth

texts.en:
Janeth is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Janeth is 42 years old and two of her children are still in school. Janeth has a gasoline vending business in the Philippines. Janeth requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more containers of gasoline to sell.

Janeth has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Janeth would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Alaura

texts.en:
Alaura is a 27-year-old married woman with three children, two attend school. Alaura works very hard to provide for them.

Alaura has run a general store for 6 years and requests 6,000 PHP through NWTF to buy canned goods, beverages, snack foods, home care products , and other groceries.

In the future, Alaura would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, beverages, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Christy Marie

texts.en:
Christy Marie is a 35-year-old married woman with two children, one attends school. Christy Marie works very hard to provide for them.

Christy Marie has run a general store for 5 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, cooking oil, eggs, shampoo, and snack foods.

In the future Christy Marie would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, cooking oil, eggs, shampoo, and snack foods.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 45-year-old married woman with seven children, two attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Elizabeth has had a gasoline business for 28 years and requests 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more containers of gasoline to sell.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more containers of gasoline to sell

loans.name: Irma Mercedes

texts.es:
Irma, de 45 años de edad, no estudio, está acompañada, su pareja se dedica a los trabajos en la agricultura y viven en casa propia.

Irma, se dedica a comercializar ropa desde que tenía 20 años de edad, ella trabajo para una tienda que vendía ropa, pero cuando ella aprendió bien sobre la compra y venta de ropa decidió colocar su propio negocio y su familia le ayudo económicamente para iniciar con este negocio y actualmente vende ropa de lunes a sábado en el mercado municipal.

Irma, necesita el préstamo para comprar más ropa, porque se acercan las fiestas de fin de año y las ventas incrementan y sus clientes le solicitan que venda nuevos modelos de ropa principalmente para mujeres. 

El sueño principal de Irma, es poder mejorar su vivienda para brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
45-year old Irma did not attend school. She lives with her partner in their own house. He earns his living as a farmer.

Irma has been selling clothing since she was 20 years old. She started out in a store, but when she had learned how to buy and sell clothing, she decided to open her own business. Her family helped her financially. Now she sells clothing from Monday to Saturday in the local market.

Irma needs a loan to buy more clothing. The New Year festivities are approaching, a time when sales increase and her customers are asking for the latest styles, particularly for women. Her greatest wish is to improve her home so she can provide her family with a better standard of living.

loans.use: buy more clothing

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 49, runs a general store to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for five years. In her store, she sells grocery items such as canned goods, noodles, bread, milk, coffee, sugar, eggs, and snack foods, as well as personal use goods like shampoo.

She and her husband have six children, two of whom are still in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Elizabeth requested a loan in the amount of PhP 10,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy grocery items to offer for sale in her store.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy grocery items to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Emily is 53 years old and has one child still in school.

Emily has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines. Emily requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell. Emily has been in this business for 1 year. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Gemma works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear. Gemma is borrowing PHP 13,500 through NWTF to buy assorted fish to sell to her local market for her fish vending business.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses. Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF.
