She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy assorted fish to sell to her local market.

loans.name: Jose Daniel

texts.es:
Daniel, de 51 años de edad, estudio hasta primer grado, pero sabe leer y escribir, está casado y vive con sus dos hijos y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

Daniel, se dedica a trabajar en la agricultura desde hace más de 30 años, desde muy joven comenzó a trabajar en esta labor, pero aparte de eso en ocasiones trabaja pintando en construcciones.- El lugar donde cultiva es en una parcela que tiene a 2 kilómetros de su casa, en donde tiene sembrado maíz y trabaja todos los días desde las 5:00 a.m. hasta que atardece.

Daniel, necesita el préstamo para comprar insecticidas, fertilizantes y abono para sus cultivos, porque de esta manera podrá obtener mejores cultivos.

Daniel, sueña con obtener buenas cosechas y que su hija mayor siga estudiando en la universidad y sea profesional.
texts.en:
Daniel is 51 years old and studied up to Grade 1. He knows how to read and write. He is married and lives with his two children and his wife who does domestic work.

Daniel has worked in agriculture for more than 30 years. He started to work at this when he was very young and besides this sometimes he works in construction painting, The place he grows his crops is a plot of land he has two kilometers from his house. He grows corn and works every day from 5 am until sundown.

Daniel needs the loan to buy insecticides, fertilizer and manure for his crops as in this way he can obtain better crops.

Daniel dreams of reaping good harvests and for his oldest daughter to continue to study at university to become a professional.

loans.use: to buy insecticides, fertilizer and manure for his crops.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Juliana is a business woman and she has a small kiosk. She is requesting a loan of $ 1,000 from Tuba Rai Metin to improve her business.She will use the loan to buy some additional supplies to sell from her kiosk, such as noodles, biscuits, soy sauce, sardines, candy, playing cards, soft drinks and other things to sell. Juliana opened her kiosk in 2012 with her own working capital of $250. She is happy with the loan offered by Tuba Rai Metin so that she will have more working capital to buy more goods.

loans.use: to buy noodles, biscuits, soy sauce, sardines, candy, playing cards and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Georgette

texts.fr: Mariée et âgée de 51 ans, Georgette est une femme qui a cinq enfants à charge. Résidant à Tokoin, Georgette écrase de la farine de maïs et du manioc qu’elle produit en des boules de pâtes non préparer et le revend à la devanture de son domicile et en parcourant les quartiers environnant en vue d’avoir une bonne rentabilité financière. Georgette s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché du nécessaire pour sa production. Pour commander des sacs de maïs et de pâte de manioc, Georgette demande ce prêt pour réaliser son achat en vue de bien revendre et de gagner plus de revenus pour faire face aux besoins de ses enfants en aidant son mari à payer les frais scolaires dès le début de cette rentrée prochaine.
texts.en: Georgette is a married, 51-year-old woman with five children whom she cares for. She lives in Tokoin. Georgette crushes corn and cassava flour that she makes into balls of raw dough and resells from the front of her home and circulating in nearby neighborhoods, with the goal of making a good profit. Georgette purchases the necessary ingredients for her dough two times a month at the market. Georgette is asking for this loan in order to make her purchase of an order of bags of corn and cassava flour. Her goal is to have good sales and make a higher income to meet her children's needs and help her husband pay the school fees at the start of the next school year.

loans.use: to buy one bag of corn and two bags of cassava flour.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 28 years old, married, and has two children, one of whom attends school. She raises pigs in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years.

Juliet requested her second loan from NWTF for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Abla

texts.fr: Abla est une femme mariée avec quatre enfants à charge. Abla est âgée de 39 ans et vit à Tokoin où elle exerce son activité de restauratrice de riz et du haricot. Abla s’approvisionne du nécessaire servant à la préparation deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile et en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Abla sollicite ce crédit pour commander le sac de riz et des bols du haricot en vue de bien revendre puis de gagner plus de bénéfices et de venir en aide à son mari aux besoins de la famille et d’améliorer les conditions de vie quotidiennes de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Abla is a married woman with four children in her care. She is 39 years old and lives in Tokoin, where she carries out her restauration activity selling rice and beans. She gets supplies of the products necessary to make her dishes twice a month at the market and resells them in front of her home and wandering around the surrounding districts.

Abla is requesting this loan to order a sack of rice and bowls of beans, so that she can resell them at a good price and earn more money to be able to help out her husband with the family's needs and improve their children's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a sack of rice and ten bowls of beans.

loans.name: Aminatou

texts.fr: Amina est une femme mariée avec deux enfants à charge qui vit à Tokoin. Amina est une revendeuse de friperies qui s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché et le revend dans les quartiers environnant. Pour avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit, Amina sollicite ce prêt pour commander des unités d’habits de friperies en vue de bien revendre puis de répondre à nombreuse attentes de ses clients afin de gagner des bénéfices et aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire.
texts.en: Amina is a married woman, who has two children in her care and lives in Tokoin. She retails second-hand clothing and gets her supplies once a month at the market. She resells her clothing in the surrounding districts. In order to have a significant stock and maximise her profit, Amina is requesting this loan so she can buy second-hand clothes and sell them at a good price, while at the same time meeting high customer demand. She will thereby be able to make more profits and help her children with their education.

loans.use: to buy 180 units of clothing.

loans.name: Samira

texts.en:
Samira is a 53-year-old married mother of 3. She is a hardworking woman who puts much effort into supporting her husband to cover their family's living expenses.

Samira used to work as a teacher, but she has been running her convenience store for 15 years in order to earn a better income.

Samira is taking a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua so she can pay the cost of urgent surgery.

Samira hopes that in the future she can open another branch of her store so she can earn a better income.

loans.use: to pay for urgent surgery expenses

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es:
La socia al banco comunal LAS MERCEDES DE KATAÑIRAY.
La socia continua dedicándose  a su negocio de venta de ropa, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una mujer emprendedora que espera obtener más ganancias para de esta forma poder continuar apoyando a su familia, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de casacas entre otros.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Zonia belongs to the LAS MERCEDES DE KATAÑIRAY community bank. She continues to make a living in the clothing sales business. She has had her business for a long time, and things are going well thanks to the effort she puts into it every day. She is an enterprising woman who hopes to boost her profits so that she can continue to support her family. She is applying for the loan to buy jackets and other items. She is grateful for the loan and is committed to making her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy jackets and other items.

loans.name: Herbie

texts.en:
As a married parent of seven children, Herbie works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice.

Herbie is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Herbie has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Gemmalyn

texts.en:
Gemmalyn, age 26, runs an upholstery business to make her living. This hard-working entrepreneur has been engaged in her business for 10 years.

She and her husband have one child, who is still attending school. She works hard to provide for her family.

Gemmalyn requested a loan in the amount of PhP 17,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy upholstery materials and to pay for equipment maintenance.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy upholstery materials and to pay for equipment maintenance

loans.name: Ma. Nimpha

texts.en:
Ma. Nimpha is 35 years old, married, and has five children, four of whom attend school. She works very hard to provide for them. Ma. Nimpha operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years.

Ma. Nimpha requested a loan from NWTF for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy items to sell such as canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items such as canned goods, beverages, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Therezinha

texts.en: Therezinha is a 56 year-old married mother of seven children who works hard to support her family. She is a teacher and her husband is in agriculture. Although the family works very hard, it is not enough for them to afford the cost of their son's education. This loan of $ 1,000 will allow Therezinha to help her son continue his studies in the university. She will use the loan to pay for registration, textbooks, and school supplies.  In the future, Therezinha hopes that her children are all well-educated and knowledgeable.

loans.use: to pay for registration, textbooks, and school supplies.

loans.name: Nabila

texts.en:
Nabila is a 44-year-old married woman living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of six children; one child is very young and fully dependent upon her. Her husband owns garments business, his practice is to buy fabrics from a wholesaler, dye it into multiple shades, sew garments and sell them in the market. He has lots of customers who like to buy garments from him. Due to new customers, the demand is increasing day by day but he does not have a sufficient amount of money to buy more fabrics.

Therefore, Nabila requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan so that her husband can buy more fabrics to fulfill the demand. She is in her third loan cycle and has shown an excellent repayment behavior. Nabila has already taken the loan from BRAC and is investing in the business. Nabila is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more fabrics for her husband's garments business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen, age 60, raises pigs to earn her living. She has been engaged in this business for four years now, and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She and her husband have three children.

Helen requested a loan in the amount of PhP 25,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to buy feed and other supplies for raising her pigs.

In the future, Helen would like to save sufficient money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for raising her pigs

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is 39 years old, married, and has five children, four of whom attend school. She works very hard to provide for them. Mary Ann operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years.

Mary Ann requested a loan from NWTF for 8,000 PHP, which she will use to buy items to sell such as beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items such as  beverages, canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Meraluna

texts.en:
Meraluna is 42 years old, married, and has nine children, four of whom attend in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Meraluna operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 20 years.

Meraluna requested a loan from NWTF for 6,000 PHP, which she will use to buy items to sell such as bread, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items such as bread, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
Irene, age 34, is a fish vendor. She has been engaged in her business for five years.

She and her husband have one child, and she works very hard to provide for her family.

Irene requested a loan in the amount of PhP 14,000 through NWTF. She will use her loan funds to purchase more fish to offer for sale to her customers.

She would eventually like to save sufficient money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fish to offer for sale

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a hardworking 27-year-old single man, who runs a double-service-provider business to improve and develop his living.
Hassan runs a computer entertainment services business. Residents of his region come to his shop, most of them seeking entertainment, while others might be students seeking certain information for projects they are working on.
Simultaneously, at the same location, Hassan provides his customers and many others with coffee and other hot drinks upon request, which he is developing so that one day he can expand both businesses properly.
Currently, Hassan is acquiring a  youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to buy new laptops for his computer entertainment services shop.

loans.use: to buy new laptops for his computer entertainment services shop

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: El Sr. Julio, es una persona de una edad de 27 años, vive en el departamento de Chuquisaca municipio de Monteagudo, en domicilio de sus suegros junto a su conyugue, el señor Julio cuenta con la capacitación y estudios de la carrera  Electrónico básico además de trabajos anteriores en talleres como empleado, el señor Julio iniciara su propio actividad de taller electrónico y generara  sus ingresos para ayudar a mantener a sus hijos y así  mismo pueda hacerse conocer en el mercado de Monteagudo. Con el préstamo que requiere el señor Julio destinara para la compra de herramientas de trabajo como ser llaves, scanner para vehículos  y otros, por lo cual el podrá iniciar sus actividades  servicio de electrónico en  general y de esa manera generar  ingresos de su actividad y así  podrá tener mejores condiciones de vida y poder tener un mejor bienestar y diario vivir tanto para el como para su familia e hijos.
texts.en:
Julio is 27 years old. He lives in the municipality of Monteagudo in Chuquisaca department, in his in-laws house together with his spouse. Julio has training and studies in Basic Electronics besides his past work in workshops as an employee. Julio will start his own electronic workshop business and generate income to help maintain his children and to make himself known in the Monteagudo market.

The loan that Julio is requesting will be used for the purchase of work tools like wrenches, a scanner for automobiles and others so that he can start his electronic service business. In this way he can generate income from his business and can have better living conditions, better well-being and daily life for himself and for his family.

loans.use: to buy work tools like wrenches, a scanner for automobiles and others and in this way generate economic income for his family.

loans.name: Sadia  Khakwani

texts.en:
Sadia is a 23 year old young lady living with her husband and two children in Multan,Pakistan. Sadia is responsible for the daily chores while her husband is the bread winner for the family and is very hardworking and passionate man about his work.

Her husband has been running an academy from 12 years now and it is very well known for its results in the area, even far away and it is quite profitable, but due to lack of savings, her husband is unable to buy the new furniture for his academy. That is why Sadia applied for the loan, so that the difficulty her husband is facing during his classes could be resolved.

Sadia is sure that her husband by mere his hardwork would be able to return the loan money. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy new furniture for her husband's school.

loans.name: Marcos Joel

texts.es:
Marcos, de 40 años de edad, está casado, su esposa es una mujer muy trabajadora, con la cual tuvo un hijo que hoy es un joven trabajador y tiene una niña de 5 años de edad.

Marcos, trabaja como pescador artesanal, esa es su labor desde muy joven cuando aprendió con sus tíos, sus actividades inician desde las 5:00 a.m. hasta las 3:00 de la tarde y esa es su rutina diaria porque es su única fuente de ingreso.  

Marcos, necesita el préstamo para comprar redes de pesca y un motor fuera de borda nuevo, porque el que tiene está en mal estado y su trabajo no rinde como debería.

El sueño principal de Marcos, es comprar otro equipo de pesca completo, para que su hijo trabaje aparte y tenga sus propios ingresos.
texts.en:
Marcos is 40 years old, and is married to a very hardworking woman, with whom he has a son who is a hardworking young man, and a daughter aged five.

Marcos works as a small-scale fisherman. He has done this since an early age, when he learned the trade from his uncles. He begins work at 5am, and works until 3pm. That is his daily routine since it is his only source of income.  

Marcos needs the loan to buy fishing nets and a new outboard motor, because his current one is in poor condition and does not perform as it should.

Marcos' biggest dream is to buy another full set of fishing equipment so that his son can work independently and earn his own income.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets and a new outboard motor.

loans.name: Elve

texts.en:
Elve is 31 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Elve is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Elve has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Welsy

texts.en:
Welsy is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 32 years old and has four children who are in school. She has a fishing business in the Philippines.

Welsy has requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fishing nets, and other materials needed in her business. She has been in this business for two years. In the future, Welsy would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Samaila

texts.en:
Samaila is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Samaila has the opportunity to attain yields of up to eight metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Samaila would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Samaila can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Samaila will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land. He is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family .

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Jared

texts.en:
Jared is a married man who has one child. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 12 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to service and maintain his motorcycle. He hopes that in the future he will be successful. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to service and maintain his motorcycle.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 30 years old, married, and has three children who are presently in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines.

Janet has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs. She has been in this business for five years now. In the future, Janet would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Licel

texts.en:
Licel is 31 years old and married with five children. With four children in school, she works very hard to provide for them. Licel runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Licel has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Yvytu Group

texts.es:
15 son las mujeres que se integran este grupo, ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando y esforzándose para mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Este es un grupo nuevo que tiene las esperanzas puestas en las capacitaciones y programas que ofrece la fundación paraguaya.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mirna, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que se esfuerza por poder mejorar sus condicione de vida a través de su esfuerzo y lucha. Ella tiene una despensa bien surtida gracias a la cual tiene los medios para mantener a su familia.
Pide este préstamo ya que quiere mejorar la cantidad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes, como ser verduras, carne, frutas, panificados, enlatados y otros, y con ello poder seguir con su emprendimiento luchando.
texts.en:
15 women make up this group. They are in a program of poverty elimination, fighting and striving to improve their life conditions. This is a new group that has their hopes placed in the training and programs which the Fundación Paraguaya offers. One of the members is Ms. Mirna, who in her poll showed a poverty level within the first level, which means that she strives to be able to improve her living conditions through her effort and struggle. She has a well stocked store thanks to which she has the means to support her family. 

She asks for this loan as she wants to improve the quantity of products that she offers to her clients, such as vegetables, meat, fruits, baked goods, canned goods, and other goods. With it, she can continue with her undertaking fighting.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, fruits, baked goods, canned goods and other goods.

loans.name: Hemed

texts.en:
Hemed is a 31-year-old father of one, who is is a timber expert and supplier, a profession he enjoys much.

This is his second borrowing to finance his business, after repaying the previous loan successfully.  

He will use the money to purchase timber and hardware accessories for resale at a profit.

With the anticipated profits, Hemed will be able to repay his loan. 

He hopes to own a wholesale hardware business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase timber and hardware accessories.

loans.name: Elina

texts.en:
This is Elina's second time borrowing after successfully repaying her loan. 

Her business has since grown, and now she wants to purchase more dry fish for resale.

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to educate her children. 

In future, she hopes to have a successful business as well as a happy family.

loans.use: to purchase more dry fish for resale.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of four children, Evelyn works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of groceries to sell from her general store business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jinkey

texts.en:
Jinkey is a 32-year-old married woman with one child who is still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Jinkey has a fruit vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more bananas to sell in her stall.

She has been in this business for 5 years. Jinkey would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is 59 years old and has seven children. She is widowed and has one child in school. She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines.

Erlinda has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 17 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Erlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Edwin Emilio

texts.es:
El señor Edwin es un mecánico de motos y carros muy experimentado. Ha adquirido muchas habilidades a través de pequeños estudios en diferentes academias y otra parte la ha aprendido empíricamente.

Adicional a su labor como mecánico también tiene un pequeño almacén de venta de repuestos automotrices en el cual ofrece distintos tipos de repuestos en diferentes marcas.

Es un hombre muy trabajador y honrado que conoce el significado que tienen los automóviles para sus dueños y es por esto que siempre trata de ofrecer un excelente servicio, de buena calidad y de una manera eficiente.

El solicita un préstamo para surtir su almacén con gran cantidad de repuestos, de este modo podrá tener los productos disponibles para sus clientes
texts.en:
Señor Edwin is a very experienced car and motorcycle mechanic. He has acquired many skills through small studies in different academies and others he has learned empirically.

In addition to his work as a mechanic he also has a small store selling auto parts, where he offers different types of spare parts in different brands.

He is a very hardworking and honest man, who knows the significance that the automobiles have for their owners. That is why he always tries to provide excellent service, of high quality and in an efficient manner.

He is requesting a loan to stock his store with lots of parts, and thus he may have the products available for his customers.

loans.use: to stock his store with a grand quantity of spare parts.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
This is Joyce's seventh borrowing from VisionFund Kenya  which she will use to complete constructing her rental houses for the occupants to settle in a conducive environment.

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to purchase a laptop and other educational stationery required by her daughter who has joined the college.  

Joyce serviced her previous loans well,  and hopes to continue with borrowing with VisionFund Kenya in order to build more affordable rentals in her community a she deals with the tragedy called poverty.

loans.use: to complete constructing her rental houses for the occupants to settle in a conducive environment.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 59 years old and has one child in school.

Lucena has a welding shop business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more welding materials for her business. Lucena has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more welding materials for her business.

loans.name: Juna

texts.en:
Juna is 54 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, bread, milk, coffee, sugar, eggs, shampoo and other snack foods.

Juna has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, bread, milk, coffee, sugar, eggs, shampoo and other snack foods.

loans.name: Maria Cruz

texts.es:
María, de 55 años de edad, nunca estudio, está soltera y vive solo con su hijo el cual se dedica a la agricultura.

María, trabaja la agricultura desde hace muchos años y ella se lo inculco a su hijo el que actualmente trabaja con ella en este trabajo; ella tiene una parcela donde cultiva maíz cerca de su casa y trabaja todos los días por las mañanas.

María, necesita el préstamo para comprar abono y fertilizantes para los cultivos que tiene. 

El sueño principal de María, es obtener buenas cosechas y que su hijo encuentre una buena mujer para que se case.
texts.en:
María is 55 years old, never studied, is single, and lives with her son who works in agriculture.

María has worked in agriculture for many years, and she taught her son how to farm. He now works with her. She has a plot of land near her home where she grows corn. She works every day in the morning.

María needs the loan to buy compost and fertilisers for her crops. 

Her biggest dream is to get a good harvest, and for her son to meet a good woman and get married.

loans.use: to buy compost and fertilisers for her crops.

loans.name: Jose Baltazar

texts.es:
José, de 37 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, luego estudio un poco de electromecánica automotriz, está casado y vive con su esposa y sus 3 hijos los cuales estudian y su esposa trabaja en casa.

José, se dedica a trabajar como electromecánico desde hace 8 años, desde que se interesó en trabajar con los carros le apasiono eso y ha trabajado en ello siempre.- Ahora tiene un taller en el centro de la ciudad, en el cual trabaja de lunes a sábado desde las 7:00 a.m. hasta las 5:00 p.m. y en ocasiones su hermano trabaja con él.

José, necesita el préstamo para comprar repuestos para vehículos, para tenerlos a la venta porque hay momentos que se necesitan piezas o repuestos nuevos o usados y tiene que mandar a los clientes a otro lugar, porque no los tiene.

José, sueña con tener más herramientas para su taller y que sus hijos sean persona de bien y profesionales.
texts.en:
José is 37 years old. He studied until the 6th grade, then he studied a little automotive electromechanics. He is married and lives with his wife who works at home and his three children who study.

José has earned a living for eight years as an mechanic who specializes in electrical systems, since he became interested in working with cars. That inspired him and he has always worked in it since. Now he has a garage in the city center, in which he works from Monday to Saturday from 7 am until 5 pm. His brother occasionally works with him.

José needs the loan in order to buy spare car parts to have for sale, because there are times when new or used pieces or spares are needed and he has to send clients to another place because he does not have them.

José dreams of having more tools for his garage and of his children being good people and professionals.

loans.use: to buy spare car parts.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is an enthusiastic entrepreneur who wants to thrive by growing his business. His company is a mobile servicing company that offers mobile retail services to its clients. These services include money transfer, withdrawing and depositing. In addition to that, the company deals in airtime credits, electricity voucher selling and mobile technical support services.

Fred's business is located in rural Northeast Rwanda near the Uganda border. His regular clients are people from his village, but he also does a significant portion of his transactions from people crossing the border by bus. Being able to transfer money, even small amounts, from mobile phone to mobile phone is a revolutionary resource in rural areas. Often when people move to the city for better jobs and economic opportunities, they want to send money back to their families in the rural villages. Through Fred's business, he is creating an opportunity for people in the villages to receive money without having to take long bus rides or relying on other people to deliver cash.

Fred is doing very well in business. He is well-known in the community as a highly motivated entrepreneur and a reliable person. However, he is not meeting all his clients’ demand. With working capital of about $4,000 USD, Fred will be able to triple his business to meet the growing demand for his services. 

AEC has been working with Fred for about six months, and he has continued to be motivated and inspiring. AEC previously gave Fred a small loan, which he paid off always on time. AEC is thrilled to help Fred with his growth plans, enabling him to support many more people in his community. Fred is very successful and has always fulfilled his payment obligations, and this time will not be different. 

Thank you for your interest in Fred and for your support of his dream!

loans.use: to increase his mobile money transfer working capital to meet demand in his rural village.

loans.name: Jessa

texts.en:
Jessa is 21 years old and single. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a 6,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Jessa has been in this business for 1 year now, and has borrowed 1 time in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Jessa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Rosalie works hard to support her family. She has a business raising pigs in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Rosalie is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies for her pig raising business.

Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies.

loans.name: Gladys Margarita

texts.es: La venta de calzado es el principal ingreso para Gladys, quien es madre de cuatro hijos y todos dependen de ella, es por tal razón que Gladys invierte constantemente en su negocio; poco a poco ha logrado invertir en su negocio y los resultados siempre han sido positivos, es por tal razón que, Gladys solicita un préstamo, el cual planea invertirlo en la compra de calzado de mejor calidad, el que espera ofrecer en esta temporada navideña y obtener buenas ganancias, que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Footwear sales are the main source of income for Gladys. She is the mother of four children who all depend on her which is the reason why Gladys is constantly investing in her business. Little by little she has managed to invest in her business and the results have always been positive.

It is for this reason that Gladys is applying for a loan which she plans to invest in buying better quality shoes. She hopes to sell these in the coming Christmas period and make a good profit in order to enable her to improve her own and family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy better quality shoes.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es:
Rosalina, de 39 años de edad, tiene dos hijos pero solo una depende directamente de ella y viven en casa propia. 

Rosalina, trabaja como sastre en su casa, esta labor la aprendió gracias a un taller que impartieron en su comunidad financiado por una ONG; esto le permitió aprender este oficio para generar ingresos para su familia; actualmente trabaja como vendedora de ropa y trapeadores en el mercado, estos productos en su mayoría son confeccionado por ella misma y su horario de venta es de 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 2:00 de la tarde.

El dinero lo necesita para comprar tela para confeccionar ropa y trapeadores, porque en los últimos meses la demanda ha crecido.

El sueño principal de Rosalina, es que en su negocio prospere y poder vender sus productos en otras zonas.
texts.en:
Rosalina, 39, has two children, but only one is directly dependent on her, and they live in their own home. Rosalina works as a seamstress at home. She learned this work thanks to a workshop given in her community funded by an NGO. This allowed her to learn this trade in order to generate income for her family. She currently works as a seller of clothes and mops in the market. These products are mostly made by her and her sales schedule is from 8:00 am to 2:00 pm.

She needs the money to buy fabric for clothing and mops, because in recent months demand has grown. Rosalina’s main dream is for her business to thrive and to be able to sell her products in other areas.

loans.use: buy fabric to make clothing and mops.

loans.name: Phoky Group

texts.en:
Mampolokeng is a 65-year-old mother of 5 children, ages 13 to 26. She not only takes care of her children but also has to take care of her elderly husband, who has become bedridden due to old age and illness. Mampolokeng lives in a small, traditional hut that is not well ventilated and does not warm up well in the winter. She works long hours to ensure there is enough food for her family. During the week, she has to wake up very early, between 3 and 4 am, to start preparing the fire for cooking breakfast, heating water to help bathe her elderly aunt, and warming the house for her young children who go to school.

Collecting firewood, setting up the fire, and doing the actual cooking demand a lot of her time. Temperatures in the Lesotho highlands are never really high; winters can get very cold, and often Mampolokeng has to start the fire inside her hut. Starting a fire releases smog and smoke, which, when inhaled in large quantities over a period of time, can lead to lung diseases, eye problems, and, in the worst cases, to death. In these circumstances, life for women like Mampolokeng has been very difficult.

ACE has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to be able to sell clean cookstoves on credit. The stoves will provide Mampolokeng and 11 other people from her village, who are living in the same circumstances, the chance of cooking in a way that does not harm them and their families and that neither requires a lot of wood, which is hard to find in Lesotho, nor requires expensive paraffin and gas . This stove can be started with the use of very small amounts of readily available biomass, like dry twigs and dry cow dung, which do not require significant lengths of time to collect. It does not produce smoke while burning, thus making it safe to be used inside the home.

This stove comes with a solar panel for charging the battery that runs the fan in the stove, a USB port for charging phones, and a mini LED lamp. A life-improving package for these people, this stove saves them time to be with their families, saves energy, eliminates the threats of toxic inhalation and house fires, and gives them a better lit home in the evening while cooking and while the children are doing their homework. For more stove information, please see www.africancleanenergy.com

loans.use: to pay for an African Clean Energy (ACE) stove, which will improve her health, save her money on fuel, and save the time she spends collecting firewood.

loans.name: Nasreen Bibi

texts.en:
Nasreen is a house working woman, and a mother of five children residing in the area of Multan, Pakistan. Her son runs a cloth overlock machine at a shop, from which he generates a reasonable amount of money. He contributes to the family and also saves an amount for himself.

Now he is well experienced with the machinery and wants to buy his own, so that he can get better profits and increase his living. Therefore, Nasreen his mother, applied for the loan amount 50,000 PKR, so that her son can buy the machine and earn better. Further, she is thankful to the Kiva team and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy an overlock machine for her son.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Leah works hard to support her family. She has a fruit vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Leah is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy more fruits like apples, oranges, bananas, pineapples, etc.

Leah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits like apples, oranges, bananas, pineapples, etc.

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita is 50 years old and married with five children. She works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Rita has been in this business for six years and has previously received funds through Kiva. Rita aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Vilma Maria

texts.es:
Para Vilma, la familia y el trabajo son las dos cosas más importantes en la vida, es por eso que ella trata de ser exitosa en ambas cosas, por un lado trata de ser la mejor madre para sus hijos y por otra parte intenta mejorar cada día su negocio.
Vilma posee una pulpería, que está ubicada en casa en donde ofrece artículos varios, como, gaseosas, galletas, golosinas, reposterías entre otras cosas, sin embargo, Vilma siente que eso no es suficiente y necesita crecer, es por eso que está solicitando un nuevo crédito, que le permita comprar granos básicos y un freezer, el cual le permitirá vender otro tipo de productos y de esta forma aumentar sus ganancias; con las cuales espera empezar a mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
For Vilma, family and work are the two most important things in life, and so she tries to be successful at both. On one hand, she is trying to be the best mother for her children, and on the other hand, she is trying to improve her business everyday.

Vilma owns a grocery store, which is set up in her house, where she sells a variety of items, including sodas, cookies, snacks, and pastries, among other things. However, Vilma feels that it’s not enough and that she needs to grow. She is asking for a new loan to buy basic grains and a freezer, which will allow her to sell different kinds of products and increase her earnings. She wants to use the earnings to begin improving her home.

loans.use: to buy basic grains and a freezer.

loans.name: Lenny

texts.en:
Lenny works hard to support her family. She is single with one child and has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, cooking oil, eggs, shampoo and other snack foods.

Lenny has been in this business for one year now, and also earns additional income from food vending. In the future, Lenny would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more items of groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, cooking oil, eggs, shampoo and other snack foods.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 37 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 6,000 Philippines Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like bread, dried fish, canned goods, and other groceries.

Lucia has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Lucia aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like bread, dried fish, canned goods, and other groceries

loans.name: Ma. Reina

texts.en:
Ma. Reina is 38 years old and single.

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Ma. Reina requested a 15,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Ma. Reina has been in this business for seven years now and has borrowed eight times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Salvador Enrique

texts.es:
Salvador, de 40 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casado y vive con su esposa y su pequeña hija que estudia primer grado y su esposa trabaja vendiendo tortillas.

Salvador, trabaja como taxista, el hace viajes en su vehículo a personas privadas desde hace 7 años, fue un amigo quien lo motivo para dedicarse a este trabajo y ahora lo desempeña desde las 7:00 a.m. hasta las 7:00 p.m. en el centro de la ciudad.

Salvador, necesita el préstamo para reparar su vehículo, el cual es su herramienta de trabajo y tiene un desperfecto mecánico y no puede trabajar si no lo repara.

El sueño de Salvador, es tener una flota de taxi y ver crecer a su pequeña hija.
texts.en:
Salvador is 40 years old, and left school after the sixth grade. He is married and lives with his wife, who works selling tortillas, and his young daughter, who studies in the first grade.

Salvador works as a taxi driver. He has transported people in his vehicle for seven years, after a friend encouraged him to work as a driver. Nowadays, he works from 7am to 7pm in the city centre.

Salvador needs the loan to repair his vehicle, which is his work tool and has a mechanical problem. He is unable to work until he repairs it.

Salvador dreams of having a fleet of taxis and seeing his young daughter grow up.

loans.use: to repair his vehicle.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 42 years old. She is married and blessed with four children. 

Her business is farming and livestock keeping. She has been in the business for 10 years. 

She earns a monthly income of 8,000 Kenya shillings. 

This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya. She will use the loan to buy a water tank for storage of water during dry season so as to facilitate irrigation. 

She will use the profits from her expanded business to invest in her farming business. Her hopes and dreams are to have a happy family and a successful business.

loans.use: to buy a water tank for storage of water during dry season so as to facilitate irrigation

loans.name: Wilkister

texts.en:
Wilkister is a married woman who has one child. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells vitenge (african attire). She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of vitenge. She hopes that in the future she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to cater for family needs.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vitenge.

loans.name: Mupa

texts.en:
Mupa is married and has five children. She describes herself to be proactive. She operates a retail business selling clothes, basins, dust bins, pegs, and other items, which she has been doing for four years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Mupa requested a loan for 20,000 KES, which she will use to buy more stock of basins, dust bins, clothes, and other items. She hopes to be successful in the future. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her home.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of basins, dust bins, clothes, and other items.

loans.name: Ma. Mae

texts.en:
Ma. Mae is 38 years old and married with four children, and one child is still in school. She works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, bread, milk, coffee, sugar, eggs, shampoo and other snack foods.

Ma. Mae has been in this business for three years. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, noodles, breads, milk, coffee, sugar, eggs, shampoo and other snack foods.

loans.name: José Luis

texts.es:
José, de 55 años de edad, estudio solamente hasta segunda grado y tuvo que trabajar desde muy pequeño porque la situación económica era muy difícil, está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos.

José, desde hace diez años se dedica al negocio de camarón, después de los acuerdos de paz que hubieron después de la guerra civil, una institución los capacito para la siembra de camarón, antes de eso se dedicaba a la agricultura, pero este trabajo no le daba buenas ganancias, luego decidió sembrar camarones y se dio cuenta que es mucho más rentable.

Tiene un estanque a 8 kilómetros de su casa y para trasladarse hasta ese lugar lo hace en un pick-up, en donde los cuida y alimenta, esa es su rutina de trabajo y en los días libres se queda en casa para descansar y dedicar tiempo a su esposa.                                                                                                                                                                                                                   El préstamo lo necesita para comprar concentrado para alimentar los camarones, para que crezcan con mayor rapidez y obtener ganancias en menor tiempo. 
                    
El sueño de José, es mejorar su vivienda porque aún le faltan algunos detalles, además de eso también quiere comprar un vehículo para trasportar la mercancía al mercado.
texts.en:
José, 55, only studied until 2nd grade and had to work from a very young age because the economic situation was very hard.  He is married.  His wife 
takes care of household chores. 

José has been working for two years in the shrimp business.  After the peace accords that there were after the civil war, an institution trained them to raise shrimp.  Before that he worked in agriculture, but that work did not provide him with good profits.  Later he decided to raise shrimp and he realized it was much more profitable.

He has a pond 8 kilometers from his house where he looks after and feeds the shrimp.  He gets there in a pick-up truck.  That is his work routine, and on his days off he stays home to rest and spend time with his wife. 

He needs this loan to buy feed for the shrimp, so they will grow more rapidly, in order to gain better profits in less time.                                                                                                                
                    
José's dream is to make improvements to his house, because there are still a few things to be done.  He also wants to buy a vehicle so he can take his product to market.

loans.use: to buy feed for his shrimp, so they grow more quickly, in order to obtain better profits in less time.

loans.name: Santa Fe 2 Group

texts.es:
Cesar, de 33 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus padres en el municipio de Togopala, Intibucá. Él se dedica al cultivo y venta de papa desde hace 8 años, esta actividad la realiza en unos terrenos cercanos a su casa. La producción la vende en el mercado local del municipio. Cesar está solicitando préstamo en forma grupal, lleva el segundo ciclo con la institución el cual va invertir en la compra de semilla de papa, fertilizantes e insecticidas para siembra y mantenimiento del cultivo de papa, esto le ayudara a mejorar sus cultivos y no tener pérdidas. Su meta es Ofrecer productos de calidad que le ayude a obtener mejores ventas y así poder construir su vivienda que es su gran sueño.
El Grupo se llama Santa Fe 2, se dedican a la agricultura, viven en la misma comunidad y están solicitando la cantidad de 26,400 Lempiras para el cultivo de papa. En la fotografía se identifican de la siguiente manera: a la izquierda esta  Florentino, José, Javier, Rodolfo y Cesar a la derecha.
texts.en:
Cesar, 33, is single and lives with his parents in the village of Togopala, Intibucá. He has worked in the cultivation and sales of potatoes for 8 years; he works this trade on land near his home. He sells the product in the local village market. Cesar is requesting a loan as a group member; he is in his second cycle with the institution. He will invest the loan in the purchase of potato seed, fertilizer, and insecticides for planting and maintenance of the potato crop. This will help him to improve his crops and to have no losses. His goal is to provide quality products that will help him get better sales and thus be able to build the home that is his great dream.

The group is called Santa Fe 2. They work in agriculture, live in the same community and are requesting the amount of 26,400 lempiras for growing potatoes. In the photo they are identified as follows: on the left are Florentino, José, Javier, and Rodolfo; Cesar is on the right.

loans.use: buy potato seed, fertilizer, and insecticides for planting and maintenance of the crop.

loans.name: Esmira

texts.en:
Esmira is 32 years old. She is a refugee from the Bilasuvar IDP settlement. Esmira has a large family. Her family consists of 3 children, her husband and her parents in law.

She is a farmer and her children are supported by her. She knows that she must work hard for her family's needs. For this, she wakes up very early morning and takes care of the animals in her yard, like cattle and sheep. She fattens them and then sell their meat in the market.

Esmira has 10 years' experience and this has made her a great expert in the field. Meat is in great demand in Azerbaijan. People like meat for traditional food like kufta, bozbash and kebabs.

Esmira sells her animals' natural meat in the local bazaar. Her kids and husband also support her in her daily activities. Currently she is planning on buying 4 calves and needs a 1800 AZN loan.

Hopefully KIVA lenders will support her.

loans.use: to buy 4 calves

loans.name: Nicasia

texts.en:
Nicasia is a married woman from Catigbian, Bohol. Her husband is a farmer and she helps her husband on the farm. They raised their family through this livelihood for more than 21 years. It is their main source of income.

Nicasia and her husband need a loan to buy a water buffalo, known as a carabao in the Philippines, to help them plow their rice field.

She needs a loan of PHP 18,000. Nicasia hopes to improve their farming system and lower their cost for laborers.

loans.use: to buy a water buffalo known as a carabao.

loans.name: Sabina

texts.en:
Sabina is 41 years old. She is an unmarried lady with two children. 

She has been selling clothes for the last eight years and it has been profitable. She has requested for her second loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 100,000 which she will be using  to purchase more stock of new clothes.

With the anticipated profits, she will be able to expand her clothes business. 

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to educate her children to university level.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of new clothes

loans.name: Justus

texts.en:
Justus is 21 years old. He is not married and still does not have children yet. 

He has had a retail shop business for one year and has requested for a loan which he will use to purchase maize, beans, sugar, salt, milk, tea leaves and soaps, and hopes this will help him to expand his retail shop.

This is his second loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES. 25,000.

His hopes and dreams for the future are to build a house and get married.

loans.use: to purchase maize, beans, sugar, salt, milk, tea leaves and soaps

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es: La Señora Máxima tiene 35 años es de la comunidad de Lazareto  que es una zona productora de maíz, papa, durazno tiene 5 hijos, de los cuales 3 ya son independientes, la señora actualmente está casada, ella y su esposo tienen sus propias tierras y se dedican a la agricultura por más de 10 años en casi una hectárea de terreno ellos producen y venden papa de la variedad la rojita y también producen maíz, provienen de una familia humilde y trabajadora con buenos valores, por razones económicas no pudieron completar sus estudios dedicándose a la agricultura desde muy jóvenes y viven día a día luchando por el sustento y educación de su familia, la Sra. Máxima necesita el préstamo para la compra de semilla de papa, esto será de beneficio ya que lograra incrementar su producción ya que en convenio de un familiar quiere producir a medias para de esa manera poder mejorar sus ingresos y poder ofrecer a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
35-year-old Ms. Máxima is from the community of Lazareto, which is a corn, potato, and peach producing region. She has 5 children, of whom 3 are already independent. This woman is currently married.

She and her husband have their own land and have earned a living in agriculture for more than 10 years. In almost one hectare of land, they produce and sell small, red potatoes, and corn as well. They come from a humble, hard-working family with good values. Due to economic reasons, they could not complete their education, earning a living in agriculture since they were very young. They live day to day fighting for their family's support and education.

Ms. Máxima needs a loan in order to buy potato seeds. This will be beneficial since she will manage to boost her production since she is in an agreement with a relative who wants to produce half with her and in that way be able to improve her income and offer her family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds in order to increase her production.

loans.name: Darwina

texts.en:
Darwina is 36 years old, married and has two children who attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Darwina sells bananas in the Philippines, which she has been doing for 12 years.

Darwina requested a loan from NWTF for 40,000 PHP, which she will use to purchase more bananas to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Julievic

texts.en:
Julievic is 21 years old and has one child. Julievic works very hard to provide for her family.

Julievic runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Julievic has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Julievic would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is a 45-year-old widow with five children, two currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Mary Jane has a food-production business in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her business.

Mary Jane has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food-production business.

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.en:
Maria Cristina is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 56 years old and has one child in school.

Maria Cristina has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell.

Maria Cristina has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Merily

texts.en:
Merily is a 58-year-old married woman with four children; one child is still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Merily has a buy and sell used clothes business in the Philippines. Merily requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more boxes of used clothes to sell.

Merily has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more boxes of used clothes to sell

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a 31-year-old married woman with three children; two children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Elsie has a food vending business in the Philippines. Elsie requested a PHP 6000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as flour, sugar, spices, etc..

Elsie has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Elsie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business such as flour, sugar, and spices.

loans.name: Kasturi's Group

texts.en:
Kasturi, standing to the extreme left hand side in the photograph, is engaged in the making and selling of brooms in Koraput district in the state of Odisha, India. Kasturi, along with her husband (a labourer by profession), is striving to make a living to provide a better life to their two sons (aged 15 and 18).

The main challenge she faces is the inability to buy the raw materials for making the brooms in bulk. And, the reason for the inability? Lack of finances. After facing this challenge for a long time, Kasturi made up her mind to borrow a loan and expand her business. She wishes to improve the family’s financial conditions through the increased income.

With a strong conviction and commitment, she, along with her other group members, approached Kiva's partner People's Forum to borrow a loan of 36,000 INR. Kasturi will use her portion of the loan amount to buy the required raw materials for her business in bulk so as to increase her level of output and improve her monthly income from 2,000 INR. Your contribution could make a difference in her life!

Kasturi is eagerly awaiting your kind hearts to help her.

loans.use: to buy the required raw materials for her business in bulk.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman who has no children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, she has operated a business selling clothes. She sells door-to-door to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces major challenges of high cost of transportation and seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting of KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Blanca Estela

texts.es:
Blanca, de 26 años de edad, está acompañada, vive junto a su pareja e hija.

Blanca, se dedica a la venta de antojitos y pupusas todos los días por las tardes, ella comenzó con este negocio porque los ingresos de su pareja solo provenían de la agricultura y no alcanzaban para los gastos del hogar. 

Blanca, necesita el préstamo para comprar materia prima para la pupuseria como quesillo, chicharon, harina y otros insumos que necesita para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

El sueño de Blanca, es mejorar su vivienda y brindar una buena atención a los clientes en su pupuseria para que sus ventas incrementen.
texts.en:
Blanca is 26 years old and lives with her partner and daughter. Blanca makes her living selling pupusas (stuffed corn tortillas) and other traditional snacks every afternoon. She started this business because her partner's entire income came from agriculture and wasn't sufficient to pay all household expenses.

Blanca needs this loan to buy raw ingredients such as fresh cheese, pork rinds, flour, etc. for her pupusa restaurant so she can offer better service to her clients. Blanca's dream is to make improvements on her house and provide good service to the patrons of her pupusa restaurant to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients such as fresh cheese, pork rinds, flour, etc. for her pupusa (stuffed corn tortillas) restaurant.

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Mathew is excited that Babban Gona offers a lasting solution to ending the cycle of poverty, renewing his dreams of gaining wealth someday.

Traditionally, Mathew would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs for food and clothing. As a member of Babban Gona, Mathew can store his maize at harvest and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. Benefiting from Babban Gona’s marketing support, Mathew has the opportunity to generate earnings of up to $2,000 per hectare of land.

Mathew is thankful that he no longer has to worry about having no money to increase his farmland and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post-secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating the pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Saidu

texts.en:
Saidu is a maize farmer from Dankwaire Village. As a Babban Gona member, Saidu is excited to have access to a trained agronomist and superior inputs that will give him the chance to achieve high yields of up to 8 metric tonnes of maize per hectare of land -- 5.5 times higher than the average Nigerian farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Saidu would've had to sell his maize at harvest -- when the price of maize is at it’s lowest -- to meet his immediate cash needs for items such as food and clothing. As a Babban Gona member Saidu can store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a period later on in the season when he can obtain the best price for his maize up to 37% higher than market price at harvest.

Thanks to the support from Babban Gona’s marketing services, Saidu no longer feels the pressure to sell his maize at low harvest prices. With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Saidu hopes to realize better yields and plans to use his additional income to diversify his farm and grow other crops.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Kavoka Shg Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Annalizer; a member of Kavoka SHG group.  She is 32 years old, and married with 3 children.  She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from the trainings especially enterprise development.

Annalizer operates a fruits & vegetables selling business.  She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy assorted fruits to increase her stock, hence enable her earn more income.  She intends to use the increased income to pay school fees for her son. 

Annalizer is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.  She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy assorted fruits for her fruits & vegetables sales business.

loans.name: Ziad

texts.en:
Ziad, age 37, became a farmer 15 years ago in order to support the needs and expenses of his wife and family. Ziad is from Syria. He is a hard worker with ambition and a wide range of experience in the agricultural domain.

The home in which Ziad lives with his family needs essential repairs and renovations before the winter season begins. However, Ziad's earnings are not enough to cover any expenses beyond the immediate requirements of his family. He has therefore requested a loan from Kiva field partner Al Majmoua. He will use his loan funds to renovate his house before winter, so that he can provide his children with a healthier and safer home.

Ziad hopes to improve his ability to provide his family with decent living conditions.

loans.use: to renovate his house before winter, so that he can provide his children with a healthier and safer home

loans.name: Mouin

texts.en:
Mouin is a 23-year-old single man who left school at early age to help in covering the needs and expenses of his family that consists of seven members. He started, six years ago, working in livestock trade. He gained experience in this domain from his parents.

Mouin has a good reputation in his region. He is working hard to develop his business, thus today he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase his merchandise with goats to satisfy his customers' requests.

Mouin hopes to expand his business in the future to increase his income and become able to build his own future and life.

loans.use: to increase his merchandise with goats to satisfy his customers' requests

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es: La señora Carmen Rosa es oriunda del Departamento de Cochabamba provincia de Tiraque del municipio de Chimore población de Valle hermoso es concubinada y madre de un hijo, la señora Carmen Rosa es una mujer muy humilde, trabajadora y responsable que se vino a trabajar desde muy joven junto a su concubino el señor Rolando, actualmente trabajan con el sindicato Litoral del municipio de Chimore  en busca de oportunidades mejores para su familia trabajando en diferentes lugar del trópico de Cochabamba realizando trabajo de cosechas de diferentes tipo de cultivos y mantenimientos de productos agrícolas. Con el pasar de los tiempos lograron comprarse un lote agrícola  con una superficie de 9.6 hectáreas, la señora requiere un préstamo para poder ampliar y mejorar su producción y de esta manera generar mejores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Carmen Rosa is from the Cochabamba Department, Tiraque province of the Chimore town of Valle Hermoso. She is in a common-law relationship and has a son. 

Mrs. Carmen Rosa is a very humble, hardworking and responsible woman who came to work with her partner, Mr. Rolando, when she was very young.  They currently work with the Litoral union of the town of Chimore, looking for better opportunities for their family. They work on different areas of the tropic of Cochabamba, growing various types of crops and maintaining farm products.  With time, they were able to buy a farming lot of 9.6 acres. 

Mrs. Carmen Rosa requests a loan to be able to expand and improve her production in order to generate better income for her family.

loans.use: Expand and improve her yield in order to generate better income for her family.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma operates a clothing shop to earn her living. She has been engaged in this enterprise for five years. Her business is located in a popular place, and her primary customers are women. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Mwanajuma lives with her husband in Mombasa.

She will use her Kes 50,000 loan to replenish her store's clothing inventory. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock. Her five-year goal is to improve and maintain the stability of her business.

This is Mwanajuma's second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to replenish her store's clothing inventory

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 54 years old, married, and has five children. She works very hard to provide for them. Nenita operates a general store in the Philippines, which she has been doing for five years.

Nenita requested a loan from NWTF for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy items to sell such as canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items such as canned goods, snack foods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a 47-year-old married woman with four children; two of her children are currently in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Delia has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Delia requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell.

Delia has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Delia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Nyamvula

texts.en:
Nyamvula is a widowed woman with seven children, one of whom attends school and the others are grownups. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years, she has operated a business of buying and selling livestock, selling at the market to local neighbours. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.

With the loan that she is requesting, she wants to purchase goats and cows for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase goats and cows for resale.

loans.name: Nasiru

texts.en:
Nasiru is a Babban Gona maize farmer. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Nasiru is thankful that days of poor yields are long gone. As a Babban Gona member, he has the opportunity to achieve yields of up to 8 metric tons of maize per hectare of land, 5.5 times the yield of the average Nigerian farmer.

Traditionally, Nasiru would have had to sell his maize for low prices at harvest to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. With Babban Gona’s support, Nasiru will store the maize he harvests and delay its sale until a date later in the season, when he can obtain a significantly higher price for his maize, at a premium up to 37% more than the harvest price.

With the opportunity to earn up to $2000 per hectare of land, Nasiru now has the opportunity to realize his dream to grow his agriculture business for himself and family members. He would like to use this additional profit to purchase a motorbike and to conduct his agricultural business activities with.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Sunadei's Group

texts.en:
Sunadei, standing to the extreme right in the photograph, is a single mother and worries about her son’s future, as their family income is just enough for subsistence. When faced with a problem, Sunadei did what pragmatic people do --- she stuck to her strengths. And, being an artistic woman, weaving is something that flows in her very veins.

She started weaving in earnest with an aim to sell her cloth to traders and earn something over their existing income. Slowly, she became an expert. Her specialty is weaving fabrics with dual borders. News of her expertise spread to nearby villages, and she started getting special orders. With experience, her quality and quantity of weaving both improved.

Her designs are always flawless. With her business all set, she is now looking to expand. Therefore, she, along with her other group members, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to procure raw materials for her trade.

Sunadei is awaiting your kind help and support.

loans.use: to procure raw materials for her trade.

loans.name: Antonia Estela

texts.en:
Antonia is in her mid-50's, and she is a single mother of 3 marvelous kids. She has had a hard time raising her kids on her own, but she has always found a way to move ahead. She is proud of herself and her family.

Antonia has been making a living by teaching at a high school. She has been in this line of work for more than half of her life. She loves her work teaching young children and is always looking to improve herself. She tries to learn something new every day.

Antonia is looking to improve 2 aspects of her life. She wants to fix some small details of her kitchen and she also wants to take a training course that will upgrade the quality of her teaching lessons. However, in order to accomplish these short term goals, she is applying for a 8,000 MXN loan from Kiva, through Kubo Financial.

loans.use: to pay for a training course.

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.en:
Dilrabo lives with her family in the North part of Tajikistan. She is kind and ambitious woman. Dilrabo is married and has 2 children. Her children are non-adults. Her husband is a migrant in Russia. Dilrabo always wanted to start her own business deal in in this way to get ahead.

Four months ago Dilrabo started her own business deal with sewing national woman dresses. She sews national woman dresses in her house where she has a workshop. Dilrabo is going to buy a new sewing machine to make the quality of her services, thus develop more business. She is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni to buy a sewing machine. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine for developing new business.

loans.name: Nyevu

texts.en: Nyevu is a widowed woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal.
