She has been involved in this business for 9 years. Her primary customers are regular. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. Her business goal is to expand business within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Emilia

texts.en:
Emilia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has had a fruit vending business in the Philippines for 30 years. She earns additional income from food vending. Emilia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell in her fruit stand.

Emilia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell in her fruit stand.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en: Milagros, 59 years old, is married and has five children, one child still in school, Milagros works very hard to provide for them. For the past two years, Milagros has run a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, cooking oil, eggs, shampoo and other snack foods, to sell. In the future Milagros would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, cooking oil, eggs, shampoo and other snack foods, to sell.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie, 32 years old, has four children, two of them in school. Rosalie works very hard to provide for them. For the past year, Rosalie has run a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items, such as bread, canned goods, junk foods, home care products and other groceries, to sell. In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items, such as bread, canned goods, junk foods, home care products and other groceries, to sell

loans.name: Debbie Jane

texts.en:
Debbie Jane is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Debbie Jane dreams that one day, She will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mylene

texts.en:
Mylene is 32 years old, married, and has two children; one child is still in school.

Mylene is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Mylene requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig.

Mylene has been in this business for 4 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Mylene would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pig

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a hollow blocks making business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy more tons of sand and sacks of cement for her business.

Leonora has been in this business for 5 years. Leonora earns more income from general store and raising pigs.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Leonora has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more tons of sand and sacks of cement for her business

loans.name: Amada

texts.es:
Elaborar y comercializar tortillas es algo que, Amada ha hecho a lo largo de 12 años, actualmente a sus 51 años Amada aún se siente con muchas ganas de trabajar y seguir luchando, para cumplir su sueño de terminar de construir su casa y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es por tal razón que Amada solicita un préstamo, el cual necesita para comprar leña y maíz que son utensilios e ingredientes esenciales para la elaboración de tortillas y sin los cuales Amada no podría trabajar.
texts.en:
Making and selling tortillas is something that Amada has done over the course of 12 years. Currently, at the age of 51, Amada still feels eager to work and she continues to strive, in order to fulfill her dream of finishing building her house and to improve her quality of life.

It is for this reason that Amada is applying for a loan, which she needs to buy firewood and corn, which are the tools and ingredients essential for the making of tortillas, and without which Amada would not be able to work.

loans.use: buy firewood and corn.

loans.name: Rajani's Group

texts.en:
Living in a village of Koraput district in Odisha, India, Rajani, standing in the middle in the photograph, is a determined woman who wishes to start earning a livelihood and improve her family's financial conditions. She has been into tailoring for an year and wishes to put this skill to best use. She draws her support from her husband, who works as a driver. Life is not easy for many people like Rajani and her husband, who get to save very little every month after their day-to-day expenses.

But, nothing deters their hope for a better future. Accordingly, Rajani now wants to sew happiness into her family's fabric. She, along with her other group members, has approached Kiva's partner People's Forum to access a loan of 36,000 INR.

She will use her portion of the loan amount to start her own tailoring business from home. She plans to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, etc. required for tailoring.

A helping hand that you lend would boost her confidence to start the new innings as an entrepreneur, as well as help her earn a better income to lead a better life.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, etc. required for tailoring.

loans.name: Rosa Angelica

texts.es:
Rosa, de 19 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, actualmente vive con sus padres.

Rosa, se dedica a la venta de verduras en un carro desde hace 5 años, esta actividad la realiza en las comunidades cercanas a la comunidad donde el reside y sale a vender desde las 8:00 de la mañana hasta las 4:00 de la tarde.

Rosa, necesita el préstamo para comprar más verduras porque la mercadería que posee en este momento es poca y la clientela ha mejorado.

El sueño principal de Rosa, es comprar un vehículo en mejores condiciones para realizar sus ventas, porque el vehículo que tiene en este momento le da muchos problemas.
texts.en:
Rosa is 19, has a ninth grade education and currently lives with her parents. Rosa has been selling vegetables from a truck for 5 years. She does this in areas that are close to her neighborhood and works from 8:00 on the morning until 4:00 in the afternoon.

Rosa needs this loan to buy more vegetables because she currently has very little stock and has gotten more customers. Rosa's number one dream is to buy a vehicle that is in better condition to use for her work because the one she has right now is causing her a lot of problems.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Maricel works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling frozen foods. Maricel is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables like carrots, cabbage, sweet potatoes, potatoes, etc.

Maricel has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables like carrots, cabbage, sweet potatoes, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is 27 years old; she is married with two children.

Lea works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like biscuits, junk food, home care products and other groceries.

Lea has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from food vending.

Lea aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like biscuits, junk food, home care products and other groceries.

loans.name: Antonietta

texts.en:
Antonietta is 48 years old and married with seven children. With four children in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Antonietta runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, etc. to sell in her general store.

Antonietta has been in this business for 36 years years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, etc. to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Babken

texts.en:
This is Babken's second loan from Kiva. He continues his studies in Armenian State Institute of Physical Culture and is currently in the third year of study.

While successfully paying back his first loan from Kiva, Babken currently asks the second one, for covering the university tuition fee. He will be very grateful to receive lenders' support one more time, ensuring responsible payments and good work in studies.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition for the third year of study to earn a Bachelor's degree.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 42 years old and married with four children. With two children currently in school, she works very hard to provide for them.

Emma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like soft drinks, canned goods, coffee, cereals, noodles, etc. to sell.

Emma has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as soft drinks, canned goods, coffee, cereals, noodles, etc.

In the future, Emma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like soft drinks, canned goods, coffee, cereals, noodles, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Nenita works hard to support her family. She has a buy-and-sell personal collection business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling ready-to-wear.

Nenita is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional products of personal collection like underwear, perfume, body lotion, shoes, bags, beauty soap and other personal care products.

Nenita has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional products of personal collection like underwear, perfume, body lotion, shoes, bags, beauty soap and other personal care products.

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es: Desde el pasado préstamo a Rosalina le ha ido muy bien en su pulperia, ya que logró comprar mesas y sillas nuevas para su negocio, el cual sigue floreciendo y dando frutos. Sin embargo Rosalina quiere seguir viendo crecer a su negocio, es por eso que, ha solicitado un nuevo crédito, el cual planea invertirlo en la compra de carne, gaseosas y golosinas. El préstamo sería de mucha ayuda para Rosalina debido a que le facilitaría el crecimiento de su negocio y se acercaría más al sueño de ella, de que en un futuro no muy lejano su negocio se estable y no necesite de más préstamos para seguir funcionando.
texts.en: Since her last loan, Rosalina's convenience store has been doing very well; she managed to buy new tables and chairs for her business, which continues to flourish and bear fruit. Nevertheless, Rosalina wants to continue to see her business grow, which is why she has requested a new loan which she plans on using to invest in buying meat, sodas and candy. The loan would be helpful for Rosalina because it would facilitate the growth of her business and would bring her closer to her dream: that in the not too distant future her business will be stable and will not need more loans to continue operating.

loans.use: to buy meat, sodas, and candy.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.es:
Lilian, de 56 años de edad, está soltera y tuvo tres hijos y vive en casa propia.
 
Lilian, se decía a la venta de jugos de naranja en la calle principal que conduce a la ciudad, ella vente jugos desde hace 3 años, porque debido a su edad no puede encontrar un trabajo formal, ella vende desde las 7:00 a.m. hasta las 10:00 a.m.

Lilian, necesita el préstamo para comprar más naranjas y un nuevo extractor de jugo, porque el que tiene ya está en mal estado.

Lilian, sueña con construir un cafetín para cubrirse del sol y de la lluvia.
texts.en:
Lilian, 56 years old, is single, had three children and lives in her own home.

Lilian makes a living selling orange juice in the main street that goes to the city. She has been selling juice for 3 years because, due to her age, she can't find formal work. She sells from 7:00 a.m. until 10:00 a.m.

Lilian needs a loan to buy more oranges and a new juicer, because the one she has is now in bad condition.

Lilian dreams of building a stand to shelter herself from the sun and the rain.

loans.use: To buy more oranges and a new juicer.

loans.name: Venus

texts.en:
Venus is 28 years old and has two children. Her live-in partner is an employee of Municipal Hall. She lives in Taggapan, Echague Isabela. Venus operates a variety store, which she has been doing for almost five years.

Venus requested a loan for 10,000 PHP, which she will use to buy soft drinks and other stocks of grocery items. She hopes that she can keep her business profitable with this additional capital.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks and other stocks of grocery items.

loans.name: Teodora

texts.en:
Basically, a sari-sari store is a business found in the Philippines. The term "sari-sari" means “variety." Many Filipinos prefer to have this type of business since it can be done in the comfort of their own homes and they can earn money and still be with their families. That’s why Teodora, a 53-year-old business woman from Cavite, Philippines, has her own sari-sari store.

She dreams of expanding her store and carrying a wide array of product choices. To help prevent delayed payments, she is continually formulating marketing strategies for her business’s success, since this really helps her meet her daily expenses and other basic needs.

Teodora wants to thank the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for their untiring support for every new entrepreneur like her. Teodora really wants to have many products to sell, because that will increase the business’s revenue. With this in mind, she has applied for a 35,000 PHP loan, which she’ll use to buy a variety of grocery items, school supplies, and other products to add to her store.

On a weekly basis, Teodora regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony and her experiences with the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy a variety of grocery items, school supplies, and other products to sell in her business.

loans.name: Israel Neftali

texts.es:
Israel, de 27 años de edad, está acompañado, vive con su pareja y sus dos hijos.

Israel, trabaja sembrando maíz y maicillo, esta actividad la aprendió de su padre, porque él también se dedica a esta actividad.- Hace cuatro años tuvo la oportunidad de dedicarse a la crianza de cerdos y gracias a la ayuda de su pareja el negocio está brindado muchos resultados positivos.

Israel, necesita el préstamo para comprar más cerdos para la crianza y luego venta, esto permitirá que en un futuro muy cercano pueda incrementar sus ingresos.

El sueño de Israel, es que su negocio de crianza de cerdos tenga mucho éxito, para sacar su familia adelante y brindarles a sus hijos una buena educación.
texts.en:
Israel is 27 years old and in a relationship. He lives with his partner and their two children. He works planting corn and sorghum, which he learned to do from his father, who also makes a living from it.

Four years ago Israel had the opportunity to start a business raising pigs, and thanks to the help of his partner, the business is doing very well. Israel needs the loan to buy more pigs to raise and sell so in the near future he can increase his income.

He dreams that his business of raising pigs will be very successful and that he’ll be able to support his family and provide a good education for his children.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Annapurna's Group

texts.en:
Living in a remote village in Koraput district of Odisha, India, Annapurna, a differently abled lady, standing to the extreme right hand side in the photograph, had not many job options to earn some income for her family. Her husband's earnings as a daily wager were not sufficient for their family of three, and he is also growing old to work for long hours and support the family alone.

Facing financial crisis, Annapurna started a cow-rearing activity from an extension of her home five years ago, as she finds it cost-effective. With her family's support, she has been contributing additional income towards her family by selling cow's milk at the local market.

Her experience of five years in the business of milk-selling has helped her gain enough knowledge and understanding of the same. She currently has one cow to manage, but feels the need to scale up the activity by purchasing one more cow for the business. For buying one more cow, she needs some financial support. Therefore, she, along with her group members, is requesting a loan amount of 36,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum.

The loan amount will help her in having a continuous milk supply, which she can sell at the local market and earn some regular income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow for her dairy business.

loans.name: Manasa Ranjan

texts.en:
Manasa Ranjan is a 27-year-old studious boy from Ganjam district of Odisha, India. His father is a retired schoolteacher, and his mother is a homemaker. His parents' most cherished dream has been for Manasa Ranjan to get a good education and build a successful career.

Manasa Ranjan is a very hardworking boy who devotes eight hours a day to his studies. This ambitious boy wants to pursue his technical course, but due to his financial constraints, he is facing numerous difficulties in order to undertake the course. He wants a loan of 50,000 INR from Kiva's partner People's Forum to pay the course fees for getting a degree to be a Certified Professional Accountant (CPA). He is interested to pursue this course, as this is a growing field with a huge range of job opportunities. A competent professional accountant is an invaluable asset to the company.

Your loan amount can help Manasa Ranjan complete his course successfully with flying colors and get a job with a handsome package, which will make his family proud to have a son like him. Manasa Ranjan is eagerly awaiting your kind hearts to help him achieve his dream.

loans.use: to pay the course fees for getting a degree to be a Certified Professional Accountant (CPA).

loans.name: Janelyn

texts.en:
Janelyn is a 49-year-old married woman with five children, four of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Janelyn has a food vending business in the Philippines, and she has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production. She has been in this business for 4 years.

Janelyn would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Naseem Bibi

texts.en:
Naseem Bibi is married, 50 years of age, and living with her husband in Multan, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a fruit shop for eight years now. He is a very humble man and works with great dedication. He is popular for his honesty and that is why he sells the fruits before the evening and earns a healthy profit, but since the last month he has been facing difficulty in buying the stock.

His wife Naseem Bibi applied for the loan to bring ease to her husband's business routine and also to kick start it once again to keep moving the wheel of their lives.

Naseem Bibi is confident about her husband's sales skills and that he will be able to return the loan amount regularly. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy fruits for her husband's shop

loans.name: Higinio

texts.es: Don Higinio, tiene años de edad, tiene 2 hijos y vive en el municipio de San juan Intibucá junto a su esposa e hijos. Él siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura de granos básicos, y lleva 7 años cultivando café el cual es su mayor fuente de ingresos. Esta producción la vende en grano oro a los intermediarios de la zona. Solicita un préstamo de 30,000 Lempiras que utilizara en la compra de fertilizantes para su finca de café con lo que podrá tener una mayor cosecha. Considera que poco a poco va ir aumentando el cultivo y con las ganancias piensa hacerle mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Higinio has 2 children and lives in the municipality of San juan Intibucá with his wife and children. He has always engaged in agriculture, growing staple grains, and has been growing coffee for 7 years, which is his main source of income. He sells his production to the area's middlemen in the form of coffee beans.

He is requesting a loan of 30,000, which he will use to buy fertilizers for his coffee plantation, and this will enable him to have a bigger harvest. He believes that gradually he will be increasing his crop and wiih the earnings he plans to make improvements to their home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for maintaining his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Jorge, de 24 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y tienen una niña de tres años de edad y su esposa se dedica a los trabajos domésticos del hogar.	

Jorge, trabaja en la pesca artesanal en la laguna de la localidad, pero también posee otra fuente de ingresos que es la albañilería, este trabajo lo aprendió gracias a su padre.

El dinero será utilizado para comprar equipo de pesca, que le permitirá tener buenas condiciones para aumentar la pesca y a si aumentar sus ventas.

Los sueños de Jorge, es tener una buena lancha para aumentar la capacidad de la pesca.
texts.en:
Jorge is 24 years old and lives with his wife. They have a three-year-old daughter and his wife is doing the domestic work at home.

Jorge is working in artisanal fishing in the local lagoon. But he also has another source of income which is the masonry. He learned this work thanks to his father. 

The money will be used to buy fishing gear, which will enable him to have good conditions to increase his catches and thus to increase his sales. Jorge dreams of having a good longboat to increase the fishing capacity.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear

loans.name: Shaheena

texts.en: Shaheena is a very vigilant and good manager, as she manages her household and clothing shop simultaneously. She is married and the mother of 4 children, and she lives with her husband in Multan, Pakistan. She manages her business alone with proper procedure and is benefiting a great deal from her business, but now the savings that she has in her account have fallen short, and she is not able to buy the seasonal inventory for her business. Therefore, she applied for this loan and is thankful both to the Kiva team and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy clothes for her clothing shop

loans.name: Jomar

texts.en: Jomar is 29 years old and his wife is pregnant with their first baby. Jomar is open to all kinds of businesses. He has a business buying and selling dried fish. Before his baby is born, Jomar plans to sell a lot of items in his sari-sari store. He took out a new loan to buy the additional goods and to renovate his business place. Jomar has already purchased the goods for his sari-sari store and has repaired his business place. Through his earnings, Jomar has improved his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy goods for his sari-sari (convenience) store

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for five years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to service and maintain his motorcycle. He hopes that in the future he will be successful. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his child.

loans.use: to service and maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a tobacco retailing business in the Philippines. Gloria is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of tobacco to offer for sale.

Gloria has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of tobacco to sell.

loans.name: Gelyn

texts.en: Gelyn, 32 years old, has five children, four of them in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past eleven years, Gelyn has operated a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 16,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell. In the future, Gelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Phương's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Mười is 44 years old and she is married. She has been operating a food stall selling eel soup for more than 10 years. 
Mười lives in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village. The market need is low in this region and the income from this business is not high enough for her to do what she really needs to comfort her life. 
The main hardship that Mười faces is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients for cooking and selling more eel soup to increase her income.
In 2012, Mười joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Since then, she has bought tables and chairs for serving more customers.
She is the group leader of "Phương's Group", which consists of three members.
In the future, Mười hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for cooking and selling more eel soup to increase her income.

loans.name: Thắm's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Thắm is 40 years old and she is married. She has had a retail business selling dry food and general things for six years. Thắm lives in Thieu Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in a village; moreover, the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Thắm faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase milk, sugar, sweets, and cake to resell.

In 2012, Thắm joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Thắm has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. She is the group leader of a three-member group.

In the future, Thắm hopes for her children to do well in school, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to maintain a successful business.

loans.use: to purchase milk, sugar, sweets, and cake to resell.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en:
Luciana is a 32-year-old woman from Tubigon, Bohol. She is married and has two children. Her oldest child is nine years old and her youngest child is seven years old. Her husband is a factory worker and she helps him through a direct-selling business. For five years she has been selling products from Avon and MSE (a company that sells products such as cosmetics, beauty products, fragrances, apparels etc.)

Luciana is in need of a loan for additional capital to purchase products such as body lotion, perfumes, cologne, beauty soap, cosmetics, shirts, underwear, shoes and sandals. Aside from this, she also wants to buy raw materials for hats because she is also engaged in hat making.

In the future, Luciana wants to improve her business to help her husband in raising their children so they could give them a better future.

loans.use: to buy personal products to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Evelyn

texts.en:
Ma. Evelyn is a 42 years old variety store owner from Pasay City, Philippines and a member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT). She chose to run this kind of business since Filipinos prefer to buy goods in a place near to their location rather than waste it on fares by going to markets. Basically, variety stores can be found in every barrios, barangays, municipalities and even in cities. They have grills or screens as a protection against theft and products here are measured by volumes, kilos, or by piece.

Ma. Evelyn has had the business for 1 year and this really helped her sustain the needs of her family and support her son’s educational expenses. The profit earned on the business has been used for their daily needs instead of buying additional products for her variety store. To add grocery items for the business is what she aims to do.

Ma. Evelyn decided to apply for a PHP 8,000 loan. If granted, she will use it to buy stocks like bottled drinks, variety of grocery items, school supplies, and other products to add to the business.

Ma. Evelyn is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength from member’s life changing testimony, share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans, and hear God’s word that was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy stocks for her store.

loans.name: Mery Cris

texts.en:
Mery Cris is 25 years old, and married with two children.

Mery Cris works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, snack foods, coffee, sugar, soap and other personal care products.

She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Mery Cris has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years.

Mery Cris aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell such as canned goods, noodles, milk, coffee, sugar, eggs and personal care products.

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 37 years old and has four children. She is married and two of her children are still in school.

Maricel is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Maricel has been in this business for eight years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Mirian Isabel

texts.es:
Mirian, estudio hasta séptimo grado, está acompañada y su compañero de vida se dedica a la agricultura y juntos tienen 2 hijos. 

Mirian, se dedica a la venta de pasteles, yuca frita y también al destazo de cerdos para comercializar la carne y de esta manera generar ingresos para su familia.

Mirian, necesita el crédito para comprar cerdos para comercializar la carne, porque este es uno de los medios de ingresos para ella y su familia. 

Su principal sueño es, ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales para que tengan una mejor condición de vida.
texts.en:
Mirian went to school up until the seventh grade. She is in a relationship and her life partner makes a living in agriculture. They have 2 children together. Mirian makes a living selling pastries, fried yucca, and also butchering pigs to sell the meat and in this way generate income for her family.

Mirian needs the loan to buy pigs in order to sell the meat because this is one of the means of income for her and her family. Her ultimate dream is to see her children become professionals so that they have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pigs to sell the meat.

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
Ernesto, de 41 años de edad, estudio hasta tercer grado, está acompañado y tiene 4 hijos con su pareja.
 
Ernesto, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y también tiene una pequeña tienda y su pareja se dedica a la administración de este pequeño negocio.

Ernesto, necesita el préstamo para surtir el negocio con mercadería como arroz, frijoles, café, pan, entre otros.

El sueña con tener su negocio mucho más grande y sueña con poder ver a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales dentro de la sociedad.
texts.en:
Ernesto is 41 years old, and went as far as third grade in school. He is married, and he and his partner have 4 children.

Ernesto grows corn and also has a small store which his partner runs.


Ernesto needs the loan to stock his business with merchandise such as rice, beans, bread and other items.

He dreams about having a much larger business, and of seeing his children become professionals in society.

loans.use: to stock his store with merchandise such as rice, beans, coffee, bread and other items.

loans.name: Roselle

texts.en: Roselle, 59 years old, is married and has three children. Roselle works very hard to provide for them. For the past ten years, Roselle has run a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more grocery items, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, cooking oil, eggs, shampoo and other snack foods, to sell. In the future, Roselle would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items, such as canned goods, noodles, spices, milk, drinks, coffee, cooking oil, eggs, shampoo and other snack foods, to sell.

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann is a woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 30 years old and has one child in school.

Mary Ann has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Mary Ann has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

loans.name: Matias

texts.es: Don Matías, tiene 63 años de edad, es casado, tiene 5 hijos y vive en una aldea del municipio de Gracias Lempira. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la agricultura con el cultivo de maíz, frijoles y actualmente café. La producción de café ha sido su mayor fuente de ingresos para su familia. Su producción la vende en grano despulpado en el mercado local. Él ha solicitado ya varios préstamos para mantener sus cultivos de donde ha podido obtener ganancias para mejorar su vivienda. Actualmente solicita otro por 4,000 Lempiras para comprar abono para aplicarle al cultivo de café y mejorar la producción. Su plan es ampliar la producción sembrando más plantas de café y poder mejorar su estilo de vida con su familia.
texts.en:
Matías, 63, is married and has five children. He lives in a community in the town of Gracias, Lempira. He has worked in agriculture his whole life, growing corn and beans and now coffee. The coffee crop has been his biggest source of income for his family. He sells his crop pulped and dried in the local market.

He has already requested several loans to take care of his crops. He has been able to earn more profit and improve his home. Currently he's requesting another loan, for 4,000 lempiras [HNL], to buy soil amendments for his coffee crop to improve his harvest.

Matías plans to increase his production by planting more coffee plants so he can improve his family's lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments for his coffee crop

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a married man. He has 4 children. He describes himself to be honest.

Samuel operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Samuel will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. He hopes that in the future, he will expand business. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to boost his business.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Rosalita

texts.en:
Rosalita has been a consistent member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for many years now and she’s grateful that they quickly responded to her loan request. The amount that they approved allowed her to buy fresh chickens she needed for her daily inventories. She wants to thank as well all of the lenders who provided financial support without asking for anything in return.

Rosalita wants to continuously support her family’s needs. That's why she’s working hard to make the business grow. She hopes to maintain her business and have regular supplies of fresh chickens, for she dreams for her children to finish their college. An approximate amount of PHP 45,000 is what she needs to make this happen.

Rosalita is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony, share her own experience of God’s love, pay micro finance loans and hear God’s word that was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy chickens to sell.

loans.name: Mercy Molina

texts.en:
Mercy Molina is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mercy Molina is 48 years old and has one child still in school.

Mercy Molina has a tailoring business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy garments and other materials needed in her business.

Mercy Molina has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Mercy Molina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy garments & sewing materials.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is 35 years old and married with two children. With her two children currently in school, Margie works very hard to provide for them.

Margie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Margie has been in this business for eight years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, soft drinks, candies, biscuits, coffee, etc.

In the future, Margie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Teresita is 50 years old now.

Teresita has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 16000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more dried fish to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Nenita is 46 years old and has four children who are still in school.

Nenita has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fish net, bamboo, gasoline for her boat, and other materials for her business.

Nenita has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing supplies.

loans.name: Edalyn

texts.en:
Edalyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is now borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs. She supplements this income with earnings from her general store business.

Edalyn dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: William Ramon

texts.es: William es un joven de 33 años, dueño de una pequeña fábrica de bloques que empezó con su propio capital, el cual, le permitió comprar su primera máquina para elaborar bloques, actualmente el negocio no está nada mal para William, sin embargo, el considera que aún necesita de un préstamo para comprar la materia prima para continuar fabricando los bloques. En el futuro William planea que su negocio sea estable y no necesite de más préstamos, además tiene planeado terminar de construir su vivienda y mejorarla, pero, por el momento William necesita del crédito para continuar impulsando su negocio.
texts.en:
William is a young man of 33, the owner of a small cinderblock factory that he started with his own resources, which allowed him to buy his first machine to make cinderblocks. Currently, the business is not going badly at all for William. However, he thinks that he still needs a loan to buy the raw materials to continue producing cinderblocks.

In the future, William plans for his business to be stable and to not need any more loans. In addition, he has plans to finish building and improving his house, but for the moment William needs the loan to continue driving his business forward.

loans.use: to buy the raw materials to continue producing cinderblocks.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 34 years old, married, and has four children. Evelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Evelyn has borrowed and paid 5 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from direct selling personal collection products.

Evelyn aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Mukisa Saalama Group

texts.en:
Prossy is a client of UGAFODE Microfinance, applying for a loan of UGX 1,000,000. She is a married woman with three children.

She is a businesswoman who owns and operates a beauty salon. She needs income to increase her working capital and expand the business. She will buy a new dryer using the loan funds. Competition and limited capital are her biggest challenges given that at times her customers want facials, pedicures and manicures and yet she lacks such unique services.

She is very grateful for the support UGAFODE Microfinance and Kiva lenders offered to her since she is now able to fund her business.

The gentleman seated in the middle is the group chairperson who has a bigger amount for a different period. He signed the client waiver though.

loans.use: to increase working capital to buy a new dryer using the loan funds.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Mary Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell seafood business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy more crabs and shrimps to sell to her customers.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Mary Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more crabs and shrimps to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Denilyn

texts.en:
Denilyn is a married woman, 24 years old, with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a vegetable "buy-and-sell" business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional vegetables like carrots, cabbages, potatoes, sweet potatoes and beans, as well as spices, to sell to her local market.

Denilyn has been in this business for five years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional vegetables like carrots, cabbages, potatoes, sweet potatoes and beans, as well as spices, to sell to her local market.

loans.name: Dowela

texts.en:
Dowela is a married woman, 65 years old, with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fish to sell to her local market.

Dowela has been in this business for one year. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to sell to her local market

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 41 years old and married with three children. With her three children in school, Gina works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and sells a variety of items. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her store, like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

Gina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, home care products, and other groceries.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 46 years old, married, and has four children. She is a rice farmer, which she has been doing since 1990. Lolita wishes to have continuous development of her rice farm so she can obtain a better yield.

Lolita requested a loan for 30,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fertilizer and insecticides and to pay hired laborers to transplant her rice farm. She hopes that she can further improve her rice planting business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and insecticides and to pay hired laborers to transplant her rice farm.

loans.name: Elissar

texts.en:
Elissar is a 20-year-old married woman with one child. She started a home-based cosmetics business 3 years ago to sell makeup and scarves. She is able to help her husband to cover the increasing needs and expenses of their family. Elissar is well-known in her region and has loyal customers.

Elissar requests a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop her business through diversifying her merchandise with new items for the winter season to better satisfy her customers' requests.

Elissar hopes to expand her business in the future through opening her own shop to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to diversify her merchandise with new items for the winter season

loans.name: Moralina

texts.en:
Moralina is 46 years old, married, and has eight children, five of whom attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Moralina operates a fishing business in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years.

Moralina requested a loan from NWTF for 12,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fish nets, paint, gasoline, and other fishing supplies. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fish nets, paint, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
Marissa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has had a general store for 5 years.

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Marissa earns additional income from raising pigs and selling firewood.

Marissa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma is a married woman with five children who works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business and earns additional income selling fish. Lerma is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.

Lerma has sustained her business through 3 previously loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.

loans.name: Julio Noel

texts.es:
Julio, de 39 años de  edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está casado, su esposa se dedica a la venta de pupusas y tiene 2 hijos.

Julio, se dedica a trabajo de agricultura y también presta servicios como conductor desde hace más de 2 años, anteriormente se dedicaba a comercializar carne de cerdo, pero ahora solo se dedica a la agricultura y a ser conductor. 

Julio, necesita el préstamo para comprar reces y cerdos para continuar su negocio de carnicería y dedicarse otra vez a la venta de carne de cerdo.

Julio, sueña con poder tener un negocio más grande y tener una carnicería que venda al por mayor.
texts.en:
Julio is 39 years old, and went as far as 9th grade in school. He is married. His wife sells pupusas (Salvadoran grilled stuffed tortillas) and has 2 children. Julio farms and also has been working as a driver for more than 2 years.

Previously he worked selling pork. Now he only farms and works as a driver.

Julio dreams about having a larger business and of having a butcher's shop that sells at wholesale.

loans.use: To buy cattle and pigs so that he can continue his butcher's shop business.

loans.name: Jummai

texts.en:
Jummai is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Jummai has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric tons of maize per hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer.

Before joining Babban Gona, Jummai would have had to sell her maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet her immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support, Jummai can store her maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest.

As a Babban Gona member, Jummai will benefit from marketing support that could see her generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Jummai is thankful that she now has the opportunity to improve the life of her children and family and looks forward to using her additional earnings to acquire more land to put into the Babban Gona program.

loans.use: to eliminate the pressure to sell maize at low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Angie

texts.en:
Angie is a 25-year-old single hard working entrepreneur.

Angie has had a food vending business for 4 years and requests 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

In the future, Angie would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna is a hardworking entrepreneur who has had a fishing business for 3 years..

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies for her fishing business.

Myrna has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family in the future.

loans.use: to buy fish nets and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
Margie is a 32-year-old married woman with two children.

She has earned a living by raising livestock for 5 years. Margie is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She earns additional income from food vending.

She works tirelessly to attain her dream which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros is a married woman with seven children who works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business and earns additional income selling fish. Milagros is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies.

Milagros has sustained her business through 2 previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream which is to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish nets, gasoline, and other fishing supplies

loans.name: Thuan's Group

texts.en:
Thuan is a 23-year-old Thai ethnic woman. She currently lives with her husband and two sons in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from small trading. The income is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and small savings amount. She wants to repair her house but the saved amount is not enough. Therefore, she wants a loan to buy materials to repair her house.

She hopes that the loan will help her family have a spacious house and good living conditions. She will work hard to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair her house

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Para Yolanda, la costura es su vida y su trabajo,  el cual realiza con mucha pasión y alegría desde hace más de una década y del cual no piensa renunciar en un futuro cercano, sin embargo, Yolanda ha tenido ciertas dificultades, las cuales, la han privado a prosperar, es por eso que en múltiples ocasiones ha recurrido a solicitar un crédito. El crédito que Yolanda está solicitando lo requiere para comprar telas e hilos, instrumentos fundamentales para realizar el trabajo que hace a Yolanda inmensamente feliz.
texts.en:
For Yolanda, making clothing is her life and work, which she has done with much passion and joy for more than a decade and she has no intention of abandoning this work in the near future. Nevertheless, Yolanda has experienced some difficulties which have deprived her of prosperity. That is why on multiple occasions, she has resorted to requesting a loan.

The loan she is presently soliciting is needed to purchase cloth and thread, fundamental instruments to accomplish the work that makes Yolanda so immensely happy.

loans.use: purchase cloth and thread for her clothes-making business.

loans.name: Ulezi Group

texts.en:
Tito is in his late 30s, married, and has three children, two of whom attend school. He has been running several business, including selling goats, cows, and chickens and renting chairs for various ceremonies, for three years. He works from 5 AM to 6 PM daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

Tito requested his twentieth loan From Tujijenge Tanzania, which he will use to purchase goats, cows, chicks, and chicken feed and to purchase chairs for renting. He used the previous loans to increase his cows, goats, and chicken stocks, to buy chicken fees, and to buy a good number of chairs for renting. All loans were repaid successfully. He used the profits to pay school fees for his two children, build his own house, repay the loans, reinvest in his businesses, and cover household expenses. He dreams of being a big business man.

Tito will share this loan with the Ulezi Group, which consists of two members who hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to purchase goats, cows, chicks, and chicken feeds and to purchase chairs  for renting

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man and has four children. He describes himself as optimistic. He is a cobbler and has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive place and his primary customers are locals. He says that his biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital.

This is John's first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the KES 30,000 to buy materials for making shoes. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business and hopes that in the future he will have improved living standards.

loans.use: to buy materials for making shoes

loans.name: Xom's Group

texts.en:
Xom was born in 1978 and is a Thai ethnic woman. She has participated in the program of M7-MFI’s forerunner since January 2001. She has a husband and a son who lives in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from growing crops and breeding livestock, so the income is just enough to cover the living expense of the family and a small savings amount. She wants to repair her house but she does not have enough money to buy materials and pay wage for builders.

She hopes that the loan will help her family have a clean and spacious house and good living conditions. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy materials and pay wage for builders

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Sarah works hard to support her family. She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling frozen foods and raising chickens.

Sarah is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, cooking oil, spices, vegetables, etc. for her food vending business.

Sarah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, cooking oil, spices, vegetables, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Billy Alexander

texts.es:
Billy, de 40 años de edad, estudio técnico en agronomía, pero por situación de escasos recursos económicos ya no pudo continuar, está acompañado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y tiene 2 hijos.

Billy, se dedica a trabajar con ganado que le genera leche desde hace más de 10 años, esta labor la adquirió como enseñanza de sus padres; pero aparte de eso también presta sus servicios en la alcaldía de su municipio.

El crédito lo está solicitando para comprar concentrado para su ganado y para la preparación de forraje. 

Su sueño es tener un establo en buenas condiciones y semi-tecnificado para poder obtener mejores resultados de su ganado.
texts.en:
40-year-old Billy studied to become an agronomy technician, but could not continue due to a lack of financial resources. He has a spouse, who works at home, and two children.

Billy has worked for more than 10 years with dairy cattle. He learned this occupation from his parents. He also works for the mayoralty in his town. 

He is requesting a loan to buy feed concentrate for his cattle and for the preparation of fodder.

His dream is to have a semi-technified barn in good conditions in order to obtain better results from his cattle.

loans.use: to buy feed concentrate for his cattle and for the preparation of fodder.

loans.name: Luzmar

texts.en:
Luzmar is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a soft drink retailing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF in order to buy additional stock of soft drinks to sell to customers for her soft drink retailing business.

Luzmar has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from selling dressed chicken.

Luzmar has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of soft drinks to sell to customers.

loans.name: Majidan

texts.en:
Majidan is a 40-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She spends her life with her husband and three children.

Her husband is a very hard worker and an honest man. He owns a small restaurant in which he offers various types of delicious foods. She cooks some dishes for the restaurant, and people like to eat at her husband's restaurant.

He hired a worker for his restaurant, and he has to pay a salary to that worker. He has been running his restaurant for many years, and now most of the chairs, utensils, and crockery have broken. Therefore, he wants to buy new plastic furniture, utensils, and crockery, but the majority of his income is spent on household expenses.

Therefore, Majidan requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband could buy plastic furniture, utensils, and crockery. She thanks Kiva and appreciates the lenders' warmth and support to her.

loans.use: to enable her husband to buy plastic furniture, utensils, and crockery.

loans.name: Soi's Group

texts.en:
Soi was born in 1997 and is a Thai ethnic woman. She has a husband and daughter. The family lives in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main income is from growing crops and breeding animals. The income is just enough to cover the living expense and small savings. She wants to buy fertilize for her family’s coffee field but she does not have enough money.

She hopes that the loan will help her family invest effectively in cultivation with high productivity. In the next harvest, the coffee field will be double, as compared to the previous year. She will work hard to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a single woman who has one child. She describes herself as honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are locals.

This is Josphine's second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan. She will use this KES 20,000 loan to buy more clothes to sell.

Josphine will use the anticipated profits to expand her business. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Damaris

texts.en: Damaris is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be power outages. She will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use. Her business goal is to have a bigger salon within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.en:
Viviana works hard to support her family. Viviana is widowed and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Viviana requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients such as meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her business.

Viviana has been in this business for 4 years now.

In the future, Viviana would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Lucille

texts.en:
Lucille works hard to support her family. Lucille is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Lucille requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Lucille has been in this business for 2 years now.

Lucille would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Hranush

texts.en:
Hranush lives and studies in Gyumri town. She is a student at the Pedagogical University, named after M. Nalbandyan, and is in her fourth year of study.

Hranush lives with her parents, brother and sister.

She asks this loan to be able to cover the university tuition fee and continue her studies to get a Bachelor's degree.

Hranush hopes to receive lenders' support and invest in her education, so she will be able to have a well paid job and support her family in the near future.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition fee.

loans.name: Leilani

texts.en:
Leilani is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 28 years old and has two children who are in school.

Leilani has a buy-and-sell frozen foods and soft drinks business in the Philippines.

Leilani requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more packs of frozen foods and cases of soft drinks to sell.

Leilani has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more packs of frozen foods and cases of soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Tan's Group

texts.en:
Tan, 22 years old, is a Thai ethnic man. His family consists of three members, including his wife and his lovely son. The family is living in Mai Son district, Son La province.

His family’s main occupation is cultivation and breeding. His income is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and a saved small amount. He wants to buy a breeding buffalo but the saved amount is not enough. Therefore, he wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

He hopes that the loan amount will help his family to be able to invest in breeding and next year the buffalo will bring his family lovely buffalo calves. He will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy a breeding buffalo

loans.name: Kieu's Group

texts.en:
Kieu, 25 years old, is a Thai ethnic woman. She is living with her husband and her two children, one son and one daughter, in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family’s main occupation is from cultivation and breeding. Their annual income after deducting costs is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family. She does not have enough saved money to pay for all the education expenses of her two children, one is at primary school and the other is at kindergarten. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She hopes that the loan amount will help her children have better conditions for learning. She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to pay for all the education fees of her children.

loans.name: Yesenia Arely

texts.es:
Yesenia, de 28 años de edad, está soltera, tiene dos hijos que vive en casa, uno estudia y el otro pasa en casa de ella.

Yesenia, se dedica al comercio de especias para comida y condimento desde hace 3 años y este negocio lo aprendió por su tía quien también se dedica  a este negocio y su horario de trabaja es de 8:00 a.m. hasta las 6:00 de la tarde.

Yesenia, necesita el préstamo para comprar más especias y condimentos para comercializarlos.

Yesenia, sueño con comprar un vehículo para salir a comercializar su producto.
texts.en:
Yesenia, 28 years old, is single, and has two children who live in her home. One child studies in school while the other remains at home.

Yesenia has sold spices and condiments for food during the last three years. She learned the business from her aunt who was also dedicated to this business. Yesenia's work schedule runs from 8:00 am until 6:00 in the afternoon.

Yesenia needs the loan to purchase more spices and condiments to sell.

Yesenia dreams of buying a vehicle someday in order to get out and sell more products.

loans.use: to buy more spices and condiments to sell.

loans.name: Ghadeer

texts.en: Ghadeer is a single lady living in a refugee camp which is Baqaa. After her father retired and ‎her mother is a stay home mother to care for her children, Ghadeer needs the loan to pay ‎for this semester. Ghadeer wants to finish studying to find a full time job to help her parents ‎with her sibling’s education. ‎

loans.use: to pay for her next semester fees.

loans.name: Gloria Marina

texts.es: Gloria, es una madre soltera con 3 hijos, tiene 64 años de edad, vive con una de sus hijas en el municipio de Mercedes, Ocotepeque que colinda con Gracias, Lempira. Ella maneja una pulpería y venta de ropa desde hace 10 años en su casa. Anteriormente ella se dedicaba a la agricultura. en el negocio actual ofrece productos de la canasta básica como ser arroz, frijoles, maíz, aceite, azúcar, harina, churros, cereales, refrescos, pan y otros, además vende ropa de niño, blusas, calcetas, camisetas, y ropa interior. Ella solicita la cantidad de 15,000 lempiras para surtir su negocio con más productos de la canasta básica familiar para surtir la pulpería y un poco de ropa nueva para lograr tener mejores ventas. Su sueño es crecer como microempresaria y seguir aportando al núcleo familiar para ayudar a tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Gloria is a single mother with three children. She is 64 years old and lives with one of her daughters in the municipality of Mercedes, Ocotepeque which borders with Gracias, Lempira. She is managing a grocery store and the sale of clothing at her home for ten years. Formerly she has been working as a farmer. In her current business she offers products of basic need such as rice, beans, corn, oil, sugar, flour, churros (fried dough), cereals, soft drinks, bread and other things. In addition she is selling children´s clothing, blouses, socks, t-shirts and underwear.
She is requesting the amount of 15,000 Lempiras to stock up her shop with more products of basic needs for families to expand the grocery store and for some new clothing to achieve better sales. Her dream is to grow as a microentrepreneur and to go on contributing to the family nucleus to help having a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy food products to stock up her grocery store and to buy new clothing to sell.

loans.name: Shugufta

texts.en:
Shugufta is 44, married, and the mother of two sons and three daughters. They live in a small house in Lahore.

Her husband is a rickshaw driver in Lahore. Rickshaw service, being cheap, is very common in Lahore. He provides pick-up and drop-off services to students and workers and charges his fare at the end of the month. Other than that, he also gives transportation services to locals during his spare time. He is the sole earner in the family, and meeting the daily expenses is a challenge.

His rickshaw's body has deteriorated due to wear and tear, and he wants to replace it as people prefer cleaner and better rickshaws. Shugufta has therefore requested a loan to help her husband buy a new covering or body for the rickshaw.

loans.use: to help her husband buy a rickshaw body to resume his transportation services.

loans.name: Nga's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nga, born in 1985, is a Thai ethnic woman. She joined the program of M7-MFI’s forerunner in January, 2006. She is living with her husband and her two children, one daughter and one son in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family lives mainly on income from cultivation and breeding, so the income after deducting costs is just enough to cover the living expenses of the family and save a small amount.

She wants to raise pigs, but the saved amount is not enough to buy pigs and food for it. Therefore, she wants to borrow a loan for this purpose.

She will work hard to get money to repay the loan for M7-MFI on time and she hopes that the loan amount will help her family invest in the breeding effectively.

Next year when selling the first pig herd, her family will earn a considerable profit.

loans.use: to raise pigs

loans.name: Walid

texts.en:
Walid is a 20-year-old single man who took employment in a music shop two years ago to cover his needs and expenses. He is a talented man who has professional skills in painting. He has a creative vision and he has worked hard on improving it for he believes that painting has positive effects on his personality. He is also still continuing his university studies.

Today, Walid is acquiring a Youth loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy painting tools (canvas rolls, palettes, brush cleaners, brushes, etc..) to create beautiful paintings to share in a exhibition.

Walid hopes to establish his own exhibition in the future to become more famous and well-known in the artistic field.

loans.use: to buy painting tools (canvas rolls, palettes, brush cleaners, brushes) to create beautiful paintings to share in a exhibition.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as focused. She operates a farm where she grows cabbages, onions, beans and other crops. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be energetic. She operates a retail business where she sells potatoes, fruits, and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be perishability of products.

She will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. Her business goal is to have a better business within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have good living conditions. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to invest in other businesses.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a 25-year-old single lady who started eight years ago working as a tutor to cover her needs and expenses. She is a hard worker and ambitious lady who is well known in her region for her professional skills in this domain.

Mariam is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua. She will use the loan to maintain her car, which she uses to get to her student's houses.

She hopes to open her own business in the future to increase her income and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to maintain her car, which she uses to get to her student's houses.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a Kiva borrower. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

John will use the Kes 20,000 loan to service and maintain his motorcycle.

This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to improve business.

loans.use: to service and maintain his motorcycle

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
The previous loan that was approved by Center for Community Transformation (CCT) became a way to increase her business sales. Evangeline used the amount to buy fresh vegetables and she also plans to maintain an increasing revolving fund for her business. She is grateful that there are people willing to extend their help financially. To all of the lenders and CCT, she wants to send sincerest thanks.

Evangeline wants to have additional capital. This time, she would like to apply for PHP 25,000-worth of loan. With this she will buy a bulk quantity of fresh vegetables. This will make her business earn more than previously. She perseveres to make the business grow as she wants to invest to have her own stall in Batasan market. She’s confident that God will guide her to succeed in the business.

Evangeline has been consistent in attending her CCT fellowship group that consists of 15 to 30 members, where she hears the word of God and testimonies from partners. This has made her become strong spiritually and dependent on God on every occasion.

loans.use: to buy bulk quantity of fresh vegetables daily.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Delia works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from doing manicures.

Delia is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy a new engine for her fishing boat for her fishing business.

Delia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

loans.name: Haneen

texts.en:
Haneen is 20 years old and is studying for a degree in business management. She lives in ‎Jarash with her family. She has five siblings, and she is working really hard to get ‎ahead and to grow.

Haneen dreams of having a good job so that she could help to pay for ‎her daily expenses and help her family with their household expenses.

She is requested this ‎loan to pay for her educational expenses so that she can continue her education and ‎achieve her dreams.

loans.use: to pay for her educational expenses so that she can continue with her education.

loans.name: Alaa

texts.en:
Alaa is a kindergarten teacher. She is 28 years old and lives with her elderly parents in Jabaa’, near Jerusalem. She is single. Alaa is taking care of her parents because they are old and they need medicine. She is working hard to provide her parents what they need.

Alaa wants to rebuild her house before winter, to make it warmer for them. She needs to purchase cement, wood, nails, iron, etc. Alaa has requested a 700 USD loan from Kiva’s partner Alibdaa to achieve what she needs.

Alaa is very thankful for the whole team at both Kiva and Alibdaa.

loans.use: to buy more structural equipment such as cement, wood, iron, etc. to repair her house

loans.name: Mebinawe

texts.fr: Mebinawe est une femme mariée qui vit avec ses trois enfants à charge à Agoè.
