Agée de 29 ans, Mebinawe est une revendeuse des habits de friperies qui s’approvisionne huit fois par mois au marché et le revend en parcourant les quartiers environnant. Pour avoir un stock important et maximiser son profit afin de répondre à nombreuse attentes de ses clients, Mebinawe demande ce crédit pour commander des unités de jupes et chemises de friperies en vue de gagner des bénéfices et venir en aide à  son mari aux diverses charges quotidiennes éprouvées par la famille.
texts.en:
Mebinawe is a married woman who lives with three children in her care in Agoè. Mebinawe is 29 years old and a retailer of second-hand clothing who gets her supplies eight times per month from the market and sells them throughout the surrounding neighborhoods.

To have a large stock and maximize her profits in order to meet the numerous expectations of her customers, Mebinawe is seeking this loan to purchase second-hand skirts and shirts with the goal of making a profit and helping her husband with the family's various day-to-day expenses.

loans.use: to purchase 50 skirts and 50 shirts.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed, who is in his early 60s, is married. He has five children, one of whom is still in college. The other four are grown. He has been selling charcoal for 20 years now. He works from 7am to 6pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Mohamed's fifth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase his charcoal stock and has successfully paid back all his loans. He is doing fine with the loan. He used the profit to reinvest in the business, to repay the loan, and to pay school fees. He also bought a plot of land and covered household expenses.

He will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal to sell at retail and wholesale, as well. He dreams of expanding his charcoal business by opening another big charcoal store in a different area.

Mohamed will be accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal  to sell at retail and wholesale

loans.name: Madona Group

texts.en:
Kija, who is in his mid 20s, is married with two children who both attend school. He has been selling cosmetics for two years now. He works from 10 a.m. to 6 p.m.daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Kija's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He will use this loan to buy the best selling cosmetics to meet his customers' demand. He dreams of expanding his cosmetics business.

Kija will share this loan with his loan group Madona ,which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy the best selling cosmetics to meet his customers' demand.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is a hardworking and responsible woman. She raises pigs and cultivates her rice farm land. Nilda is 51 years old, married, and had three children. She aims to have a productive farm land; that's why she and her husband have been doing their best.

Nilda is now asking for additional capital of PHP 30,000. She will use this loan amount to buy farm inputs such as seed variety and fertilizers and to pay for transplanting her rice farm land. She is looking forward to continuous improvement of her rice farming business.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as seed variety and fertilizers and to pay for transplanting her rice farm land.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe de 24 membres fait partie du banc villageois qui a été crée en décembre 2012. Il est constitué de femmes du même village et des environs. Elles ont de bonnes relations et s’activent dans le commerce, l’agriculture et l’embouche. Une bonne ambiance anime les réunions de groupe.
NDEYE FATOU  debout à droite de la photo et levant la main gauche est l’emprunteuse vedette, elle  est âgée de 38 ans. Elle est mariée et mère deux 2 filles et 2  garçons. Elle s’active dans l’embouche.
Avec le prêt reçu elle compte  acheter  un mouton à 50 000 FCFA et le revendre au bout de 5 mois d’élevage à 100 000 FCFA. Avec le reste du prêt elle achète de l’aliment de bétail. 
Les bénéfices vont  servir à aider ses enfants dans leurs scolarités en leurs achetant des fournitures mais aussi s’occuper d’elle-même.
texts.en:
This group of 24 members is part of the banc villageois that was established in December 2012. It is made up of women from the same village and surrounding area. These women have good relationships and take part in business, agriculture, and raising livestock. A good atmosphere enlivens the group's meetings.

Ndeye Fatou, standing at right in the photo and raising her left hand, is the featured borrower. She is 38 years old, married, and the mother of two girls and two boys. She takes part in raising livestock.

With the loan received, Ndeye Fatou plans to purchase a sheep for 50,000 CFA francs and resell it after five months of fattening for 100,000 CFA francs. With the rest of the loan, she [plans to] purchase livestock feed.

The profits [from this loan] will help Ndeye Fatou's children in their education by purchasing the[ir school] supplies, and will also allow Ndeye Fatou to take care of herself.

loans.use: to purchase a sheep.

loans.name: Mario Rony

texts.en:
Mario Rony lives a simple life with his family in the town of Calape, Bohol. He is a 47-year-old married man and has three adult children. He raised his family for 15 years by operating a chainsaw. In addition to this, he and his wife are also running a sari-sari (variety) store business.

He is asking for a loan to buy a variety of goods such as toiletries, canned goods, noodles, eggs, spices, cooking oil, sugar, salt, candies, chips, biscuits, coffee and powdered chocolate drink. He will also buy chainsaw blade.

Mario Rony wants to improve their business for their sustainability. He wants to sustain these businesses because it is their main source of income.

loans.use: to buy a chainsaw blade, toiletries, canned goods, noodles, eggs, spices, cooking oil, sugar, salt, candies, chips, biscuits, coffee and powdered chocolate drink.

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Jean used her previous loan to buy raw material and supplies for her food stall business. She never thought that it would be very easy to apply for a loan from Center for Community Transformation (CCT) but they quickly responded to her application. Genuine appreciation she wants to send to all of the people used by God for the approval and assistance of her previous loan.

Jean is now able to earn an approximate amount of PHP 8,000 every month. She dreams that the business will continue to operate and be more progressive because the business has helped her sustain their daily needs ever since in addition to the income earned by her husband. To maintain the freshness of every raw ingredient that she has, she plans to buy a new freezer this year and to buy necessities for her food business. So she is applying again for a loan of PHP 35,000. If granted, the amount will make a vast impact on her business.

Jean is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gains spiritual strength from the other members' life changing testimony, shares her own experience of God’s love, pays Micro Finance loans and hears God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to have a revolving fund to buy raw ingredients on a daily basis.

loans.name: Leonalyn

texts.en:
Leonalyn is 50 years old and married with one child who is in school, Leonalyn works very hard to provide for them.

Leonalyn has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Leonalyn has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, shampoo, canned goods and other groceries.

In the future Leonalyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Enaya

texts.en:
Enaya is a married woman from Jenin. She has applied for a loan to purchase construction materials to renovate her house.

Enaya is a mother of two children who are attending schoo. Enaya is a housewife while her husband is a construction worker and he will renovate their house before winter.

Enaya is requesting)USD) $500 from Kiva’s partner Alibdaa and she is very grateful for each Kiva team and Alibdaa Palestine.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to renovate her house.

loans.name: Aïda

texts.fr: Mère de deux enfants, Aïda est une femme mariée âgée de 28 ans résidant à Agoè. Aïda est une marchande de bouillie  préparée à base du maïs et accompagné des beignets à domicile. Aïda revend sa marchandise au bord de la route. Aïda s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché du nécessaire pour sa préparation et demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs de maïs, de farine de blé, de sucre et de bidon d’huile afin de gagner une marge bénéficiaire assez importante pour pouvoir aider son mari dans les charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Aïda is a married 28-year-old woman and the mother of two children living in Agoè. She sells corn porridge with beignets that she prepares at her home, and sells her products at the side of the road. Twice per month, she gets the necessary supplies for what she makes from the market.

Aïda is seeking this loan to purchase sacks of corn, wheat flour, and sugar and a container of oil in order to earn a large enough profit margin to be able to help her husband with the family's expenses.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of corn, wheat flour, and sugar and a container of oil to make corn porridge and beignets.

loans.name: Niyingabiye Group

texts.fr:
Daniel  fait partie du groupe  Niyingabiye et  habite à  Gitega. Il a 66 ans et est marié à Angèle ,une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants ,dont  3 étudient. 

Il fait le commerce de vin de banane  depuis  30 ans. 

C’est son premier   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande quantité de banane pour la fabrication de la bière de banane à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, il voudrait voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Daniel is part of the Niyingabiye Group and lives in Gitega. He is 66 years old and is married to Angèle, a farmer. Together, they have five children, three of whom attend school.

Daniel has been selling banana beer for 30 years. This is his first loan with Turame. With this Kiva loan he is receiving, he will increase his capital and purchase a large quantity of bananas to make banana beer to sell in order to earn more.

In the coming years, Daniel would like to see his children study.

loans.use: to increase his capital and to purchase a large quantity of bananas to make banana beer to sell in order to earn more.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Philippines is well-known for its very unique and tasteful native delicacies, one of which is called “suman”. It’s a sweet delicacy made from rice flour and added flavorings. Filipinos really love to eat. That’s why you can find varieties of foods there. Sinukmani, Bibingka, puto and kutsinta are other examples of it. Varieties of rice cakes can be found in most parts of the country since it’s easy to make, affordable yet delicious.

Marivic is a 44 year-old business woman who cooks and sells suman. She has been in the business for more than five years now. She needs to wake up early every day to cook and sell hot suman. She is persistent every day to make a living and earn more profit for her family. She needs added capital to buy ingredients and necessities for the business. Like other entrepreneurs, Marivic dreams to succeed in the business. For this, Marivic applied for a PHP 10,000 loan.

On a weekly basis, Marivic regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience in the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and necessities for her food business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a married woman. She has 5 children. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, flour, cooking fat, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour, cooking fat and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will become a reknowned business woman. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, rice, flour, cooking fat and other items.

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 56 years old and widowed with eight children. Rosita works very hard to provide for them.

Rosita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21500 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Rosita has been in this business for 8 years and sells a variety of items such as soft-drinks, noodles, sanitary pads, diapers, beers, biscuits, cooking oil, vinegar, etc. 

In the future, Rosita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ramzana

texts.en:
Ramzana runs a clothing sales business that she operates from her home. She is hardworking and friendly. Her pleasant nature makes her favorite of her clients and her small business helps her manage the day to day expenses and she can hardly save for other purposes.

In order to increase sales she wants to buy winter clothes as winter is are coming and demand for winter clothes have increased. Therefore she has requested for a Microfinance loan to buy these seasonal items and sell it at reasonable margins. She is hopeful to increase sales and open up another shop in the market.

loans.use: to buy warm clothes to sell in the winter.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
Bahati is a married mother of seven children, five of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over ten years, she has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business.

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her busines

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Noor is a single girl from Jenin. She is working in a clothing store in order to help her family in their expenses, despite the fact that she is still a student in the university and she needs to pay the tuition for this semester. So she is requesting Kiva’s partner, ALIBDAA, to help her in continuing her study. She needs $500 for the payment for the university.

Noor is very grateful for the whole team in Kiva and ALIBDAA microfinance.

loans.use: to pay the tuition costs in order to continue her education.

loans.name: Kurbonby

texts.en:
Kurbonby is widowed and has 4 children. She is the only keeper of her children who are are 15, 12, 6 and 3 years old. Kurbonby for some years worked in a State museum. She has no higher education and that’s why she is a cleaning woman with a small salary, thus she hardly manages family expenses.

She must buy coal and wood to keep warmly her house in winter season, as in the winter season, there is a problem with electricity in Tajikistan. She is asking for a loan of 2200 Somoni to buy coal and wood. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy wood and coal for heating during the winter season.

loans.name: Marline

texts.en:
Marline was granted a loan amount of PHP 50,000 almost four months ago and was able to use the amount for her variety store business. She’s grateful as CCT and lenders helped her a lot in the business. She bought a variety of grocery items to stock her store.

Marline aims to have a one stop shop someday where she can have all of the items needed by the consumers. That is why she’s contemplating of ways on how to attract new buyers/consumers. Since it is her bread and butter, Marline exerts her effort and hard work for the business. Added capital and revolving fund will help her business flourish. With this, Marline decided to apply for another PHP 20,000 loan for her to buy additional products for the variety store such as bottled drinks, grocery items, school supplies and other products.

Marline regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks such as laundry products, drinks, toiletries, canned goods, school supplies and other items for the business.

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.en:
Beatriz is 59 years old and has eight children. Beatriz is married and has one child who is still in school.

Beatriz is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Beatriz requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Beatriz has been in pig fattening for ten years now, and has borrowed fourteen times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Beatriz would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia is very energetic and with excellent communication skills and she manages her clothes sewing business well. She is aged 36 and mother of four children, residing with her husband in Rawalpindi, Pakistan.

Asia takes a lot of orders at a time, but now she thinks that she requires another machine to get her sewing done with effectiveness and efficiency. Therefore she applied for a Kiva loan to help herself proceed with her orders in less time. She is obliged to the Kiva team and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in a new machine for her sewing business.

loans.name: Celeste

texts.en: Celeste is a 30-year-old woman from Clarin, Bohol. She is married with four children; they are seven, six, two and one-year-old. Her husband is a painter while Celeste buys and sells junk materials. She has been doing this for eight years to help her husband raised their family. Thus, she is asking for a loan for additional capital to her junk shop. She is asking for a loan of PHP15000 to buy junk materials. Celeste wants to be successful in her business for her children’s future.

loans.use: to buy junk materials for recycling

loans.name: Eliud

texts.en:
Eliud is a married man with 4 children. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells milk and has been involved in this business for 8 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be drought which leads to low milk production. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy dairy meal for his dairy cows. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children to university level. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to expand business and take care of his family.

loans.use: to buy dairy meal for his dairy cows

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is now able to earn an approximate amount of 25,000 PHP every month. She wants to thank all of the people who have been a part of the previous loan approval. This also would not be possible without the help of all of the lenders. She wants to extend her sincerest appreciation.

Lorna aims to have a continuous business operation. She is contemplating ways on how to increase the business’ revenue. That is why she takes advantage every time of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT), which conducts business seminars to broaden knowledge on business.

Lorna decided to apply for a loan amount of 50,000 PHP, which will be used for buying stocks of ready-to-wear clothes, because the demand on products is increasing during the holiday season. She is determined to succeed in the business for her family. She helps support her children’s educational expenses because she wants them to finish college and find a better job someday.

Despite being busy managing the business, Lorna spares time for her CCT fellowship group, which consists of ten to fifteen individuals. She can gain strength spiritually, hear testimony from other CCT partners, hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationships with other partners, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional ready-to-wear products for her store.

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia joined Community Transformation (CCT) on year 2004. Basically, she buys and sell mineral water which is one of their source living. She’s been in the business for 12 years and striving her best to succeed on her chosen industry for it provides extra income for her family.

As a mother, she wants her children to finish college. She’s a person who loves to cook and wants to establish her own cafe someday. But for now, she wants to have continuous stocks of mineral water for her buy and sell business. That’s why she decided to apply for a loan of PHP 12,000. She is hoping that CCT will grant her loan request since this will be a great help for her business’ growth.

Claudia believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gain spiritual strength for member’s life changing testimony , share her own experience of God’s love, pay Micro Finance loans and hear God’s word that was conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to have continuous stocks of mineral water for her buy and sell business.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.en:
Managing a small sari-sari store is the source of income for Angelica from Tondo, Philippines. She has had the business for only months and is earning enough daily. A sari-sari store is a Tagalog word meaning “variety”. It is a small type of convenience store where items are much cheaper compared to supermarkets since here you can buy items by piece, kilo or volume.

Like any business, competition from others in the same industry line is one of the prime challenges for her. That’s why Angelica is always focused on handling the business and on marketing schemes to attract new customers. With the help of the Lord, Angelica’s greatest foundation, the business is able to survive on a daily basis.

She wants to invest for her own house and lot someday and be able to continually support the education of her children - which is why she’s working hard every day to earn more profit. Angelica is hopeful that CCT will grant the loan of PHP 10,000 since this amount will be used to buy grocery items for her sari-sari store business.

Angelica regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience of the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for her variety store business.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 56 years old, married with three children.

Nilda works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

Nilda has borrowed and paid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from fattening pigs.

Nilda aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa works hard to support her family. Elsa is married and has a business raising livestock in the Philippines.

Elsa requested a PHP 45,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Elsa has been in this business for 15 years now.

Elsa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

loans.name: Mchezia

texts.en:
Mchezia is a married woman. She has three children, none of whom attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past two years, she has operated a business selling motorcycle spare parts from her home. Her potential customers are motorcycle operators. Her major challenge is seasonality in her place of operation.

With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase inventory of motorcycle spare parts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Jose Lazaro

texts.es:
José, es actualmente es casado, vive con su pareja y tres hijos, de los cuales dos estudian, es una persona reconocida en la zona por ser responsable y trabajador, su manera de generar ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su familia es cultivar granos básicos, tanto para consumo familiar como para vender, además tiene experiencia criando cerdos para luego venderlos, cada invierno trabaja en el campo con sus hijos cultivando maíz, maicillo y frijol.
Para tener una mejor cosecha, está necesitando de un crédito con el que podrá comprar abono para fortalecer sus cultivos, pues es un insumo básico para realizar sus trabajos de agricultura, La finalidad de trabajar con créditos es tener un negocio más rentable para resarcir sus deudas y cubrir las necesidades de su familia.
Su deseo es que en está ocasión la cosecha sea más abundante, ya que en la anterior por el mal invierno tuvo pérdidas.
texts.en:
José is currently married. He lives with his partner and three children; two of them go to school. Locals think of him as a responsible and hardworking person. He grows vegetables to earn an income and cover the home expenses. He uses some of the produce to feed his family. José has also worked raising pigs to sell. He works every winter in the fields with his children, growing corn, green beans, and beans.

He needs a loan to improve his plantations. He will use it to buy fertilizers to strengthen his plantations; this is an essential agricultural supply for his activity. Loans help him to have a more profitable business, pay off his debts, and cover the needs of his family.

He hopes to have a more abundant harvest this time. Last winter was harsh, so it ended with losses for him.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to strengthen his plantations.

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre la Esperanza está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comités, es un grupo nuevo que forma parte del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, cada una poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Cada una de las personas que integra este grupo está luchando por salir adelante, entre las que se destaca Lucrecia, una mujer muy sacrificada, quien comenta que hace un tiempo ya que se dedica al comercio, tiene una despensa bien surtida en la que todos los días trabaja desde muy temprano en la mañana.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para su negocio, como ser bebidas, verduras, frutas, panificados y otros, y de esa manera poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The name of this group is Esperanza [Hope]. This is its first cycle in the Women Committee Program. It is a new group and is part of the Poverty Elimination Program. Each member works hard in order to grow and improve their living conditions.

Each one of the members is fighting to get ahead. Among them, there is Lucrecia, a hardworking woman. She says that she has been a businesswoman for some time now. She has a well-stocked store, where she works every day, starting early in the morning.

She is requesting this loan to buy supplies for her business, such as beverages, vegetables, fruits, and bakery products. This will help her to continue selling her products, as she has been doing so far.

loans.use: to buy beverages, vegetables, fruits, and bakery products, among other things.

loans.name: Letecia

texts.en:
Letecia’s Variety store business is continually growing. She considers Center for Community Transformation (CCT) and all of the lenders participating in the Kiva program as God’s way of sharing blessings. She’s delighted to have CCT, since the prior loan of PHP 30,000 was granted and the amount was a supplementary capital for her business growth. She was able to buy necessary items for the business to become more attractive to customers.

Competition in this line of business is what challenges her. Proper marketing strategy and good treatment of customers are the qualities that she has. For 16 years and until now she has had the business and it’s still growing. Letecia is able to support her children’s education because of her diligence and determination. However, she’s not satisfied about the recent status of the business since as an entrepreneur you should always think of ways on how to step-up.

She applied for another loan of PHP 40,000 as she wants her business to be a one-stop-shop for dry goods someday. She’s hoping that her request will be granted and will provide an added capital for the business.

Letecia believes that if you want success to come in, you need God to be your greatest foundation. She is consistent in attending weekly fellowship group for CCT partners that consists of 15 to 30 members where she gains spiritual strength from hearing members' life-changing testimony, sharing her own experience of God’s love, paying Micro Finance loans and hearing God’s word that is conveyed to them every week.

loans.use: to buy grocery items for her variety store business.

loans.name: Sidi

texts.en: Sidi is a widowed woman. She has four children. She describes herself as energetic. She operates a retail business in which she sells tomatoes, potatoes, onions, and cabbages. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more vegetables. Her business goal is to expand business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables.

loans.name: Juan Mario

texts.es:
Juan, cuenta que con el crédito anterior le fue de gran ayuda ya que logro salir adelante con la venta de medicina, además eso le permite darle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. En la actualidad se dedica únicamente a dar el servicio de moto taxi, es un negocio que ha impulsado con las ganancias obtenidas, de la inversión anterior, 
Juan nuevamente solicita un crédito para poder invertirlo en la compra de repuestos para su unidad de transporte, así como llantas, frenos, bujías, etc., considera que le será de gran ayuda ya que le permitirá poder continuar generando ingresos, para que su familia tenga mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Juan says that the previous loan was very helpful for him. He was able to get ahead with his medicine sales, offer his family better living conditions, and fulfill his customers' demands. He is currently working with his mototaxi. He has given momentum to this business with the profits he made from the previous investment.

Juan is again requesting a loan to buy spare parts for his vehicle, such as tires, brake linings, and spark plugs. He believes this will be of great help for him, because he will be able to continue earning an income so that his family can live a better life.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his vehicle: tires, brake linings, spark plugs, etc.

loans.name: Niño Salvador Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Niño Salvador, está en su ciclo número 3 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de  Concepción, una zona alejada de la capital del país que aun está en crecimiento y donde tiene difícil acceso para muchos servicios básicos.
La Sra. Venancia es una de las integrantes, ella es madre soltera, se dedica a la costura ya que posee una pequeña maquina, su objetivo es poder comprar una maquina más para ir creciendo en su trabajo, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora. Ella es una mujer muy sacrificada que quiere ser alguien en la vida, y es por ello que se esfuerza.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, hilos, gomas, botones, cierres y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus confecciones como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
This group is called Niño Salvado, and is is in its third cycle of it's women's committee program. The group is from the city of Concepcion, a remote area of the capital that is still growing and where it is difficult to access many basic services.

Venancia is one of the members of the group; she is a single mother is makes a living as a seamstress, and as she already owns a small machine, she wants to buy a bigger sewing machine to grow her business. She is a hardworking and enterprising woman . She is a woman who sacrifices a lot and who wants to be somebody in life, which is why she works so hard.

Venancia is requesting this loan to buy fabric, thread, rubber, buttons, zippers and other supplies, in order to be able to continue with her work as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, rubber, buttons, zippers and other supplies to use for sewing.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo lleva por nombre Mujeres Emprendedoras  está en su ciclo número 18  del programa de comité de mujeres, están además dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, luchando cada una para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Norma, quien se dedica al humilde trabajo de venta de remedios naturales, comenta que por medio de este trabajo tiene los medios para poder ayudar a su familia y luchar por darles una vida digna.
La Sra. Norma  solicita de este préstamo para la compra de remedios naturales para mates y terere, lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos. Ella agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder crecer y mejorar en su humilde emprendimiento.
texts.en:
The "Entrepreneurial Women" group is in its 18th cycle of the women's committee. It is also part of the poverty elimination program, which helps each member work to improve her living conditions. 

Norma is one of the members. She sells natural remedies and says that this occupation allows her to support her family and provide them with a decent life.

Norma is requesting a loan to buy natural remedies, which will allow her to carry out her business plan and improve her income. She is thankful for the opportunity that she is receiving to grow and improve her small business.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies for sale.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a Kiva borrower, with 2 children. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals and has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 35,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to have a big cereals store within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Aspiring entrepreneurs are thankful for Kiva lenders for having a compassionate hearts in helping people who needs financial support. One of them is Vivian. She was granted a loan of Php 20,000 which was used for buying stocks of personal items for her buy and sell business. She wants to thank lenders for helping her grow the business.

Vivian is focused on how to make the business earn more profit. She aims to save money, since she’s also planning to establish an added business. She believes that this will be the start for her business to flourish through the help of God and people who have compassionate hearts to give help.

This year, Vivian is applying for a loan of Php 30,000. The amount will be used to buy stocks of personal products so that customers will not wait for weeks just to have the items. She uses this strategy to have an increase on her daily earnings.

Despite of being busy managing the business, Vivian spares time attending CCT group fellowship that consist of 10-15 individuals where she can gain strength spiritually and where she hear testimonies from other CCT partners and able to hear God’s word, study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To buy stocks of personal products for her buy and sell business.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.en:
Haydee is a 53-year-old married woman with five children, two of whom are in school. For the past 20 years, she has operated a rug-making business in the Philippines. Haydee is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Haydee is requesting a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more materials for her rug-making business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials for her rug-making business

loans.name: Arnelli

texts.en:
Arnelli is a 29-year-old married woman with two children who are in school. For the past three years, she has run a business buying and selling frozen foods in the Philippines. Arnelli is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Arnelli is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase frozen foods to sell to customers

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Sughran is very creative and dedicated married woman. She has been practicing embroidery since she was a child and later after her marriage she started her own business, which has been running 7 years now. She is a professional and runs her embroidery business on her own and is also supported by her family members,as they encourage her by telling where she lacks.

Sughran has got a big order from one of her customers so she applied for the loan to buy the required items for the task she is assigned. Furthermore Sughran is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy embroidery materials for herself.

loans.name: Enma

texts.es:
La señora  Enma  de 42 años de edad, tiene casa propia vive con su esposo en  Nacaome Valle al sur de Honduras se dedica desde hace 06 años a su negocio de pulpería sus clientes son todos los amigos y vecinos que transitan por la zona  también tiene un taller de herrería es una mujer  trabajadora con muchos deseos de salir adelante.

La señora Enma con el prestamo que está solicitando espera comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, café, pan, huevos  refrescos etc. Con esto espera mejorar su negocio y así poder tener una mejor calidad de vida agradece a Prisma por la oportunidad que le puede brindar.

Su sueño es poder mejorar su negocio y poder tener una mejor calidad vida.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Septiembre 2015.
texts.en:
Enma, age 42, lives in her own house with her husband. She lives in the Nacaome Valle in southern Honduras. She has had a grocery store for six years. Her customers are all her friends and neighbors that travel through the area. She also has a blacksmith business. She is a hard-working woman with a great desire to get ahead. Enma will use the loan that she is requesting to buy rice, beans, sugar, coffee, bread, eggs, and soft drinks, etc. With this she hope to improve her business. This way she will be able to have a better quality of life. She is grateful to Prisma for the opportunity that they are able to offer her. Her dream is to be able to improve her business and to be able to have a better quality of life.


San Lorenzo, Honduras - September, 2015.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, coffee, bread, eggs, and soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: El Arroyo Group

texts.es:
Ma Teresa es una señora con muy buen humor, no deja pasar las oportunidades para bromear con las personas y ayudar a crear un clima de confianza. Ella se dedica a la siembra de maíz y a la cría de borregos, ambas actividades muy comunes en la comunidad que habita. En esta época, las casas están rodeadas de tallos y mazorcas, las personas se preparan para la cosecha que comenzará en noviembre.
“Trabajar la milpa no es fácil” comenta Ma Teresa quien afortunadamente tiene su propia tierra desde hace 4 años a diferencia de muchas otras personas que tienen que rentar parcelas para sembrar. El maíz que cosecha Ma Teresa lo utiliza principalmente para autoconsumo, pero siempre sobra una pequeña porción que puede vender y así tener una ganancia extra. 
La actividad principal de Ma Teresa es la venta de borregos que le permite apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Delfino, su pareja, trabaja en la construcción en la capital y únicamente se ven los fines de semana cuando él regresa a la comunidad. Entre semana, Ma Teresa se encarga de los animales, la parcela y sus 4 niños. 
Gracias a los préstamos de VFMéxico que ha recibido desde hace 2 años y a su gran esfuerzo, ella ha logrado hacer algunas renovaciones a su vivienda y comenta que puede comparar con mayor facilidad ropa y zapatos para sus pequeños. El nuevo préstamo lo invertirá en algunos borregos y alimento. Sin embargo, aún hay mucho qué hacer y es que ella sueña con aprender a cortar el cabello y abrir una estética en un futuro.
Las demás integrantes del grupo son Lourdes y Mauricia quienes invertirán en toros; Juana, en su tienda; Clara y María de la Luz, en borregos. 

*La fotografía se capturó en la plaza central del municipio donde habitan los integrantes. Ma Teresa viste una blusa morada y un rebozo verde botella, tiene de la mano a una de sus pequeñas.
texts.en:
Ma Teresa is a woman with a great sense of humor. She never misses an opportunity to joke with people and help create a climate of confidence. She works planting corn and breeding lambs, both of which are common trades in the community in which she lives. In this season, the houses are surrounded by stalks and cobs. People are preparing for the harvest that will begin in November. "To work in the cornfield isn't easy," Ma Teresa says. Fortunately she has had her own land for 4 years, in contrast to many others who have to rent parcels to sow. The corn Ma Teresa harvests she uses principally to feed her family, but there is always a small portion left over that she can sell to earn a little extra.

Her primary job is breeding lambs. This allows her to help her husband with the household expenses. Delfino, her husband, works in construction in the capital. They only see each other on the weekends when he returns to their community. During the week, Ma Teresa takes care of the animals, the parcel of land, and their 4 children. Thanks to the loans of VFMéxico that she received 2 years ago and to her great effort, she has managed to make some renovations to her home, and can buy clothes and shoes for her little ones with greater ease. She will use the new loan to invest on buying some lambs and food. Nevertheless, there is still much to do, and she dreams of learning to cut hair and open a salon in the future. The other members of the group are Lourdes and Mauricio who invest in bulls, Juana who invests in a store, and Clara and María de Luz who invest in lambs.

*The photo was taken in the central plaza of the town where the members live. Ma Teresa is wearing a purple blouse and a green shawl. She is holding the hand of one of her children.

loans.use: para comprar borregos y alimento

location.town: San Juan Cote, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are regular. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to own a bigger business within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: buy more materials for her tailoring business

loans.name: Erwina

texts.en:
Erwina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a direct selling tupperware and fullerlife products business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase more products to sell to her customers for her direct selling tupperware and fullerlife products business.

Erwina has been in this business for 8 years. Erwina earns more income from selling ready to wear.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Erwina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more products to sell to her customers

loans.name: Kwekwe

texts.en:
Kwekwe is a married woman with five children, three of whom attend school. The other two are still too young for school. For the past year, Kwekwe has operated a general store where she sells household consumables such as wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. Her  major business challenge is customers taking too long to repay goods taken on credit. Kwekwe owns a house without electricity or running water. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Kwekwe is requesting a loan to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour

loans.name: Tereza

texts.es:
Tereza es una mujer muy trabajadora y excelente madre, dueña de una pulpería que está situada en su hogar desde hace mas de 20 años, la cual ha sido una importante fuente de ingresos para su familia.
Tereza es una mujer muy positiva, y siempre está buscando la manera de superarse, tanto personalmente como económicamente, es por eso que está solicitando un nuevo préstamo, el cual le sería muy útil para continuar surtiendo su tienda, mediante la compra de arroz, aceite, jabón y prendas de vestir, las cuales le dejarían un margen de ganancias más amplio y le permitiría seguir sosteniendo a su familia económicamente y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Tereza is very hardworking and an excellent mother. She has owned a corner store located in her home for more than 20 years, which has been an important source of income for her family. Tereza is a very positive woman, and is always looking for a way to improve, both personally and economically.

For that reason she is seeking a new loan which she will use to continue stocking her store through the purchase of rice, oil, soap and items of clothing. These will give her a wider profit margin, and will permit her to continue supporting her family economically, and to improve the conditions of her life.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, soap, and items of clothing.

loans.name: Maryam

texts.en:
Maryam is 46 years old lives in Baqaa and she is mother of five children. Maryam is ‎conservative woman and asked her son Omar to take her place in the photo. She had been ‎facing difficulties in her life, her husband is working for a low income and she is working hard and doing anything to help her husband and she never complains.

Now her son ‎Omar is 24 years old and he is studying Marketing. She want to see him graduate and ‎find good work, perhaps he will remove some of the responsibility that she carried all these ‎years and help his father with the household expenses. Maryam applied for an educational ‎loan to pay the university fees for Omar because she could not cover his fees.‎

loans.use: to pay her son's university fees in Marketing, because she could not cover his fees.‎.

loans.name: Carolina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Carolina, de 24 años de edad, solo estudio educación básica, actualmente vive con su tía porque sus padres fallecieron cuando ella era una niña.

Carolina, desde muy joven ha trabajado, ella salía a vender frutas y verduras en la comunidad, porque con esos ingresos a salido adelante.

Ahora Carolina, necesita el préstamo para comprar un frízer porque quiere vender bebidas frías y también quiere dedicarse a vender hielo. 

El sueño de Carolina, es comprar un terreno, para formar su propio hogar propio y mantener su negocio.
texts.en:
Carolina is 24 years old and received a basic education. She currently lives with her aunt because her parents passed away when she was a child. Carolina has worked from a very young age. She went out to sell fruits and vegetables in the community, because with this income she could move ahead.

Now Carolina is requesting a loan to buy a freezer because she wants to sell cold drinks and she also wants to sell ice. Carolina's dream is to buy some land to build her own house and maintain her business.

loans.use: to buy a freezer because she wants to sell cold drinks and ice.

loans.name: Yllson

texts.en:
Residing in rural southeastern Albania, Yllson is 61 and a married father of two children in their late teens. He is photographed in front of the family home, and one can tell how poorly his family lives. He did not want to be photographed inside the house, because he felt ashamed of the living conditions.

For almost 25 years Yllson has been engaged in agriculture, earning only about $1000 per year since their land area, upon which they grow beans, is quite small.

"We are very poor. The money we have been making has been very little. Not enough for food, let alone other things. My teenage kids, most of the time, go to bed with no dinner, but just a piece of bread and that's it. I feel sorry for them," said Yllson during the interview.

Yllson is requesting this loan start up a fresh produce wholesale business.

loans.use: to start up a fresh produce wholesale business, purchasing from area farmers to sell in cities.

loans.name: Yessenia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Yessenia, de 19 años de edad, es una persona emprendedora y luchadora, tiene un negocio de venta de tortillas desde hace 5 años y con esto ha logrado salir adelante con su familia. 
 
Yessenia, aprendió el negocio por medio de su mamá, para poder trabajar y llevar el sustento a su familia y ayudar a su pareja a trabajar para colaborar con la alimentación de su familia.   
  
El préstamo lo necesita para comprar maíz y leña para su negocio.
 
Yessenia, sueña con hacer crecer a su familia y que sus hijos gozen de buena salud.
texts.en: Yessenia, 19 years old, is an enterprising person and a fighter. She has had a business selling tortillas for 5 years now and with this, she has managed to carry on with her family. She learned the trade through her mother to be able to work, support her family, and help her partner by working to collaborate in feeding her family. Yessenia needs the loan to buy corn and firewood for her business. She dreams of making her family grow and of her children enjoying good health.

loans.use: to buy corn and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is a single mother who is taking care of one daughter. She works a lot.

She works as a cashier at a financial institution and she also has an artisan business where she makes musical instruments.

Lourdes is making big efforts to build up her house, so she needs a loan to pay the construction of a perimeter wall. She hopes you can help.

loans.use: to pay for the construction of a perimeter wall around her house.

loans.name: Maria Emilia

texts.es:
La señora María Emilia de 66 años de edad es soltera, no tiene  hijos que dependan de ella ya que su hija es mayor de edad,  vive en  san Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 16  años  al negocio de venta  ropa interior y ropa normal su venta es formal, es una persona muy trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante.
 
Doña María Emilia está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de ropa como blusas, vestidos, faldas, pantalones, etc. porque quiere  aprovechar esta temporada de navidad. Con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos. Está muy contenta del apoyo que Prisma le puede brindar.

 Su sueño es poder mejorar su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras- de octubre del 2015.
texts.en:
Maria Emilia, who is 66 years old, is single and has no children that rely on her because her daughter is grown up. She lives in San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras. She has her own house and has been working for 16 years in the business of selling underwear and normal clothing. Her sales are businesslike. She is a very hard-working person with the desire to get ahead.

Maria Emilia is applying for the loan to purchase clothing such as blouses, dresses, skirts, pants, etc. because she wants to take advantage of this Christmas season. With the support of this loan, she plans to improve her income. She is very happy about the support that Prisma can offer her.

Her dream is to improve her house.

San Lorenzo, Honduras, October 2015.

loans.use: para la compra de vestidos, blusas, faldas, pantalones,etc. para su negocio.

loans.name: Maria Haydee

texts.es:
Hace dos años, María decidió emprender en su propio negocio, por primera vez, con el objetivo de comenzar a ahorrar para los estudios de su hija de cuatro años, con los ingresos de una pulpería. A sus 33 años, ha sentido que la vida le ha vivido una vida plena junto con su esposo, su pequeña y trabajando de todo empleo digno que encontrara. 
Actualmente ella posee una de las pulperías más reconocidas en su vecindario, además de tener un criadero de cerdos, el cual funciona como ingresos extras. María solicita un préstamo para comprar granos básicos, jabones, shampoo, panes, papel higiénico, entre otros productos de gran demanda para surtir su pulpería, puesto quiere seguir creciendo con ella y así asegurar el futuro de su hija.
texts.en: Two years ago, Maria decided to launch her own business, for the first time, with the goal of starting to save for her four-year-old daughter's education, with the earnings from running a convenience store. At 33, she feels she has lived a full life alongside her husband and their little daughter, working as hard as she could at whatever dignified job she could find. Now she owns one of the most popular convenience stores in her neighborhood, aside from raising pigs, which brings in extra income. Maria is applying for a loan to buy staple grains, soap, shampoo, breads, toilet paper, and other products in high demand to stock her store; she wants to continue to grow the business and secure her daughter's future.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, soap, shampoo, breads, toilet paper, and other products.

loans.name: Ma. Ester

texts.en:
Maryl Lizzete is 21 years old, the second of three children in the family. Her mother, Ma. Ester, a member of NWTF, supports the family by purchasing and selling coconuts in the Philippines.

Maryl Lizzete is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Pharmacy degree and is currently in her second year of this four-year course. Ma. Ester is requesting a loan of PHP 20000 to pay her tuition fees for the second semester of the 2015-16 school year.

When she graduates, Maryl Lizzete plans to be gainfully employed so she can help to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition fees.

loans.name: Edis Adilia

texts.es:
Edis, de 32 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está soltera y vive con sus abuelos y tiene una hija.

Edis, tiene tres años de experiencia en la venta de pupusas, este negocio lo inicio debido a la necesidad que tenía para aportar ingresos económicos para su familia.

Edis, necesita el préstamo para comprar carne, harina, chicharrones, tomates, repollo y para ampliar su negocio, porque en los últimos meses han aumentado sus clientes.

El sueño principal de Edis, es que su hija pueda estudiar hasta que obtenga un título universitario y mejorar su negocio para que también mejore la situación económica de su familia.
texts.en:
Edis is 32 years old, single, left education after the ninth grade, and lives with her grandparents. She has a daughter.

Edis has three years' experience selling pupusas, traditional El Salvadorian corn tortillas filled with meat or cheese. She began the business because she needed to contribute to the family income.

Edis needs the loan to buy meat, flour, crackling, tomato and cabbage, and expand her business, because in recent months she has been getting more customers.

Edis' biggest dream is for her daughter to be able to study to obtain a university degree, and to improve her business so that her family's financial situation also improves.

loans.use: to buy meat, flour, crackling, tomato and cabbage, and expand her business.

loans.name: Jose Raul

texts.es:
Raúl, de 49 años de edad, trabaja en la agricultura, está acompañado y su pareja trabaja en los oficios domésticos y juntos tienen 5 hijos y todos asisten a la escuela.

Raúl, se dedica a la siembra de maíz y a la crianza de especies menores como gallinas y cerdos y a la ganadería; su pareja le ayudad con esta labor y el lugar donde cultiva está a 15 minutos de distancia de su casa.

El dinero que está solicitando es para comprar fertilizantes para aplicarlos a 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz que tiene sembrados. 

El sueño de Raúl, es construir su vivienda para brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Raúl, 49 years old, works in agriculture. He is in a relationship and his partner is a housekeeper. They have five children and all of them go to school. 

Raúl makes a living growing corn and raising small animals such as chickens, pigs, and ranching. His partner helps him with this work and the place where he farms is 15 minutes away from his house. 

The money he is requesting is to buy fertilizers to apply them to 14,000 square meters of corn which he has planted. 

Raúl's dream is to build his house to provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to apply them to 14,000 square meters of corn.

loans.name: Republica Alemana Group

texts.es:
Grupo ¨República Alemana¨, lo coordina Roger de 36 años, casado y con 3 hijos de 8,10,12 años, quien se esfuerza para poder enviarlo recibir la educación secundaria  y poder ser una profesional más adelante. Tiene su negocio de venta de frutas y verduras. Negocio iniciado desde hace 15 años con la ayuda de su económica de su papa. Ahora con el dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra cosechas de tamarindo. 
Las otras integrantes es Lesbia de 35 años quien prepara y vende comida y Marvin, de 41 años quien como todo padre responsable busca la mejoría de su hogar y se dedica a la venta de cosechas.
texts.en:
The coordinator of the República Alemana Group is Roger, who is 36 years old, married. He has three children aged 8, 10 and 12 for whom he works hard to to send to secondary school and be a professional later on. He has a business selling fruits and vegetables, and his business began 15 years ago with the financial support of his father. 

Now, with the money he is requesting, he will invest in the purchase of tamarind crops. The other members of the group are Lesbia, 35, who prepares and sells the food and Marvin, 41, who, as all responsible father seeks to improve his home, and he sells crops.

loans.use: to purchase tamarind crops.

loans.name: Milagro Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Milagro no se agobió por su separación con su esposo, tenía una mantenedora y se le ocurrió trabajar haciendo refrescos naturales y del cual le ha sacado todo el provecho posible. Doña Milagro se ha convertido en inspiración para su hijo ya que ha sabido sobrellevar todas las situaciones que ha vivido y sacar provecho de estas. 
Ahora  Doña Milagro espera seguir trabajando realizando refrescos naturales para costear los estudios de su hijo y las necesidades de su familia, conocida en su comunidad por hacer los mejores refrescos, por tal razón solicita el crédito que le ayudará a incrementar su negocio por lo tanto se dirige a ustedes para contar con su apoyo y poder comprar las frutas, azúcar y también ocupará el dinero para comprar unas llantas a un camión en el que sale a comprar y vender piedras canteras, esto le ayudará a mejorar su medio de trabajo. Doña Milagro tiene como meta que su negocio siga creciendo y poder vender en un futuro cercano granos básicos.
texts.en:
Milagro did not feel depressed when she got separated from her husband. She had a freezer, and thought of making natural beverages. She has tried to be as productive as possible. Milagro has become her son's inspiration, since she has managed to overcome all the difficulties she has faced and has been able to benefit from them. Milagro hopes to continue working making natural beverages to cover his son's tuition fees and the home expenses.

She is well-known in her community for making the best beverages. This is why she is requesting a loan that will help her to expand her business. She has come to you asking for your help to buy fruits and sugar, and also a set of tires for a truck she uses to buy and sell gravel. This will help her to improve her business. Milagro's goal is to continue expanding her business and start selling vegetables in the future.

loans.use: to buy fruits and sugar, and tires for a truck she uses to transport gravel.

loans.name: Nodira

texts.en:
Nodira is a hard working young woman. She is single and lives with her parents.

Nodira learnt sewing from a master. She sews a variety of women's dresses. Nodira is a newcomer in business as she began sewing as a business 4 months ago. She began her business with her mother's old sewing machine. Now she plans to buy a new sewing machine and in this way improve her quality of service.

Nodira is asking for a loan of TJS 2,000 to buy a new sewing machine for developing her business.
She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine for developing her business.

loans.name: Amal

texts.en: Amal is 45, married and has four children, two of whom are married. Her husband is a part-time farmer and she runs a small grocery store where she sells produce to earn money for her family. Amal previously requested and repaid a 5,000 EGP loan and is now requesting another loan, for 7,000 EGP, to buy items to sell such as rice, pasta and fruits and vegetables such as onions, potatoes, bananas, and apples. Her goal is to expand her business and increase her family's income.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as rice, pasta, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Airene

texts.en:
A 42-year-old woman named Airene is selling fresh fish in the market of Estancia, Iloilo with the help of her husband. She is the mother of three children; they are 19, 17 and 12 years old.

Airene and her husband have been selling fresh fish proficiently for 22 years. It is the business that helps her and her husband raise their children. It is their main source of income; that is why she wanted to improve this business for sustainability.

With the help of the funds she is requesting, she will be able to buy assorted fresh fish to sell that can increase her profit and improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Lucia  está en su ciclo número 2° del programa de comité de mujeres, son de la Ciudad de Itá , donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. 
Una de las señoras integrantes es Maxima, quien se dedica a hacer comestibles y comenta que por medio de sus ventas ayuda a su familia. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora que pone todo de sí para poder mejorar y crecer por medio de las capacitaciones que viene haciendo, desde temprano cada día se levanta a hacer sus comidas que después sale a vender de manera ambulante.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar carne, condimentos, hortalizas, pollo, jamón, queso y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir mejorando sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Santa Lucía Group is in its no. 2 loan cycle of the women's committee program. They are from the city of Itá, where all of them work and help each other to succeed.

One of the member ladies is Máxima, who works in making foodstuffs; she says that through her sales, she helps her family. She is a very hardworking person who gives her all to be able to improve and grow through the training she has been doing. She wakes up early each day to make her meals that she later goes out to sell on the streets.

Máxima is asking for this loan to be able to buy meat, spices, vegetables, chicken, ham, cheese, and others, and thus be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing. She is thankful for the opportunity she receives of being able to further improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make food, such as meat, spices, vegetables, chicken, ham, cheese, and others.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado San Roque está en su ciclo número 2, son 15 integrantes donde cada una pone su mayor esfuerzo para poder crecer y mejorar cada día. Todas ellas participan activamente en las actividades que les proporciona la fundación paraguaya.
Maria es una de las que integra este grupo, ella es la presidenta de este grupo, siempre se esfuerza por poder motivar a sus compañeras, y al mismo tiempo se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas que le permite tener los medios para poder ayudar a su familia.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de prendas variadas, como ser camisas, jeans, remeras, pantalones y otros, y de esa manera poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que le permite crecer y mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
The San Roque group is in its second loan cycle. It is composed of 15 members and each one puts forth her best effort to grow and improve every day. They all participate actively in the activities provided by Fundación Paraguaya.

Maria is one of the group's members and is also the president. She always strives to motivate her fellow members and at the same she works selling a variety of clothing which provides her with financial resources to help her family. She is asking for this loan to buy an assortment of clothing such as shirts, jeans, T-shirts, pants, etc. so she can continue selling as she has been doing.

She is grateful for the opportunity to grow and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing for sale such as shirts, jeans, T-shirts, pants, and other items.

loans.name: Argell

texts.en: Argell owns and operates a stall where she sells merchandise such as oil and miki (a dish made of noodles, seasonings, vinegar, green leafy vegetables, eggs and condiments. She is 29 years old, married and the mother of two children. Her husband is a carpenter, and she uses her income to educate her children. Argell has requested a loan to buy assorted items to sell, such as canned goods, sugar, cooking oil, vegetables and spices. Her goal for the future is to provide a good life to her growing children.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is married, the mother of three children and describes herself as focused. For the last five years, she has earned a living by operating a retail business where she sells shoes, handbags, and clothes. Her business is located in a good area where she has many regular customers. Her biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital, and she is requesting a loan for Kes 30,000 to buy more handbags, shoes and other items. Her goal for the future is to buy land. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, and she plans to use the anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more handbags, shoes and other items to sell.

loans.name: Nicholas

texts.en:
Nicholas is a married man with 8 children. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes and metallic boxes. He has been involved in this business for 8 years. His business is located in a busy area and his primary customers are locals.

Nicholas will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes and metallic boxes. His business goal is to expand his business within 5 years. He will use the anticipated profits to open another shop.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes and metallic boxes.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en: As the married parent of two children, Maribeth works hard to support her family by running a general store in the Philippines. She earns additional income by selling frozen foods, and is requesting a loan for PHP 15,000 from NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store. Maribeth has sustained her business with help from eight prior loans from NWTF, and hopes that her hard work will help send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell

loans.name: Muvakani Mbukilye S.h.g Group

texts.en: The woman raising her hand in the photo is Winfred, who is the married mother of four children. She is 36 years old, an active member of Muvakani Mbukilye SHG, and joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from our training, especially on enterprise development. Winfred operates a grocery store where she sells assorted fruits and vegetables such as cabbage, tomatoes, onions, bananas, and oranges.  She is requesting this loan to buy more produce to sell and increase her income. She hopes that this will give her children a better life and pay their school fees. Winfred is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to increase her income by buying more fruits and vegetables to sell in her grocery store.

loans.name: San Antonio Group

texts.es:
Este es un grupo numeroso, formado en la ciudad de Itá, de nombre San Antonio; está en su ciclo número  12 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas se pusieron como meta, el crecimiento, no solo en lo económico, sino también como persona. 
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Mirna, quien  a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo en la venta de ropas que hace, tiene los medios para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos, dándoles una vida digna y sin privaciones como las que ella tuvo que pasar. Mirna es una mujer muy trabajadora que con sacrificio ha podido crecer y salir adelante, pese a los desafíos del día a día.
La Sra. Mirna solicita de este préstamo para la compra de blusas, remeras, pantalones y todo tipo de prendas de vestir; lo que le ayudará a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
This large group called San Antonio was formed in the city of Itá. This is its 12th loan in the women's committee program in which everyone has a goal of not only financial growth, but personal growth as well.

Mirna is one of the members, who, with her effort and her work selling clothing, has the means to be able to help her loved ones, providing them with a dignified life, without the privations she had to experience. Mirna is a very hard-working woman who, with sacrifice has been able to grow and get ahead in spite of her daily challenges. She is asking for this loan so she can buy blouses, T-shirts, pants and all kinds of clothing which will help her to realize her business plan and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy articles of clothing for resale such as blouses, T-shirts, and pants.

loans.name: Marchie

texts.en:
Marchie is 27 years of age, single, and business-minded. She runs a sari-sari store and is a beauty products business owner. She has a lot of customers, and she cannot provide the orders of her other customers because of capital.

Marchie wants her customers to be satisfied with her services. That is why she took a new loan to purchase additional goods for her business.

Marchie is improving her living through her business because she earns income. She plans to have another branch of her beauty products business in a nearby town.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods for her buy-and-sell business.

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
El grupo “Kuña Kyrey” está en su 11º ciclo, donde todas se comprometieron a trabajar y a ayudarse entre todas para salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, como un medio de conocer la situación de cada una y conforme a ello poder esforzarse por mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Lidia, quien se dedica a las costuras, por medio de las confecciones que hace se gana la vida de una manera digna y honesta. Comenta que ha crecido por medio de su negocio gracias a que siempre hace muy buenos trabajos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas, cierres y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus confecciones y ayudando a su familia por medio de su trabajo.
texts.en:
The group "Kuña Kyrey" is in its 11th cycle in which all promise to work and all help each other in order to get ahead. They are taking the test to eliminate poverty as a means to know the situation of each one and in accordance with this to be able to make an effort to improve their life conditions.

One of the members is Lidia who makes a living sewing. Through the creations she makes, she earns a living in a worthy and honest manner. She says she has grown through her business thanks to the fact that she always does good work.

She requests this loan in order to be able to invest in the purchase of cloth, thread, elastics, fasteners, and other things, so as to be able to continue with her creations and helping her family through her work.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread, elastics, fasteners, and other supplies for sewing creations.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Zainab is a 36-year-old married mother of four. Twelve years ago, she started selling clothes to help her husband in covering the increasing needs and expenses of their family. She is a hard worker and an ambitious lady who is well known in her region and she has her loyal customers.

Zainab is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to increase her merchandise with the new winter season new collection to satisfy her customers' needs.

Zainab hopes to expand her business more in the future to increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with the new winter season collection to satisfy her customers' needs.

loans.name: Hashimu

texts.en:
Hashimu is in his early 40s and is married with two school age children. He has been selling lubricants since 2000. He works from 6am to midnight daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be Hashimu's sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to buy and increasehis stock of the best selling lubricants in his shop. He has managed to pay back all his loans successfully. He is doing great with his loans. He used the profit to pay school fees, to repay the loan, bought a plot of land, started building his house and covered his household expenses.

Hashimu will use this loan to increase his stock of lubricants and meet his customers' demands. He will be accountable for paying back his loan.

He dreams of finishing building his house and of expanding it.

loans.use: to increase his stock of lubricants and meet his customers' demands.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah owns a stall inside a public market selling ready-to-wear items such as blouses, t-shirts, shorts, skinny jeans, dry goods and various footwear. She is 33-year old married woman and has three school-aged- children. She lives in the rural town of Carmen, Bohol.

She needs funds to support her existing project. She has requested a loan to buy footwear like shoes and sandals and a variety of stock such as pants and t-shirts. These are tools that could help her improve her earnings and support her family. She could provide better living conditions for the entire family and she could be able to handle her finances and start to save for future use.

Sarah is hoping that some day she will be productive in her chosen field and will be able to continue supporting her children's education for a brighter tomorrow.

loans.use: to buy footwear like shoes and sandals and a variety of other stock like pants and t-shirts.

loans.name: Mankuvar's Group

texts.en:
For anyone and everyone, vegetable shopping is a tedious job, especially if you are a person who goes for it after a long day at work. You do not want to do it, but you need it. This is where Mankuvar comes into the picture. She is a differently abled lady and a vegetable seller by profession. She is 39 years old and she has been selling vegetables for 10 years now.

Her daily routine includes taking care of her family (including her husband and two daughters who are in high school now) and collecting varieties of seasonal vegetables such as cauliflower, cabbage, peas, potatoes, beans, ladies fingers, different varieties of chilies, coriander, etc. from the agents and farmers at a wholesale rate. She delivers quality and her products are fresh anytime of the day, all around the year. She is accessible, she is loyal and she is honest in her buying and selling.

All she wants and hopes is to increase her capital. Therefore, she along with her group member, is requesting a loan amount of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to collect different varieties of seasonal vegetables and sell to people locally.

She aspires to increase her standard of living through her increased income and lead a better life. Mankuvar is standing on the left hand side in the photograph.

loans.use: to collect and procure different varieties of seasonal vegetables and sell to people locally.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: Ella es una madre de familia que esta preocupada por una de sus hijas debido a que sufre de fuertes dolores e inflamación ocasionado por las muelas de juicio, necesita que le sean extraídas y así recuperar su salud dental. Lamentablemente la señora no cuenta con los recursos suficientes ya que ella es el único sustento de su familia, pues recientemente a su esposo lo liquidaron en la empresa donde trabajaba,
texts.en: She is parent who is concerned about one of her daughters, due to the fact that she suffers exteme pain and inflammation caused by her wisdom teeth. She needs to have them extracted and thereby recover her dental health.
