Unfortunately, she does not have sufficient financial resources, as she is the sole support for her family, as her husband was recently laid-off at the company where he worked.

loans.use: to obtain dental treatment.

loans.name: Rambai's Group

texts.en:
Rambai, 50, standing on the right-hand side in the photograph, is a widow who lives in Korba, a picturesque town located in Chattisgarh, India. Agriculture is the main form of income for most of the small population, and like many, Rambai is also a farmer, with over 12 years of experience. She lives with her son and daughter in a thatched house, owning a bicycle and a TV, too. Her son helps her with the farming. Rambai has only studied until 10th a this mother and farmer considers is being able to educate her daughter to college graduation and, as a result of this, she was able to secure a stable job in a private firm.

However, the financial inputs over the years have always kept her and her family in strain, coupled with a lesser yield this year. So, Rambai along with her group member, would like to avail a loan of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. The money will help Rambai pay for quality saplings, fertilizers, and tools. It would also allow her to expand her cultivation from solely tomatoes and allow crops to be harvested in every alternate month. The increased and regular yield would provide good prices at the markets, and subsequent profits to help this family from much financial strain.

loans.use: to pay for quality saplings, fertilizers, and tools. It will also allow her to expand her cultivation from solely tomatoes and allow crops to be harvested in every alternate month.

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo MUJERES TRABAJADORAS está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, están poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder capacitarse y mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus familias.
Una mujer que se destaca es la Sra. Agustina, quien se dedica a la venta de prendas usadas, comenta que sus ventas han mejorado mucho ya que hoy en día son muy solicitadas las prendas de segunda mano. Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora que pone todo de sí para poder crecer y salir adelante y ayudar a su familia por medio de sus ventas.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas usadas para la venta, y de esa manera poder seguir con sus ventas y cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group Mujeres Trabajadoras is in its first cycle of its women's committee program.  They are putting in their best effort to be able to train and improve their living conditions for themselves and their families.

One woman who stands out is Mrs. Agustina, who makes a living selling used clothing.  She says that her sales have gotten much better now that second-hand clothes have become very popular.  She is a very hard-working and determined woman who puts all of herself into being able to grow and move forward and help her family though her sales.

She asks for this loan to be able to buy used clothing to sell, so she can continue with her sales and meet the demands of her customers as she has been doing.

loans.use: to buy used clothing to sell.

loans.name: Ghasnin's Group

texts.en:
The life of a widow is filled with ups and downs. Ghasnin's life is no different. She is the one standing on the right-hand side in the photograph and she hails from a small village in Korba, Chattisgarh, India.

All she has in life at the moment is her son who is in class 11. A vegetable vendor by profession, Ghasnin earns Rs. 2,500 a month. But she finds it difficult to stock her vegetable stall because she doesn't have much working capital, like most small business owners.

Therefore, she along with her group member, are seeking a loan of 30,000 INR from Kiva's partner Peoples Forum. She will use her portion of the loan amount to purchase more stock of vegetables in bulk.

She points out that vegetables are a basic requirement for all people - so her business is sure to do well and she is confident that she can repay the loan in a prompt manner.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of vegetables in bulk

loans.name: Mujeres Victoriosas Group

texts.es:
El grupo es nuevo, se formó en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que quieren mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de sus seres queridos. Ellas están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, poniendo su mayor esfuerzo para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Sandra quien tiene una surtida mercería, es una mujer muy sacrificada que pone todo de sí, y también trata de tener siempre su negocio bien surtido ya que es lo que más gusta a sus clientes. Sandra a través de su trabajo quiere ayudar a su familia y darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener y evitar que pasen por necesidades. 
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar artículos variados para la venta en su mercería, como ser prendas, calzados, artículos de bazar y demás, para poder seguir dando una buena variedad a sus clientes, lo cual siempre gustan y piden.
texts.en:
The group is new. It was formed in the city of San Lorenzo. They are female heads of family who wish to improve their life conditions and those of their loved ones. They are in the program for the elimination of poverty putting their greatest effort in so as to be able to improve their life conditions.

One of the members is Sandra who has a notions business. She is a very sacrificing woman who puts in her all and also tries to keep her business well stocked since it is what the customers like most. Sandra, through her work, wants to help her family and give them everything that she could not have and avoid that they want for anything.

She requests this loan in order to be able to buy various items for sale in her notions business, such as clothing, footwear, bazaar items, and the rest, in order to continue offering a good variety to her customers who always like it and request it.

loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear, bazaar items, and the rest in order to be able to stock a notions business.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, y comenta que le gustaría ejercer su carrera para poder cumplir sus metas y de esa manera poder ayudar a su familia.
Juan es una persona dedicada que pone su mayor esfuerzo para poder conseguir sus anhelos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Juan is from the city of Carapegua. He is studying a course in nursing, and he says he would like to use his course to be able to fulfill his goals and in this way to be able to help his family.

Juan is a dedicated person who puts in his greatest effort in order to be able to obtain his desires.

He requests this loan in order to be able to pay the fees for his course of study and in this way to be able to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay the fees for his course of study.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married woman with 10 children. She describes herself to be hardworking and she operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for 20 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in climate.

She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy another dairy cow. Her business goal is to buy more high breed dairy cows within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth owns a sari-sari store in front of her house, catering neighbors and local dwellers in her place. She has been doing it so for many years now. She sold merchandise like cooking oil, seasonings, coffee, powdered milk, pouch vinegar, soap, shampoo, eggs, and toiletries. She is married and has one grown child. Her husband has also an income that could help defray the family's expenses.

Aside from operating a sari-sari store, she raises and sold hogs, to have additional source of income. At the moment, she encounters funds shortage to continue operate her business.

Elizabeth has requested a loan to buy groceries for the store and pig feed. In that way, she could able to maintain the stocks of her store and also raises and sold quality hogs. Slowly, she would start to expand and handle her finances wisely.

With her previous loan, she was able to paid back successfully and now she is requesting a new loan to continue boost her both sources of income to become sustainable.

loans.use: to buy groceries for the store and pig feed

loans.name: Zarefa

texts.en:
Zarefa is studying at Al-Quds Open University. She is 22 years old and lives with her parents in Jenin. Zarefas’ family didn’t have enough money to pay the premium for this semester. She is in her final semester and then she will finish university. Zarefa hopes to find a good job and have a better standard of living.

Zarefa is asking Kiva’s partner ALIBDAA for a loan of $1,000 to pay the costs of her education for this semester.

loans.use: to pay the costs of higher education for this semester.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a married woman. She has 1 child. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a good place, and her primary customers are locals. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to have a bigger shop within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado “Divino Niño Jesús” esta trabajando dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, las integrantes de este grupo se unieron para poder ayudarse las unas a las otras, están entusiasmadas en poder capacitarse y mejorar cada día.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Liz, una humilde vendedora, tiene un negocio en el que toda la familia ayuda, ya que es su sostén, tiene una despensa en la que trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano en la mañana y por medio de su negocio tiene los medios para poder ayudar a sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para poder surtir su despensa con todo tipo de productos, como ser verduras, frutas, carne, panificados, enlatados y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The group named "Divino Niño Jesús" ["Divine Child Jesus"] is working in the poverty elimination program. This group's members meet to be able to help one another. They are excited about being able to be trained and improve every day.

One of the members is Ms. Liz, a humble salesperson. She has a business, which the whole family helps, since it is her support. She has a small grocery store in which she works every day from very early in the morning. Through her business, she has the means to be able to help her loved ones.

She requests this loan to be able to stock her grocery store with all types of products such as: vegetables, fruits, meat, baked goods, canned goods, and other things, and thus can continue with her sales as she had been doing.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fruits, meat, baked goods, canned goods, and others.

loans.name: Mujeres Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Mujeres Luchadoras, lleva ese nombre, ya que las integrantes son mujeres luchadoras que se esfuerzan por poder salir adelante, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, esforzándose por crecer y salir adelante.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Maria, quien en su  encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel uno, lo que quiere decir que está en un nivel de pobreza alta, ella tiene una peluquería en la que todos los días trabaja para poder ir superando su situación de pobreza. Ella pone todo de sí para poder crecer y salir adelante por medio de su trabajo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes, como ser tintes, cremas, shampoo, enjuagues y otros, y de esa forma poder seguir con su buen servicio. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder seguir creciendo y mejorando.
texts.en:
The group is called Mujeres Luchadoras. It has this name since the members are tenacious women who make an effort to be able to get ahead. They are part of the program of poverty elimination, making an effort to grow and move forward.

One of the members is Sra. Maria, who in her survey demonstrated a level of poverty at level one, which means that she is in a high level of poverty. She has a hair salon where she works every day to be able to overcome her situation of poverty. She gives it her all to to able to grow and move forward, by means of her work.

She is asking for this loan to be able to buy supplies such as dyes, lotions, shampoo, conditioners and other products, and in this way be able to continue offering a good service to her customers. She is grateful to receive the opportunity to be able to continue growing and improving.

loans.use: to buy beauty salon supplies, such as dyes, lotions, shampoo, conditioners and other things.

loans.name: Rosalba

texts.es:
Rosalba está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, dentro de unos años se ve ejerciendo su profesión y ayudando a los demás.
Al terminar sus estudios quiere especializarse y de esa manera poder incrementar sus conocimientos.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Rosalba is studying Nursing. In a few years, she sees herself practicing her profession and helping others. At the end of her studies, she wants to specialize in her career and improve her knowledge this way. She is requesting a loan to pay for her career's tuition fees, and keep studying as she has been doing so far.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam is a widowed woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be dedicated. She operates a retail business where she sells omena (type of fish), cooking fat, and onions. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a competitive place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more stock of omena and cooking fat. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to cater to her family needs.

loans.use: to buy more stock of omena and cooking fat.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en: Asuncion lives in Estancia, Iloilo where she owns a small restaurant known as “carenderia”.  She has been operating this for 18 years to earn a living and to raised her child. Thus, she has one adult child. Asuncion is asking a loan to operate her business continuously. She needs a bigger amount of loans to buy food ingredients such as pork, vegetables, spices, and cooking oil. She will also need to buy sacks of rice and other part of her loan amount is for motorcycle maintenance. Perhaps, she owns a motorcycle that serves as their service in transporting her goods. In the future, Asuncion wishes to expand her business for their sustainability.

loans.use: to buy  food ingredients such as pork, vegetables, spices, and cooking oil; sacks of rice; and motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Bella is 50 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Bella has a food vending business in the Philippines. Bella requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, rice, fish, spices, hotdog, etc. for her food production business.

Bella has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Bella would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, rice, fish, spices, hotdog, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 43 years old and married with one child. With one child currently in school, Teresita works very hard to provide for them.

Teresita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, eggs, snack foods, biscuits, candies, coffee, etc. to sell.

Teresita has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, eggs, snack foods, biscuits, candies, coffee, etc. 

Teresita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, eggs, snack foods, biscuits, candies, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Gene

texts.en:
Gene  is 31 years old, married with two children.

Gene  works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store.

Gene  has borrowed and paid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 8 years and also earns an income from motorcycle transport.

Gene  aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.en:
Marlyn is 42 years old and married with five children. With one of her children currently in school, Marlyn works very hard to provide for them.

Marlyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marlyn has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, cooking oil, snack foods, eggs, biscuits, detergent soap, etc.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Marlyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Arsenio

texts.es:
Arsenio está estudiando la carrera de contaduría pública, el préstamo que solicita es para los gastos de sus cuotas y también para la compra de materiales de estudios.
Comenta que tiene previsto poder ejercer su profesión y por medio de ella poder abrirse camino en el mundo laboral y profesional. Él es una persona que pone todo de sí para poder crecer y salir adelante.
texts.en: Arsenio is studying the career of Public Accounting. He is requesting a loan to pay for tuition fees and study materials. He comments that he plans to practice his profession and with it to progress in the work and professional world. He is a person who gives his all to progress and move ahead.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and to buy study materials.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es:
Lourdes proviene de una familia muy trabajadora, es arquitecta recibida y además está estudiando posgrado en artes y tecnologías.
Su sueño es tener una gran constructora, además ser una docente reconocida, es por ello que se esta sacrificando y continua estudiando.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma seguir con sus estudios de postgrado. Agradece por la oportunidad que esta recibiendo de poder crecer.
texts.en: Lourdes comes from a very hardworking family. She graduated as an architect and is also studying graduate school in arts and technology. Her dream is to be a great builder, and also to be a known professor. This is why she is working hard and continues with her studies. She is requesting this loan to pay for her career's tuition fees, and in this way to continue with her graduate school. She is grateful for the given opportunity to be able to grow.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Rudy

texts.en: For 15 years, Rudy supports his family by running a sari-sari (variety) store business in Estancia, Iloilo.  He is a married man and has four children; ages 19, 17, 13 and 10 years old. Besides his sari-sari store business, he also raises pigs. Thus, he is asking for a bigger amount of loan to buy grocery stock such as canned goods, noodles, spices, toiletries, chips, candies, biscuits, coffee, sugar and drinks. He will also use the loan to buy feed. In the future, Rudy dreams of having enough capital to operate his business continuously.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, noodles, spices, toiletries, chips, candies, biscuits, coffee, sugar, and drinks in addition to feed for his pigs

loans.name: Kanga

texts.en:
Kanga is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past six years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es:
El grupo se llama Virgen del Carmen está en su ciclo número 14° del programa de comités, a la vez están trabajando dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, el cual es el medio que les permitirá conocer la situación de vida de cada una, y conforme a ello poder seguir esforzándose.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Liz quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la venta de ropas que hace se gana la vida de una manera digna y honesta, y comenta que poco a poco está creciendo gracias a su lucha y sacrificio. Liz se define a si misma como una persona sacrificada que quiere mejorar por su familia y sus seres queridos.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de ropas variadas como jeans  para damas y caballeros, remeras para damas y caballeros, etc. para su posterior venta de ropas, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
The Virgen del Carmen group is in its 14th cycle of the committee program. At the same time they are working through the poverty elimination program which is the way that allows them to learn the life situation of each woman and according to that be able to continue making an effort.

One of the members is Ms. Liz who through the effort and continuous work and the sales of clothing that she makes earns a living in a dignified and honest manner. She says that little by little she is growing thanks to her fight and sacrifice. Liz defines herself as a sacrificed person that wants to improve for her family and loved ones.

She is asking for this loan for the purchase of various clothes such as men's and women's jeans, men's and women's shirts, etc. for her subsequent clothing sales, that will help her set her business plan which will help her improve her income.

loans.use: purchase clothing such as: men's and women's jeans, men's and women's shirts, etc.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
Sonia continua con su carrera de Psicología Enfermería Educacional, comenta que por medio de su carrera quiere poder ayudar a las demás personas, es por ello que pone su mayor esfuerzo para poder lograrlo, con su préstamo anterior pudo pagar las cuotas de su carrera, lo cual le fue de mucha ayuda.
Hoy pide este nuevo préstamo para poder pagar de vuelta las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: Sonia continues studying Educational Nursing Psychology. She comments that with her career, she wants to help others. This is why she puts her biggest effort to achieve it. With her previous loan she was able to pay for her career's tuition fees, which was very helpful. Today, she is requesting a new loan to pay again for tuition fees, and in this way to continue with her studies as she has been doing so far.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Celso

texts.es:
Celso comenta que proviene de una familia trabajadora, su madre es docente y en todo momento lo acompaña en todos sus proyectos.
A la par que estudia también trabaja, el cual le permite poder cubrir con los gastos de su carrera. Su inspiración es su familia por ellos cada día trata de ser mejor.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.
texts.en: Celso comments that he comes from a hardworking family. His mother is a teacher, and is always at his side in all his projects. Besides studying, he is also working, and this allows him to pay for his career's expenses. His inspiration is his family; for them he tries every day to be better. He is requesting this loan to pay for his career's tuition fees, and in this way to be able to continue with his studies.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Milagros works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling brooms in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling coconut wine. Milagros is borrowing PHP 19,000 through NWTF to buy more brooms to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Milagros has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more brooms to sell

loans.name: Mujeres En Marcha Group

texts.es: María, tiene 60 años de edad, es soltera por viudez, tiene 11 hijos y reside en una aldea del municipio Monquecagua de Intibucá junto a tres de sus hijos y dos nietos. Toda su vida se ha dedicado al hogar y a la agricultura. Sus cultivos son maíz, frijol, siendo el de mayor ingreso el cultivo de papas, el cual vende en la misma zona en el mercado local.  Además para generar otros ingresos también vende lácteos (cuajada). Ha decidido solicitar el cuarto ciclo de préstamo en ODEF y en forma grupal con el propósito de comprar abonos y fungicidas para sus cultivos de papas y leche para la elaboración de cuajada. Ella tiene como meta seguir mejorando el cultivo para mejorar su condición de vida y mejorar su casa. El grupo se llama Mujeres en Marcha, integrado por dos miembros que se dedican a la agricultura y residen en la misma zona. El préstamo grupal es por 18,000 lempiras para comprar abonos y fungicidas para aplicar a sus cultivos y compra de insumos para otras actividades. En la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda esta María y a la derecha Mirna.
texts.en: Maria is 60 years old. She is a widow. She has 11 children and lives in a village of the municipality of Monquecagua of Intibuca, together with three of her children and two grandchildren. She has worked her whole life in her household and in agriculture. Her crops are corn and beans, and her main income comes from cultivating potatoes, which she sells in her same area at the local market. Besides generating other income, she also sells dairy (curd). She has decided to request a loan in ODEF for a fourth cycle loan as a group with the purpose of buying manure and fungicides for her potato crops and milk to produce curd. Her goal is to continue improving her crops in order to improve her life condition and her house. The group's name is "Mujeres en Marcha" (Women on the March), comprised by two members who work in agriculture and live in the same area. The group loan is for 18,000 lempiras to buy manure and fungicides to apply to her crops, and to buy inputs for other activities. On the picture one can see Maria on the left side and Mirna on the right.

loans.use: to buy manure and fungicides to cultivate potatoes, and to buy inputs to make dairy products.

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.en:
Bibiana is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Bibiana is 41 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Bibiana has a fruit and vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Bibiana requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell.

Bibiana has been in this business for 21 years. In the future, Bibiana would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Iliya

texts.en:
Iliya is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Iliya has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Iliya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Iliya can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Iliya will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Iliya is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to buy maize grinding machines.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Matea

texts.en:
Matea is 51 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Matea is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Matea has been in pig fattening for 5 years and also earns additional income from selling ready to wear.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
For the past four years, Marilou has owned a fruits and vegetables stall, situated inside the market place in the rural town of Bilar, Bohol. She sells fruits like mangoes, bananas, and vegetables like patola (gourd), squash, young corn, tomatoes, and green-leaf vegetables.

She faces challenges in her livelihood. The lack of capital holds back her business.
Marilou would like to buy more stocks of fruits, vegetables and canned goods. Thus, attract more buyers to improve her daily earnings. It enables her to provide the needs of her family and continue to expand her business to become more sustainable in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fruits, vegetables and canned goods

loans.name: Emprendedores De Coclan Group

texts.es: José, de 26 años de edad, está casado, tiene 2 hijos, vive en el municipio de Jesús de Otoro, Intibucá junto a su esposa y sus hijos. Él se dedica al cultivo y venta de viveros para café desde hace 4 años en su casa, lo cual ayuda a todos sus clientes que cultivan café en la finca. Él solicita un préstamo en forma grupal, el cual invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes, bolsas, preventivos, foliares e insecticidas para la elaboración y cultivo de viveros para café. Tiene como meta mejorar su economía, darles una mejor educación a sus hijos y seguir creciendo en su negocio. El grupo se llama Emprendedores de Coclan, formado por 4 miembros, quienes se dedican diversas actividades como ser venta de vivero de café, elaboración y venta de pan, pulpería y venta de calzado. Todos viven en la misma comunidad y solicitan la cantidad de  43,000 Lempiras para invertir en sus negocios. En la fotografía se identifican de la siguiente manera: a la izquierda de pie esta José  y Agat a la derecha, sentadas están: Belkys a la izquierda y María a la derecha.
texts.en:
José is 26 years old. He is married with 2 children and he lives in the Municipality of Jesús de Otoro, Intibucá with his wife and children. Four years ago, he began producing and preparing coffee nurseries out of his home, helping all his clients who grow coffee in his farm. He is asking for this group loan to invest in fertilizers, bags, fungicides, foliar feed and insecticides for production and cultivation in coffee nurseries plots. His goal is to improve his financials, to provide his children with a better education and to continue growing his business.
This group is called 'Emprendedores de Coclan' and it's composed of 4 members, who work on different activities, such as coffee nurseries, bread making and selling, grocery store and shoe retail selling.
All of them live in the same community and they are asking for 43,000 Lempiras to invest in their businesses. They are shown in the picture as follows: standing up, left, José. right, Agat; sitting down, left Belkys, right María.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, bags, foliar feed, fungiside, insecticides, for production and cultivation in nurseries plots that are for sale

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door to door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. In addition she also operates a tailoring business that earns her another source of income.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 20,000 she wants to purchase a stock of new clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase a stock  of new clothes for resale

loans.name: Rida

texts.en: Rida is a housewife with five children residing in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband is in the business of repairing automobiles for 5 years. Initially he used to work at a workshop for a owner, but now he has started his own automobile repair business and it is running well. He thinks that by investing a little more in his business, he could gain much. Therefore he wanted to buy more stocks of automobile parts and deliver it at several locations. Thus his wife applied for the loan so to help her husband.  Futhermore Rida pays her regards to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to invest in her husband's automobile repair business.

loans.name: Thinu Mwanzo Mpya Women Group

texts.en:
Esther is the name of the lady raising her hand in the photo.She is a member of Thinu Mwanzo Mpya Women Group. She is fifty three years old, married and a mother of three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from the training especially enterprise development.

She operates a general retail shop where she sells commodities like sugar, salt, tea, soap, cooking fat and other household items. She is borrowing Kiva loan to buy more household items hence add stock. This will increase her income to enable her provide basic necessities to her family e.g food and shelter.

Esther is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. She promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy household items hence add stock to her general retail shop and earn more income.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a married man with 1 child. He describes himself to be opportunistic. He operates a cyber café where he offers internet browsing, photocopying, type setting services. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His primary customers are locals.

He describes his biggest business challenge to be power outages. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy photocopy papers and other cyber café items. He hopes that in the future, he will have a better cyber café.

loans.use: to buy photocopy papers and other cyber café items

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is 47 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Antonia is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Antonia has been farming vegetables for 8 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Criselda is 58 years old and widowed with seven children.

Criselda is in the agricultural business, poultry in the Philippines. Criselda requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her poultry business.

Criselda has been in poultry for 5 years now and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Criselda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and vaccines for her poultry business.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is 37 years old, married with four children.

Elsie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Elsie has borrowed and paid 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 2 years and also earns an income from selling purified drinking water.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Elsie aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Oldemar

texts.es: Oldemar  tiene la edad de 59 años, está casado   y vive con  la esposa y dos   hijos   actualmente. El crédito lo quiere para la compra de unas vacas de doble propósito  .El espera poder obtener más leche y queso para vender a los negocios y vecinos y engordar las crías  y venderlos con el peso ideal y  así tener mayores ingresos económicos. El espera en un futuro brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida y una mayor estabilidad económica, y de poder seguir creciendo. Es el primer préstamo que recibido de FUDECOSUR. El no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Oldemar is 59 years old. He is married and he lives with his wife and two children. He wants to use this loan to buy a pair of dual purpose cows. He hopes to be able to get more milk and cheese to sell to other businesses and neighbors, fatten the babies and sell them at the right weight to increase his income.
In the future, he hopes to provide his family with a better quality of life and better financial stability and to be able to continue to grow. This is his first loan with FUDECOSUR. He wasn't able to obtain a loan from any state bank, but FUDECOSUR has granted this loan without any trouble and at a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to buy two heifers.

loans.name: Lesby Yamileth

texts.es: Lesby, de 27 años de edad, tiene 2 hijos, vive con sus hijos y su esposo en casa de su madre en el municipio del Progreso, Yoro. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de niño, pantalones de mujer, ropa interior, sandalias y relojes, esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulante desde hace 5 años, lo que le ha generado ingresos para su familia. Ella está solicitando la cantidad de 10,000 Lempiras que utilizará para comprar más blusas, pantalones, sandalias, relojes, y ropa de niños para aumentar su inventario y poder ofrecer más productos a sus clientes. Su sueño es tener un local propio para el negocio y brindarles a sus hijos la educación que se merecen.
texts.en: Lesby is 27 years old. She lives with her children and her husband at her mother's house in the Municipality of Progreso, Yoro. She sells children's clothing, women's slacks, underwear, sandals and watches. She's been selling door to door for 5 years, and she's been able to generate an income for his family out of it. She is asking for a loan for 10,000 Lempiras to buy blouses, slacks, sandals, watches and children's clothing to increase her stock and be able to offer more products to her customers. Her dream is to own a store and be able to provide her children with the education they deserve.

loans.use: to buy blouses, slacks, sandals, watches and children's clothing to resell.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married woman with three children, all of whom attends school. She lives her own house that neither has electricity or piped water.

She has operated a butcher shop business for the past ten years, selling meat goat. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and transportation in her business.
With the loan, she wants to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goats to slaughter and get meat for resale

loans.name: Hekuran

texts.en: Hekuran wants to buy items used in his construction trade and for this he needs your help. From his activity he makes approximately $4650/year and his wife receives a disability pension and some assistance in the total of $156.

loans.use: to buy items used in his profession, such as plaster, paints, gypsum, etc.

loans.name: Yahaya

texts.en:
Yahaya is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Yahaya has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Yahaya would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Yahaya can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Yahaya will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Yahaya is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest.

loans.name: Emprendedoras En Accion Group

texts.es: Ana María es una mujer emprendedora madre de dos hijos ya mayores,se dedica a la confección y venta de polos para damas  caballeros y niños desde hace ocho años en su taller de costura donde su esposo y su hija menor la apoyan con el trabajo diario, desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar ya que su padre era anciano y se encontraba delicado de salud ella tuvo que hacerse cargo de los gastos que suscitaban,el préstamo que solicitó lo invertirá en la compra de materiales como telas hilos y demás para campaña navideña.Ella se siente feliz y agradecida de saber que hay personas como los inversionistas Kiva que la apoyan sin conocerla y pide que sigan ayudando a personas que desean salir adelante.
texts.en:
Ana María is an entrepreneur. She is a mother of two children of age and she is a seamstress. She's made polo shirts of men, ladies and children for eight years at her sewing shop where her husband and youngest daughter help her with the daily work load. She had to work since she was very young as her father was an elderly man and of ill health. She had to take care of the household expenses.
She will use this loan to buy materials such as fabric, thread and others for the holiday season. She is happy and grateful to know that the are people such as Kiva's investors who support her without knowing her personally and she ask people to continue to help other people who simple wish to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials, such as fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Elibeth

texts.es: Elibeth es una mujer muy esforzada que se dedica a la actividad cafetalera. Solicita un préstamo de quinientos cuarenta mil colones (₡ 540 000), para la compra de almacigo y fertilizantes, esto con el fin de realizar la resiembra de su finca, que le permitirá cambiar la variedad de las plantas, lo cual generará un aumento en la productividad de dicho negocio.
texts.en: Elibeth is a very hard-working woman who works growing coffee. She is requesting a loan of five hundred forty thousand Colons (540,000 CRC), to buy young coffee plants and fertilizers with the goal of replanting her plantation. This will allow her to change the variety of her plants, which will generate an increase in the productivity of her business.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies to plant coffee.

loans.name: Muhiba

texts.en: Muhiba was born in 1994.  She is young and smart. Muhiba is single and she lives with parents. She is a student in the 4th course. Muhiba studies well and she dreams of being a good specialist in the future. She is also a dressmaker. Muhiba sews national women's dresses but her income is not enough to pay for the university tuition. So, she is asking for a loan of 7,000 Somoni with this aim. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
As the married mother of six children, Esmeralda works hard to support her family.

Esmeralda runs a meat-vending stall and also earns additional income from food vending. She is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional meat to sell.

Esmeralda has been sustaining her business through nine previous loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional meat to sell in her meat stall.

loans.name: Mirza

texts.en:
Mirza is 47 years old. He lives in Akhmeta with his wife. Mirza is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has bee-hives with bee-colonies and produces honey. In addition, they have a cow and produce cheese. 
Mirza wants to expand his husbandry business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables him to get a loan of 2000 GEL. With the received credit he will purchase piglets and will raise them to resell at a good price. This will give him a good income and will expand his husbandry business in future. Mirza is experienced in this field and awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise and sell .

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: Doña Martina, de 60 años de edad, vive en una colonia suburbana de la ciudad de Gracias Lempira junto a su esposo y uno de sus hijos. Ella tiene varios años de dedicarse al cultivo de granos básicos de maíz, frijoles y café. Con esta actividad ayuda a cubrir gastos del hogar. Ha solicitado varios préstamos a la institución, actualmente solicita otro por 7,000 Lempiras para invertir en la compra de fertilizantes para su cultivo de maíz y frijol. Este préstamo le ayudara a mejorar la finca y sacar buenas cosechas. La producción la vende en la zona del municipio de Gracias Lempira.   Su meta es seguir ampliando el cultivo lo que le permitirá obtener buenos ingresos para mejorar su calidad de vida familiar.
texts.en:
Martina is 60 years old. She lives in a suburban colony in the city of Gracias Lempira with her husband and one of her children. She's been growing basic grains such as corn, beans and coffee for several years. She helps to cover her household expenses with this activity.
She's asked for several loans for his partner and she is currently asking for 7,000 Lempiras to buy fertilizers to grow corn and beans. This loan will help her to improve her farm and grow better crops. She sells her production around the area in the municipality of Gracias Lempira.
Her goal to continue to expand her crops which will allow her to obtain a better income and improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers to grow corn and beans.

loans.name: Pendo

texts.en:
Pendo is a married woman with two children, each of whom is too young to attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity or piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past one year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Mapendo Kakungwe Group

texts.fr: Vendeuse de produits divers depuis son jeune âge, Esther admet avoir appris cette activité à travers l'expérience de ses parents. Seul l'insuffisance de fonds propres constitue le plus grand obstacle à son affaire commerciale mais elle reste confiante qu'une fois son capital renforcé, cela aura un impact positif sur sa rentabilité. Sur photo, Esther toute souriante est assisse sur une chaise contrairement à Marie-Claire, l'autre membre du groupe MAPENDO KAKUNGWE, qui est un peu plus brune et en position accroupie.
texts.en: A seller of various goods since she was young, Esther acknowledges she learned about this business from her parents’ experiences. Her greatest obstable is only a dearth of funds for her business, but she remains confident that once her capital is bolstered, her profitability will see a positive impact. In the photo, Esther is the one with a big smile and sitting in a chair opposite Marie-Claire, the other member of the group MAPENDO KAKUNGWE who is a bit more brunette and crouching.

loans.use: to buy wholesale dairy products seasonally and various other goods

loans.name: Suzana

texts.en: Suzana is a 29-year-old single woman who started working as a secretary five years ago to help cover the expenses of her family of five. She gained experience in this field from her academic studies. She is a hard-working, ambitious person who is trying hard to improve her family's living conditions. Today, she is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to pay for her brother's necessary medical treatments. Suzana hopes to continue providing her family with good living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for her brother's necessary medical treatments.

loans.name: Virgen De Fatima Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “VIRGEN DE FATIMA” conformada por 05 socios con deseos de superarse. Este es el caso de Sara de 37 años de edad conviviente con un hijo dependiente. Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas como arroz con pollo tallarines y muchas variedades más. Su mayor deseo es de poder ampliar su negocio. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de arroz aceite pollo y condimentos. El grupo “virgen de Fátima” está agradecido con las personas de kiva que hicieron posible este crédito, pues le permite seguir mejorando. Sara es la tercera del lado del lado derecho.
texts.en:
This is the new group "Virgen de Fatima" composed of five members with a desire to succeed.

This is the case of Sara, 37, living with a dependent son. She makes a living selling meals such as chicken and rice; pasta; and many more varieties. Her greatest wish is to be able to expand her business.

She requested a loan in order to buy rice, oil, chicken, and condiments.

The group "Virgen de Fatima" is grateful to the Kiva people who make this loan possible, since it allows it to continue improving.

Sara is the third from the right side.

loans.use: to buy rice, oil, chicken, and condiments.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Don Pablo, de 50 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene 2 hijos y reside junto a su esposa e hijos en el municipio del Progreso, Yoro. Él se dedica actualmente a la venta de pescado. Lleva 15 años de tener este negocio donde ofrece a sus clientes los productos de Tilapia negra y roja. Anteriormente él se dedicaba a la venta de coco rallado pero considero que la venta de pescado le iba resultar mejor. Ha solicitado varios préstamos para sostener el negocio, actualmente solicita la cantidad de 11,000 Lempiras para la compra de  más pescado para mantener su negocio surtido y aumentar las ventas e ingresos. Su meta es mejorar como persona a fin de ser mejor administrador, ayudar a su familia para que este mejor económicamente y que su negocio siga aumentando.
texts.en:
Pablo is 50 years old. He lives with his wife and two children in the municipality of Progreso, Yoro. Pablo sells fish. He's worked on this business for 15 years where he sells red and black tilapia. He used to sell shredded coconut, but he figured selling fish would be a better investment. 
He's asked for several loans before to support his business and he is asking now for 11,000 Lempiras to buy more fish to keep a good selection in his business and to increase sales. 
His goal is to be a better person and become a better administrator, to support his family financially and to continue growing his business.

loans.use: to buy more fish to increase his selection as well as his sales.

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna is a married woman and she has five kids. She is living with her husband and kids in Jabaa’, near Jenin city. Her family's standard of living is very hard and she hopes to have a better life for her kids in the near future.

Muna has applied for a loan in order to purchase a boiler so it can keep water warm during the winter semester.

loans.use: to purchase a boiler in order to keep water warm during the winter semester.

loans.name: Muungano Group

texts.fr: Grâce à l'assistance de sa belle-mère, Sakina s'est lancé dans la vente de chaussures d'occasion en 1992. Avec l'expérience acquise, elle est en mesure de subvenir tant soit peu aux besoins de son foyer. Elle s'approvisionne chaque deux semaines et réalise un gain de trois cent cinquante dollars le mois. Ce crédit sera orienté dans la vente de chaussures d'occasion ainsi que des tissus. Sur photo, Sakina  est en troisième position (de gauche à droite) portant une robe rose.
texts.en: Thanks to help from her sister-in-law, Sakina got started selling secondhand shoes in 1992. With experience in hand, she is in a position to meet to a small degree the needs of her household. She gets her supplies every two week and realizes a gain of $350 each month. This loan will be applied to selling used shoes, as well as fabrics. In the photo, Sakina appears third from the left and is wearing a pink dress.

loans.use: to purchase used shoes to resell and some fabrics

loans.name: Union  Por El Progreso Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “UNION POR EL PROGRESO” está conformada por 07 socias entusiastas. Este es el caso de JESUSA de 58 años de edad, viuda con 01 hijo.jesusa es una madre empeñosa que con mucho esfuerzo y dedicación trata de sacar adelante a su familia. Ella se dedica a la venta de emoliente. El deseo de jesusa es ampliar su negocio. Solicito el crédito para la compra de azúcar limones linaza. El grupo “unión por el progreso” agradece a Kiva por la ayuda brindada.jesusa es la tercera del lado izquierdo viste chaleco azul.
texts.en: “UNION POR EL PROGRESO” communal bank is made up of seven enthusiastic women. One of them is Jesusa, who is a 58-year-old widow with one child. Jesusa is a hardworking mother who strives to provide for her family and is very dedicated. She works selling herbal teas. Jesusa's desire is to expand her business. She requested the loan in order to buy sugar, limes, and flaxseed. “UNION POR EL PROGRESO” group thanks Kiva for helping. Jesusa is the third from the left, wearing a blue vest.

loans.use: to buy sugar, limes, and flaxseed.

loans.name: Dhahabu

texts.en: Dhahabu is a married woman with 3 children. She operates a retail business where she sells mobile phones and accessories. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 25,000 loan to buy more stock of mobile phone accessories. Her business goal is to have a bigger business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living conditions. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of mobile phone accessories

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en: Miriam is a 24-year-old single woman from Lebanon who lives with her parents and siblings. Her father is the family's main source of income and he works very hard to always fulfill their needs and provide a good lifestyle. Sara is focusing on her university and she also works in a pharmacy for additional income. Today, in order to pay her university fees, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l. She says that her goal is to achieve a higher position and be able to support her family members financially.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a married woman. She has 7 children. She operates a farm where she grows coffee, bananas and other crops. Her business is located in a fertile area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be climate change. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Solidaria Mujer El Eden Group

texts.es: Flor María es una mujer trabajadora que se dedica al comercio de Zapatos, Cosméticos, Ropa, Perfumería. Madre de 3 hijos dejo su natal Nicaragua para poder darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida, es así como emigra a Costa Rica y inicia su negocio de ventas. Actualmente tiene varios clientes a los que pretende darle este servicio, por lo cual necesita comprar mercadería para realizar esta actividad, Está solicitando un préstamo para realizar dicha compra de productos y continuar dando Educación a su familia.El Grupo que pertenece Flor Maria esta conformado por dos socias mas que van invertir en la misma actividad comercial.
texts.en:
Flor María is a hard-working woman who sells shoes, cosmetics, clothing and perfumes. She is a mother of three children and she left her native Nicaragua to be able to provide her children with a better quality of life. For that reason, she emigrated to Costa Rica and stated her business.
She has several clients who seek her services, so she needs to buy more merchandise to keep up with this activity. She is asking for a loan to buy these products and continue to send her children to school. Flor Maria is part of a group composed of two other members who will invest in this same activity.

loans.use: to make her retail business stronger.

loans.name: Twikenure Group

texts.fr:
Chantal  fait partie du Twikenure et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 35 ans et est mariée à Desiré ,un menuisier. Ensemble ils ont 5 enfants âgés de 8 à 16ans.

Elle fait le commerce de sorgho. 

Elle est à son vingt-troisième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  une grande de sorgho à revendre pour gagner plus. 


Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait voir  ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Chantal is part of the group Twikenure and lives in Gitega. She is 35 years old and married to Desiré, a furniture maker. Together they have five children, from 8 to 16 years old.

Chantal does commerce in sorghum.

She is on her 23rd loan at Turame. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a large amount of sorghum to resell, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to see her children educated.

loans.use: to purchase sorghum to resell, so as to earn more

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en:
Abubakar is a maize farmer and Babban Gona member. Anticipating a good harvest this season, Abubakar has the opportunity to attain yields of up to 8 Metric Tonnes of Maize per Hectare of Land, 5.5 times that of the average Nigerian maize farmer. 
Before joining Babban Gona, Abubakar would have had to sell his maize at harvest, a period when maize prices are at their lowest in the market, to meet his immediate cash needs such as food and clothing. Thanks to Babban Gona’s support Abubakar can store his maize and sell it at a future date for up to 37% higher than the market price at harvest. 
As a Babban Gona member, Abubakar will benefit from marketing support that could see him generate earnings of up to $2000 per hectare of land. Abubakar is thankful that he now has the opportunity to improve the life of his children and family and looks forward to using his additional earnings to ensure that all his children get a post secondary education.

loans.use: to buy food and clothing, eliminating pressure to sell maize for low prices at harvest

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en:
Musarat is very sharp and confident woman, aged 53 mother, of seven, lives in Rawalpindi ,Pakistan. Musarat is also a house wife. She manages both things in parallel, as with the chores, she manages to run her very own clothing boutique and is in this line for six years. She is very choosy and her designer wardrobe is loved by the ladies in her area.

She loves experimenting with new things and ideas which turn out favorable for her and her business. This time Musarat wanted to complete a bridal dress order and invest a little amount in her boutique for various purposes. Therefore she applied for a 50000 PKR loan from Kiva and BRAC Pakistan. She is thankful towards both.

loans.use: to invest in her boutique clothing shop .
